story:
Short Summary

Short Story Day Africa is a literacy project and a celebration of fiction's short form. We aim to get people of all ages reading, writing and sharing stories. In order to do this, we're running writing competitions with some fantastic prizes: an online writing workshop, for example, and book vouchers, all sponsored by organisations and people passionate about literacy and books. We've been overwhelmed by the support our project has received. Many authors writing for adult, kids and young adults have generously donated signed copies of their books to giveaway. What we need now is money to post those books.

We're not asking for a lot. Just $700 to pay for postage and packaging. The entire project  is run without funding by passionate volunteers. People who love African fiction and want to help create a global platform for it. We've done the work. We've reached the kids, the readers and the writers, we just need a little help.

By helping us, you get to continue to read the stories of some of Africa's most talented writers on our website, FREE! And, no matter how much you contribute, we'll credit you on our thank you page. We can't offer much more than that, but if you fund us, we get to keep going for another year, opening up avenues for stories you may never hear otherwise.

All funds raised go towards postage and packaging, even if we don't reach our goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out about Short Story Day Africa. Like our Facebook Page, follow us on twitter @shortstoryAFR, and let people know about our campaign to raise a money postage. Share, share, share.

story:
Who is Mickey Malone?

This spring, from author Lisa Fantino, a new view on crime with legs to die for. "Shrouded in Pompei," introducing the Mickey Malone Mysteries.

Why I need you:

Did you know that an excellent P.R. campaign can make a good book great?  Did you also know that a great publicist can often earn more than a lawyer?  I should know, right?  But they are worth every penny if it helps spread the word about a new author and a new mystery crime series.

I am quite proud that my memoir "Amalfi Blue - lost & found in the south of Italy" has spent a year on the Top 100 Kindle books on Italy bestseller's list but a new novel needs big time P.R. help.

By the way, if each person reading this buys just the ebook, it will be a slam dunk to meet the one month goal and anything beyond that will be pure bliss.

For each $5000 over the goal, I can tack on another month of promo and publicity...it would mean the world to me!


What I Need & What You Get

Meeting the funding goal only gets me one month of publicity.  For each $5000 over the goal, I can tack on another month.  It would be nice to get three months of great P.R. to launch the Mickey Malone Mysteries.  Watch the video here and you'll see why.

The funds will be used for:

  • Hiring the best P.R. firm to spread the word
  • Launching a book tour
  • Creating promo materials to market "Shrouded in Pompei"

And in return, you get an advanced copy of the book, depending on your perk level, my undying gratitude and that warm & fuzzy feeling you get as a patron of the arts.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Please spread the word & make some noise about the campaign
  • Remind people to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.  No registration required either.

Just pick your perk, or no perk, and contribute as much as you can...even a buck will help!

Suggested price points are only starting minimums.  You can pledge higher than stated.

Each of you has my heartfelt thanks,

Lisa Fantino

story:
Chris Eldin was an aspiring middle grade author whose life took a tragic turn and ended in 2012.  She was active in the writing community, helping dozens of fellow authors promote their books.  She was a loving mother and a champion of young adult fiction. To those of us who knew her and want to memorialize her, she was a friend.

We’re launching an annual fellowship in Chris’s honor, one dedicated to middle grade fiction (ages 8 to 12), the genre she specialized in.  And since she was unpublished at the time of her death, we’re restricting the fellowship to previously unpublished writers.  It’s what she would have wanted.

The idea is this: writers who have never before published a middle grade novel are invited to submit the first 5000 words of their work-in-progress, along with a synopsis.  We’ll select finalists, and young adult author Louise Hawes will choose a winner.  With your help the winner will receive $1000 and a crystal trophy.

Who are we?  We’re the editors and friends of The Lascaux Review.  We’re a group consisting of writers and other industry professionals.  We’re the people who want to keep Christine Eldin’s name alive.

And we’ve got perks to award in exchange for donations.  They’re tallied in the sidebar, but here’s some additional information:

1.  The books are all autographed. They were donated personally by their respective authors.

2.  When Travis Erwin says he’ll eat a piece of lettuce in your honor, on video, while proclaiming your name to all the universe within his periphery, you need to genuflect in gratitude, because to Travis lettuce is the devil.

3.  For more information about Erica Orloff's writing class visit her site.

4.  All donors will be listed on the Lascaux Review donate page.

Since the fundraiser is now underway, and since we have your undivided attention, we might as well announce that fellowship submissions are being accepted at this time:

That’s about it.  Complete information about the contest can be found at eldinfellowship.org.  If you have any questions write to Stephen Parrish or Wendy Russ at lascauxreview at gmail dot com.  We’ll answer them immediately.  If you’re hesitant, read the eulogy Steve wrote.  Then come back and help us honor someone whose name deserves to live forever.

Thank you for your help.

story:
So I Said to My Anxiety by Jessica Victoria is a graphic book about anxiety. Each page has an anxious thought and a more rational thought underneath it.

I recently had to let my publisher go abruptly. Though he gave me all the rights to my book at no cost, I've been faced with the challenge of finishing it off and financing the rest of it. Your contribution, no matter how big or small, will be much appreciated!

  • Funding will go towards the formatting and printing of this book.

  • If you donate $35 or more, you will be one of the first to have this book in your hands!

  • Even if I don't reach my entire goals, the funds raised will still help towards the funding of the book.

  • You can also help by sharing this campaign with your friends and family!

story:
WAS IST SIMPOL?

 

SIMPOL:  SImultaneous POLicy .... eine Strategie der Gemeinsamkeit und Gleichzeitigkeit. 

SIMPOL verpflichtet die Regierungen in allen Ländern gleichzeitig, weltweit eine Politikänderung umzusetzen, damit keine benachteiligt oder zu Unrecht begünstigt wird.

Der Gedanke der Notwendigkeit gleichzeitiger souveräner staatlicher Maßnahmen ist selbst keine neue Idee - es ist die Grundlage von Verträgen und Initiativen der Vereinten Nationen, dass bei bestimmten Problemen wie Abrüstung nichts getan werden kann, bis alle wichtigen Akteure sich auf einen gemeinsamen Zeitplan einigen Lösungen umsetzen.

Neu bei SIMPOL ist jedoch, dass Bürger, die die Simultaneous Policy (Simpol) "übernehmen", die Formulierung der globalen Politik selbst in die Hand nehmen.

SIMPOL kurz erklärt bei wikipedia

Haben Sie sich jemals gefragt, warum die Regierungen globale Probleme wie Klimawandel, Wohlstandsungleichheit und Massenmigration nicht lösen können? Aber haben Sie jemals darüber nachgedacht, dass Regierungen nicht auf diese Probleme reagieren wollen, sondern dass sie dies nicht können? Ihr Bedürfnis, ihre Volkswirtschaften für internationales Kapital und Investoren attraktiv zu halten, macht es ihnen unmöglich, die Gesellschaft oder die Umwelt in den Vordergrund zu stellen. Was wäre, wenn Sie helfen könnten, Regierungen vom Wettbewerb um Kapital zu befreien, damit sie für unsere Zukunft zusammenarbeiten können? Was wäre, wenn Sie Teil einer Bewegung sein könnten, die es uns ermöglicht, unsere Stimmen auf völlig neue Weise zu nutzen, um die Regierungen zur Zusammenarbeit zu bewegen?

SIMPOL heißt: Nicht zu versuchen, ein Problem zu Zeit zu lösen, sondern gemeinsam mehrere Probleme gleichzeitig angehen, dass sich daraus keine Nachteile für irgendein Land ergeben.

The SIMPOL-Solution ist eines dieser seltenen Bücher, die nicht nur die Ursachen für unsere derzeitige Unfähigkeit, globale Probleme zu lösen, beschreiben, sondern gleichzeitig auch konkrete Lösungen und neue Wege anbieten. Die SIMPOL-Kampagne existiert bereits! Helfen Sie uns, nicht nur dieses Buch auf deutsch zu veröffentlichen, sondern eine bessere Zukunft zu ermöglichen. Es liegt in unserer Hand!  Hier können wir tatsächlich etwas bewirken!

Hier ein paar wichtige Links:

  • Eine Leseprobe (Einleitung) kann hier runtergeladen werden.
  • Die englischsprachige Ausgabe des Buches finden Sie hier.
  • Die deutsche SIMPOL Kampagne finden Sie hier.
  • Ein Interview mit John Bunzl finden Sie hier.

 

DIE AUTOREN

 

John Bunzl ist Direktor eines internationalen Textilunternehmens, Schriftsteller und internationaler Vorkämpfer mit einer einfachen und starken Vision für wirksamere globale Zusammenarbeit. Seit über einem Jahrzehnt hat er mit politischen Entscheidungsträgern und Politikern, Wissenschaftlern und Nichtregierungsorganisationen, Aktivisten und Bürgern auf der ganzen Welt zusammengearbeitet, um eine effektivere Zusammenarbeit zu fördern. Im Jahr 2000 gründete John die International Simultaneous Policy Organization (ISPO) und startete die Simultaneous Policy (Simpol) Kampagne. John schreibt regelmäßig Beiträge für die Huffington Post und hat auf verschiedenen TEDx-Veranstaltungen gesprochen. Er hat SIMPOL auch dem Weltsozialforum, der Welthandelsorganisation, der Schumacher Society und verschiedenen Universitäten einschließlich der London School of Economics vorgestellt.

Nick Duffell ist ein Psychotherapeut, Trainer und Psychohistoriker mit langjähriger Erfahrung als Moderator in der Führungsentwicklung. Er hat mehrere Bücher veröffentlicht. Sein The Making of Them (2000) fand breite Anerkennung, und sein 2004 erschienenes Buch Wounded Leaders, das eine herausfordernde psychologische Analyse der britischen politischen Szene liefert, schlägt immer noch Wellen. Nick und seine Frau Helena gründeten 1996 das Center for Gender Psychology und verfassten gemeinsam das beliebte Buch Sex, Love und Dangers of Intimacy.

 

Stimmen zum Buch 

„Es ist ambitioniert und provokativ. Kann es funktionieren? Das ist sicherlich einen ernsten Versuch wert“.  - Noam Chomsky 

„Ich musste zustimmen und nicken, bis mir der Nacken wehtat. Seit Jahren habe ich kein Buch gelesen, dem ich so tief und durchgehend zustimme und von dem ich so intensiv das Gefühl habe, dass dies Botschaften sind, die die Welt hören muss. Die Klarheit, Einfachheit und existenzielle Wichtigkeit dieses Buches stehen außer Frage. Ich bitte alle, es zu lesen, und andere zu ermutigen, dasselbe zu tun.“ Prof. Simon Anholt Gründer von „Good Country“, Good Country Index und Global Vote „Die Simpol-Lösung“ ist ein ermutigender, weil umsetzungsorientierter und pragmatischer erster Schritt in Richtung einer Weltordnungs-Plattform. Eine voll funktionierende Global Governance ist vermutlich noch sehr viel weiter entfernt, doch die Simpol-Lösung beinhaltet Handlungsschritte, die unternommen werden können und in vielen Fällen bereits unternommen wurden, um ein wachsendes Netzwerk aus international abgestimmten und vereinheitlichten Rahmenvereinbarungen zu entwickeln. Damit ist die Simpol Lösung etwas, das wahre Kosmopoliten, frustriert über die derzeitige Unerreichbarkeit einer voll funktionalen Weltregierung, heute bereits vorantreiben können, um so zumindest die wichtigsten ihrer Träume und Visionen zu realisieren. Das ist das Beste, was wir derzeit haben, das Ähnlichkeiten mit einem echten und funktionalen Welt-Regierungssystem aufweißt." - Ken Wilber, Bewusstseinstheoretiker, Autor von „Die Integrale Vision“ 

 „Ein mutiges und dringend benötigtes Buch. Es lenkt den Blick auf den Kern des Problems: ‚Wir können die Probleme der Welt nicht mit dem gleichen Denken lösen, das sie hervorgebracht hat‘. Das hat Einstein gesagt, und Bunzl und Duffell weisen den Weg, das umzusetzen. Dieses Buch sollte jeder lesen!'  - Ervin Laszlo Autor, Philosoph und Theoretiker evolutionärer Systeme Gründer des Club of Budapest

 „Die nationale Wettbewerbsfähigkeit ist zu einem der zentralen Mythen geworden, von denen wir regiert werden. Im Kern handelt es sich um einen zersetzenden Prozess, der die Fähigkeit des Staates untergräbt, Steuern anzuheben, und gleichzeitig den meisten von uns einredet, dass unsere Arbeit nicht so viel kosten dürfte. Bunzl und Duffell nehmen die wichtige Aufgabe war, diesen Mythos öffentlich zu entlarven, und gehen zugleich noch sehr viel weiter. Sie entwerfen einen erstaunlichen Plan, um eine radikal andere Welt zu denken und zu realisieren. Herausfordernde Bedingungen zwingen uns, weiter zu denken als bisher, und dieses Buch erfüllt in vieler Weise den angemessenen Anspruch, über die neoliberalen Dystopien hinaus zu denken, die der nationale Wettbewerbsdiskurs hervorgebracht hat. Es verdient eine große Leserschaft und eine breite gesellschaftliche Debatte seiner zentralen Ziele.“ - Matthew Watson Professor für Politische Ökonomie an der University of Warwick Fellow des Wirtschafts- und Sozialforschungsrats des Vereinigten Königreichs 

 „Simpol ist eine sehr mächtige neue Idee zum Lösen globaler Probleme. Es erfordert allerdings eine tiefgreifende Veränderung, das dem Leser durch den innovativen psychologischen Ansatz des Buches ermöglicht wird. Nachdem ich selbst diese Veränderung vollzogen habe, hoffe ich, dass NGOs auf der ganzen Welt an der Realisierung von Simpol mitwirken werden, dass Menschenfreunde vorangehen und eine große Informationskampagne finanzieren werden und vor allem, dass wir Bürger beginnen, unsere Stimmen in der von Simpol vorgeschlagenen Weise einzusetzen. Wenn wir das tun, werden wir feststellen, dass wir Teil der globalen politischen Lösung geworden sind.“ Scilla Elworthy Friedensarbeiterin und Gründer der Oxford Research Group Autorin von „Pioneering the Possible: Awakened Leadership for a World That Works“ „Die Simpol Lösung“ kombiniert eine messerscharfe Beschreibung unserer heutigen Wettbewerbsfähigkeits-Falle – ein Wettbewerb, der vital ist, uns aber an selbstzerstörerische Muster fesselt – mit einer ebenso bestechenden praktischen Lösung. Ich würde sehr gerne miterleben, wie John Bunzl seinen Plan ans Laufen bringt“. Dr. Sally Goerner Autorin von „After the Clockwork Universe“ Wissenschaftsberaterin, Capital Institute „Die Simpol-Lösung wirft einen begrüßenswert frischen Blick auf die politische / wirtschaftliche Realität und erklärt die psychologischen Gründe dafür, dass wir eine neue Perspektive brauchen, um zu erkennen, wie wir Politiker zwingen können, die Welt in unserem Namen zu verändern. “ Joris Luyendijk Autor, Journalist und Talkshow-Moderator „Wir müssen den Wettbewerb unseres globalen Marktes dringend mit einer selbstregulierenden Steuerung und einer Zusammenarbeit auf gleicher, globaler Ebene ergänzen, argumentieren die Autoren. Sie legen ihren brillanten Simpol-Plan als Blaupause vor, um uns dorthin zu bringen. Alles, was wir tun müssen, ist, uns engagiert einzubringen und Simpols DNA aktiv zu verbreiten! “  - Elisabet Sahtouris, Ph.D. Evolutionsbiologin und Futuristin MBA-Professorin, Chaminade University, Honolulu Autorin von: „Gaia’s Dance: The Story of Earth and Us“

 „Bunzl und Duffell liefern einen ehrgeizigen und zum Nachdenken anregenden Bericht darüber, wie destruktiver Wettbewerb zwischen Nationalstaaten in eine global vorteilhafte Zusammenarbeit umgewandelt werden kann. Ihr Ziel ist eine ‚simultane Politik‘, bei der mehrere Fragen parallel so zwischen allen Staaten verhandelt werden sollen, dass sich allen Staaten wichtige Vorteile bieten und so eine vollständige weltweite Umsetzung möglich wird. Sie skizzieren eine geniale, in Großbritannien bereits erprobte Methode, die nationalen Politiker dazu zu drängen, die Unterstützung für solche globalen Lösungen vorab zu versprechen. Sie stützen sich auf ein beeindruckendes Spektrum an Quellen und Disziplinen – von Politikwissenschaft und Psychologie über Wirtschaftswissenschaften bis hin zur Evolutionsbiologie. Dabei schreiben sie in einem leicht zugänglichen Stil und präsentieren eine Reihe anschaulicher Anekdoten, um ihre Behauptungen zu untermauern. Dieses Buch wird einen wichtigen Beitrag leisten in der Debatte um Global Governance-Optionen und um die Zerstörungen, die unvermeidlich scheinen in einem System konkurrierender souveräner Staaten.“ - Professor Luis Cabrera Convenor, World Government Research Network Griffith Universität, Brisbane 

 „Da die großen Herausforderungen der Menschheit globaler Natur sind, sind neue Bezugssysteme, Philosophien und Ansätze unentbehrlich, damit unsere Gesellschaften, so wie wir sie kennen, überleben können. Der Simpol-Ansatz bietet einen Ausgangspunkt auf dem langen Weg zu einem System der Global Governance, das eine inklusive, nachhaltige Zukunft hervorbringen kann." - Steve Killilea Gründer des Global Peace Index und des Institute for Economics and Peace

 

Andere Weisen, wie Sie helfen können!

Einige von euch werden das Projekt nicht finanziell unterstützen können; aber das heißt nicht, dass ihr nicht auch helfen könnt, diesem wichtigen Buch zu helfen. Bitte helft, das Projekt bekannt zu machen!

-> Ihr könnt diese Kampagne auf Facebook teilen

-> Oder euren Freunden davon erzählen

 

In jedem Fall danke ich euch für eure Unterstützung!!!

 DIE AUTOREN John Bunzl ist Direktor eines internationalen Textilunternehmens, Schriftsteller und internationaler Vorkämpfer mit einer einfachen und starken Vision für wirksamere globale Zusammenarbeit. Seit über einem Jahrzehnt hat er mit politischen Entscheidungsträgern und Politikern, Wissenschaftlern und Nichtregierungsorganisationen, Aktivisten und Bürgern auf der ganzen Welt zusammengearbeitet, um eine effektivere Zusammenarbeit zu fördern. Im Jahr 2000 gründete John die International Simultaneous Policy Organization (ISPO) und startete die Simultaneous Policy (Simpol) Kampagne. John schreibt regelmäßig Beiträge für die Huffington Post und hat auf verschiedenen TEDx-Veranstaltungen gesprochen. Er hat SIMPOL auch dem Weltsozialforum, der Welthandelsorganisation, der Schumacher Society und verschiedenen Universitäten einschließlich der London School of Economics vorgestellt.Nick Duffell ist ein Psychotherapeut, Trainer und Psychohistoriker mit langjähriger Erfahrung als Moderator in der Führungsentwicklung. Er hat mehrere Bücher veröffentlicht. Sein The Making of Them (2000) fand breite Anerkennung, und sein 2004 erschienenes Buch Wounded Leaders, das eine herausfordernde psychologische Analyse der britischen politischen Szene liefert, schlägt immer noch Wellen. Nick und seine Frau Helena gründeten 1996 das Center for Gender Psychology und verfassten gemeinsam das beliebte Buch Sex, Love und Dangers of Intimacy. Stimmen zum Buch „Es ist ambitioniert und provokativ. Kann es funktionieren? Das ist sicherlich einen ernsten Versuch wert“.  - Noam Chomsky „Ich musste zustimmen und nicken, bis mir der Nacken wehtat. Seit Jahren habe ich kein Buch gelesen, dem ich so tief und durchgehend zustimme und von dem ich so intensiv das Gefühl habe, dass dies Botschaften sind, die die Welt hören muss. Die Klarheit, Einfachheit und existenzielle Wichtigkeit dieses Buches stehen außer Frage. Ich bitte alle, es zu lesen, und andere zu ermutigen, dasselbe zu tun.“ Prof. Simon Anholt Gründer von „Good Country“, Good Country Index und Global Vote „Die Simpol-Lösung“ ist ein ermutigender, weil umsetzungsorientierter und pragmatischer erster Schritt in Richtung einer Weltordnungs-Plattform. Eine voll funktionierende Global Governance ist vermutlich noch sehr viel weiter entfernt, doch die Simpol-Lösung beinhaltet Handlungsschritte, die unternommen werden können und in vielen Fällen bereits unternommen wurden, um ein wachsendes Netzwerk aus international abgestimmten und vereinheitlichten Rahmenvereinbarungen zu entwickeln. Damit ist die Simpol Lösung etwas, das wahre Kosmopoliten, frustriert über die derzeitige Unerreichbarkeit einer voll funktionalen Weltregierung, heute bereits vorantreiben können, um so zumindest die wichtigsten ihrer Träume und Visionen zu realisieren. Das ist das Beste, was wir derzeit haben, das Ähnlichkeiten mit einem echten und funktionalen Welt-Regierungssystem aufweißt." - Ken Wilber, Bewusstseinstheoretiker, Autor von „Die Integrale Vision“  „Ein mutiges und dringend benötigtes Buch. Es lenkt den Blick auf den Kern des Problems: ‚Wir können die Probleme der Welt nicht mit dem gleichen Denken lösen, das sie hervorgebracht hat‘. Das hat Einstein gesagt, und Bunzl und Duffell weisen den Weg, das umzusetzen. Dieses Buch sollte jeder lesen!'  - Ervin Laszlo Autor, Philosoph und Theoretiker evolutionärer Systeme Gründer des Club of Budapest „Die nationale Wettbewerbsfähigkeit ist zu einem der zentralen Mythen geworden, von denen wir regiert werden. Im Kern handelt es sich um einen zersetzenden Prozess, der die Fähigkeit des Staates untergräbt, Steuern anzuheben, und gleichzeitig den meisten von uns einredet, dass unsere Arbeit nicht so viel kosten dürfte. Bunzl und Duffell nehmen die wichtige Aufgabe war, diesen Mythos öffentlich zu entlarven, und gehen zugleich noch sehr viel weiter. Sie entwerfen einen erstaunlichen Plan, um eine radikal andere Welt zu denken und zu realisieren. Herausfordernde Bedingungen zwingen uns, weiter zu denken als bisher, und dieses Buch erfüllt in vieler Weise den angemessenen Anspruch, über die neoliberalen Dystopien hinaus zu denken, die der nationale Wettbewerbsdiskurs hervorgebracht hat. Es verdient eine große Leserschaft und eine breite gesellschaftliche Debatte seiner zentralen Ziele.“ - Matthew Watson Professor für Politische Ökonomie an der University of Warwick Fellow des Wirtschafts- und Sozialforschungsrats des Vereinigten Königreichs  „Simpol ist eine sehr mächtige neue Idee zum Lösen globaler Probleme. Es erfordert allerdings eine tiefgreifende Veränderung, das dem Leser durch den innovativen psychologischen Ansatz des Buches ermöglicht wird. Nachdem ich selbst diese Veränderung vollzogen habe, hoffe ich, dass NGOs auf der ganzen Welt an der Realisierung von Simpol mitwirken werden, dass Menschenfreunde vorangehen und eine große Informationskampagne finanzieren werden und vor allem, dass wir Bürger beginnen, unsere Stimmen in der von Simpol vorgeschlagenen Weise einzusetzen. Wenn wir das tun, werden wir feststellen, dass wir Teil der globalen politischen Lösung geworden sind.“ Scilla Elworthy Friedensarbeiterin und Gründer der Oxford Research Group Autorin von „Pioneering the Possible: Awakened Leadership for a World That Works“ „Die Simpol Lösung“ kombiniert eine messerscharfe Beschreibung unserer heutigen Wettbewerbsfähigkeits-Falle – ein Wettbewerb, der vital ist, uns aber an selbstzerstörerische Muster fesselt – mit einer ebenso bestechenden praktischen Lösung. Ich würde sehr gerne miterleben, wie John Bunzl seinen Plan ans Laufen bringt“. Dr. Sally Goerner Autorin von „After the Clockwork Universe“ Wissenschaftsberaterin, Capital Institute „Die Simpol-Lösung wirft einen begrüßenswert frischen Blick auf die politische / wirtschaftliche Realität und erklärt die psychologischen Gründe dafür, dass wir eine neue Perspektive brauchen, um zu erkennen, wie wir Politiker zwingen können, die Welt in unserem Namen zu verändern. “ Joris Luyendijk Autor, Journalist und Talkshow-Moderator „Wir müssen den Wettbewerb unseres globalen Marktes dringend mit einer selbstregulierenden Steuerung und einer Zusammenarbeit auf gleicher, globaler Ebene ergänzen, argumentieren die Autoren. Sie legen ihren brillanten Simpol-Plan als Blaupause vor, um uns dorthin zu bringen. Alles, was wir tun müssen, ist, uns engagiert einzubringen und Simpols DNA aktiv zu verbreiten! “  - Elisabet Sahtouris, Ph.D. Evolutionsbiologin und Futuristin MBA-Professorin, Chaminade University, Honolulu Autorin von: „Gaia’s Dance: The Story of Earth and Us“ „Bunzl und Duffell liefern einen ehrgeizigen und zum Nachdenken anregenden Bericht darüber, wie destruktiver Wettbewerb zwischen Nationalstaaten in eine global vorteilhafte Zusammenarbeit umgewandelt werden kann. Ihr Ziel ist eine ‚simultane Politik‘, bei der mehrere Fragen parallel so zwischen allen Staaten verhandelt werden sollen, dass sich allen Staaten wichtige Vorteile bieten und so eine vollständige weltweite Umsetzung möglich wird. Sie skizzieren eine geniale, in Großbritannien bereits erprobte Methode, die nationalen Politiker dazu zu drängen, die Unterstützung für solche globalen Lösungen vorab zu versprechen. Sie stützen sich auf ein beeindruckendes Spektrum an Quellen und Disziplinen – von Politikwissenschaft und Psychologie über Wirtschaftswissenschaften bis hin zur Evolutionsbiologie. Dabei schreiben sie in einem leicht zugänglichen Stil und präsentieren eine Reihe anschaulicher Anekdoten, um ihre Behauptungen zu untermauern. Dieses Buch wird einen wichtigen Beitrag leisten in der Debatte um Global Governance-Optionen und um die Zerstörungen, die unvermeidlich scheinen in einem System konkurrierender souveräner Staaten.“ - Professor Luis Cabrera Convenor, World Government Research Network Griffith Universität, Brisbane  „Da die großen Herausforderungen der Menschheit globaler Natur sind, sind neue Bezugssysteme, Philosophien und Ansätze unentbehrlich, damit unsere Gesellschaften, so wie wir sie kennen, überleben können. Der Simpol-Ansatz bietet einen Ausgangspunkt auf dem langen Weg zu einem System der Global Governance, das eine inklusive, nachhaltige Zukunft hervorbringen kann." - Steve Killilea Gründer des Global Peace Index und des Institute for Economics and Peace Andere Weisen, wie Sie helfen können!Einige von euch werden das Projekt nicht finanziell unterstützen können; aber das heißt nicht, dass ihr nicht auch helfen könnt, diesem wichtigen Buch zu helfen. Bitte helft, das Projekt bekannt zu machen!-> Ihr könnt diese Kampagne auf Facebook teilen-> Oder euren Freunden davon erzählen In jedem Fall danke ich euch für eure Unterstützung!!!

story:
The Story of orchids&blus

My name is Colonel-Joshua Higgins, I go by the pen name "jaziyyah" and I am the author of orchids&blus. I am a Poet and Spoken Word Artist who was exposed to the world of poetry at 11 years old. Since then, writing poetry has changed my life completely and inspired me to write orchids&blus with the intention for my poetry to impact others how it has me. This campaign is extremely important to me as a first-time author and my decision to put all my efforts towards my passion for writing.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover a new sense of the world and a fresh perspective on life. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to explore how love or pain has impacted you, evaluate the lens that you look at life through, and reflect on how your life experiences have shaped you.

You will love this book if you love the exploration of love and infatuation; have ever experienced intense emotions and wanted to see them beautifully depicted; want to read about stories that you can empathize with, or want to discover more about yourself and find yourself in the writing.

orchids&blus speaks to adults & students everywhere who love the art of storytelling and shared experiences. This book of poems is for those who want a warm welcome to the world of poetry and have come to love it in new ways.

Ultimately, I want orchids&blus to inspire reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • What do I place my value and attention on daily?
  • Do these poems encapsulate my experience(s)?
  • What perspective does this book take on the current world?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers!

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs of publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Winter.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish it and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author 

Colonel-Joshua Higgins is a Junior marketing student at Howard University from Smithfield, VA by way of Cincinnati, Ohio. He is a proud member of various factions such as the Howard SBEL Honors Program, Alpha Kappa Psi, Professional Business Fraternity, Howard Players and many more. 

Colonel, largely known under the pen name jaziyyah, wrote this book based on a lifelong passion for poetry since introduced to it. He is someone who was known since a young kid to be interested in life, the layers of meaning within it, and his form of expression, poetry, slowly became a large piece of his personality. Colonel says his personal motto is "I measure my success by the impact I have on others" and the extension of this book falls nothing short of that mantra.

Outside of writing, Colonel is an extroverted, likable, and driven individual. He is heavily involved in community efforts, plans to fulfill the extent of college experience amidst making lifelong friendships, and is a true believer that life experiences are a gift.

For more information, you can connect with Colonel-Joshua Higgins at:

  • coloneljoshua927@gmail.com 
  • https://www.instagram.com/jaziyyahh/
  • https://twitter.com/jaziyyah

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit ?)

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #orchidsandblus and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!


Tag: 
Instragram - @jaziyyahh / @newdegreepress
Facebook - @Colonel-Joshua Higgins / @NewDegreePress 
Twitter - @jaziyyah / @NewDegreePress

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Colonel-Joshua Higgins aka jaziyyah

story:
Hi!

My name is Liam Gray. I am the founder of Conquest Comics and the creator of Australia’s #1 Crowdfunded comic, Xenotype. I am expecting a baby in early October and so I decided to build a Studio in my backyard. This would give me a dedicated workplace and because I typically work at night, its perfect way to ensure my partner always gets a full nights rest.

Conquest Comics has always been a Fans First Initiative and it recently came to my attention that a number of you would generously like to support the building effort, so here we are!

By contributing to this campaign, you’re not only helping build CONQUEST COMICS but you’re ensuring superior quality streams, faster production time of comics and providing a comfortable work environment for me going forward.

"WE NEED YOU!"

Contributers will have their names immortalized on a plate (or stone slab) that will be kept in the main building or built into side of the structure. 

Risks and Challenges
The biggest risk is electrocution or my tiny body being crushed by a collapsing comic book hut.

Stretch Goals
​Name Plate Upgraded to Stone Slab
Air-Conditioning
Koala Kai Dojo Extension

story:
Story of My Book

Under Clouds and City Lights is an illustrated poetry collection about the beautiful feelings, moments, and things that end and begin over and over again and make up our lives.

My name is Caitlin Ju and I am the author of Under Clouds and City Lights. I wrote this book because I feel that we don’t spend nearly enough time just feeling and sitting in our thoughts. Writing this book allowed me to sit in those thoughts, and it was my self-care, therapy, and joy starting two months into the pandemic and for the next few months that followed. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover there are many small things and experiences that tie us together. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to give yourself the time and space to process even the most mundane experiences and emotions, negative or positive, alongside my own journey and memories. This book is for you to turn to so that you can reflect and feel, no matter where you are in your life. 

In this book, you’ll join me in exploring love, mental health, loss, friendships, and family and discovering the firsts, emotions, trials, little things, and lasts in life through poems like: 
  • “Honey and Glass” — a poem about the beginning of a journey on self-love and self-confidence.
  • “Friends or Strangers” — a poem about a “last” and feeling of loss when you realize a friend has become a stranger again.
  • “As Seen on TV” — a poem about finally seeing someone who looks like you on the screen, a look into when I saw Crazy Rich Asians and finally saw Asian American representation.
You will love this book if you have ever felt like you couldn’t open up, if you are going through some of your most difficult times or will soon, and if you want to find hope by looking into your toughest and happiest experiences. 

Under Clouds and City Lights speaks to those who want to grapple with memories and emotions in a new way. Ultimately, I hope that my book inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:
  • What are your most important firsts and lasts?
  • How do we know when we have lost someone? What if we still remember them?
  • What are the little things that we hold onto? 
I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing our relationships, thoughts, and moments of pain, doubt, resilience, and everything in between, will change us all for the better. 
 

The Book - Under Clouds and City Lights

The book is written in 5 parts.

Part 1 contains the author’s note + section 1: beginnings. This is for the first time we ever laughed, dreamed, met someone, doubted, and loved and for all our beginnings.

Part 2 contains section 2: thought clouds. This is for all the feelings that have entered our minds as thought clouds and all the times we have felt lonely, chaotic, undeserving, powerful, free, and vulnerable.

Part 3 contains section 3: trials. This is for all the most pivotal and difficult times in our lives and for when we have felt hopeless, lost, overlooked, empowered, and loved, sometimes all at once.

Part 4 contains section 4: little things. This is for all the little things that make life and us special. The thing may be very small, like chopsticks, very large, like space, or something that belongs to the world, like clouds.

Part 5 contains section 5: endings. This is for all the lasts and endings that we will ever experience, whether it is the end of the night, last time we see someone, or the end of our youth.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this April 2021.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish with a personal note!
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Caitlin Ju is a college senior graduating from University of Michigan Ann Arbor. Caitlin studies business and will be a strategy tech, media, and telecom consultant at Strategy& in New York City after graduation.

Caitlin wrote this book as a way to sort through the feelings that came with the social isolation of quarantine and a college senior year that looked very different from what she expected. Though Caitlin is passionate about all types of writing, poetry was the medium she felt she was able to best express herself with during the pandemic.

Aside from frequently talking about New Zealand and brunch, Caitlin enjoys driving on the Pacific Coast highway, watercolor painting, and planning her future travels.

For more information, you can connect with Caitlin Ju at caitju@umich.edu and at Instagram: @caitjuwrites.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #UnderCloudsAndCityLights and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Caitlin Ju

I want you to see this book as an opportunity to give yourself the time and space to process even the most mundane experiences and emotions, negative or positive, alongside my own journey and memories. This book is for you to turn to so that you can reflect and feel, no matter where you are in your life. In this book, you’ll join me in exploring love, mental health, loss, friendships, and family and discovering the firsts, emotions, trials, little things, and lasts in life through poems like: 
“Honey and Glass” — a poem about the beginning of a journey on self-love and self-confidence.
“Friends or Strangers” — a poem about a “last” and feeling of loss when you realize a friend has become a stranger again.
“As Seen on TV” — a poem about finally seeing someone who looks like you on the screen, a look into when I saw Crazy Rich Asians and finally saw Asian American representation.
You will love this book if you have ever felt like you couldn’t open up, if you are going through some of your most difficult times or will soon, and if you want to find hope by looking into your toughest and happiest experiences. Under Clouds and City Lights speaks to those who want to grapple with memories and emotions in a new way. Ultimately, I hope that my book inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:
What are your most important firsts and lasts?
How do we know when we have lost someone? What if we still remember them?
What are the little things that we hold onto? 
I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing our relationships, thoughts, and moments of pain, doubt, resilience, and everything in between, will change us all for the better.  The Book - Under Clouds and City LightsThe book is written in 5 parts.Part 1 contains the author’s note + section 1: beginnings. This is for the first time we ever laughed, dreamed, met someone, doubted, and loved and for all our beginnings.Part 2 contains section 2: thought clouds. This is for all the feelings that have entered our minds as thought clouds and all the times we have felt lonely, chaotic, undeserving, powerful, free, and vulnerable.Part 3 contains section 3: trials. This is for all the most pivotal and difficult times in our lives and for when we have felt hopeless, lost, overlooked, empowered, and loved, sometimes all at once.Part 4 contains section 4: little things. This is for all the little things that make life and us special. The thing may be very small, like chopsticks, very large, like space, or something that belongs to the world, like clouds.Part 5 contains section 5: endings. This is for all the lasts and endings that we will ever experience, whether it is the end of the night, last time we see someone, or the end of our youth. What I Need & What You'll GetThis book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this April 2021.
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish with a personal note!
You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more! About the AuthorCaitlin Ju is a college senior graduating from University of Michigan Ann Arbor. Caitlin studies business and will be a strategy tech, media, and telecom consultant at Strategy& in New York City after graduation.Caitlin wrote this book as a way to sort through the feelings that came with the social isolation of quarantine and a college senior year that looked very different from what she expected. Though Caitlin is passionate about all types of writing, poetry was the medium she felt she was able to best express herself with during the pandemic.Aside from frequently talking about New Zealand and brunch, Caitlin enjoys driving on the Pacific Coast highway, watercolor painting, and planning her future travels.For more information, you can connect with Caitlin Ju at caitju@umich.edu and at Instagram: @caitjuwrites. Risks & ChallengesThe biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship. Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #UnderCloudsAndCityLights and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.
Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Caitlin Ju

story:
Story of my book 

Mercy is a fantasy adventure novel following a young witch on her path to understanding her magic and who she is as a person. Mercy has grown up hiding and ignoring her magical powers. After accidentally injuring her father when she loses control of her magic, Mercy sets off in search of another witch capable of teaching her to use her power. Her journey leads her into new territories that help her forge bonds, experience life, and accept who and what she is. 

My name is Maxine Smith and I am the author of Mercy. I wrote this book because as a new adult I am learning to be my own person and make my own choices. I'm interested in exploring the transitional periods between stages of life and created Mercy and her journey to delve into the emotional changes and repercussions that come with growing up, branching out, and making decisions.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how your past and history can affect you, but will never control you. There are always choices you can make to change your future and your fate. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to explore growth and change as you escape from everyday life into this fantasy adventure and learn alongside Mercy, Ka'Soran, and Repeat about the importance of discovering yourself and claiming independence.

Mercy is set in the Greenlands, a magical continent home to elves, giants, goblins, dwarves, and many other magical races. During Mercy’s search for a teacher, she meets Ka’Soran, a young human scholar on his way to apprentice in the capital city of Rendum. Upon arrival, the two fast friends go their separate ways, but fate has different plans for them both. Launched into an evil plot and forced to pick sides, Mercy, Ka’Soran, and a mysterious vagabond from the Bandit Wood set off to, hopefully, save their world as they know it. 

You will love this book if you enjoy fantasy, adventure, fantasy worlds and creatures, and magic.

Mercy speaks to fantasy lovers and young people who want to grapple with history and adulthood in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Mercy inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:
  • How do the choices you make reflect on the person you are?
  • Can we choose to change our futures? Is it our minds that limit us?
  • What is a family? Is it blood that makes family? 
  • How can history appear in our present-day lives?
I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing self-discovery, acceptance, friendship, and history will change us all for the better. 
 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Fall.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

The Impact

Maxine Smith is an Aerospace Engineering and Mechanics student at the University of Minnesota with a passion for creative writing. She has been writing since age 13 when she discovered her love of science fiction and fantasy. Maxine’s interests are rooted in exploring different cultures, traveling, trying new things, experiencing life, and creating connections. 

Maxine undertook this project to explore and narrate the journey of becoming independent from family and making decisions in one’s own council. Mercy is about a young adult going through the ups and downs of creating her own path through life, with a fantasy twist. Maxine hopes readers can connect with the characters and take away lessons from their experiences. 

Outside of her studies and creative pursuits, Maxine enjoys reading, drawing, biking, and being outdoors. She loves to watch movies, spend time with her family (which includes three big dogs), and is slowly teaching herself how to cook. 

For more information, you can connect with Maxine Smith at maxinesmith.author@gmail.com and at maxinesmith.author on Instagram. 
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #mercybymax and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Maxine Smith

story:
Hope for Health: A New Wave of the Healthcare Experience explores the healthcare industry and the ways that politics, service, technology, and new practices can change healthcare and play into our everyday lives. I wrote this book because healthcare has always fascinated me and I wanted to learn more about this complex industry and share that knowledge with others. My book will publish in February 2020.

Story of My Book

Hope for Health: A New Way of the Healthcare Experience A book about the ways that the many, ever changing, aspects of healthcare play into the patient experience.

My name is Jacob Schupp and I am the author of Hope for Health: A New Wave of the Healthcare Experience. We are all impacted by healthcare in some way, shape, or form. Millions of people are impacted by the healthcare industry (directly or indirectly) every day. I wrote this book because I have always been interested in healthcare. So many people are impacted by this industry daily and yet so many people know so little about it. One aspect of healthcare that I am specifically drawn to is the patient experience and looking to see the ways that we can better improve this lifesaving system that impacts so many people.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the ways that so many people play a role in patient care, directly or indirectly. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for healthcare in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you better understand the healthcare industry, become an advocate for yourself or a loved one, and possibly enter the healthcare industry.

In this book, you'll learn about healthcare and the many complex intersections:

Spiritual Care - and how it can help so many people through some of their toughest moments

Healthcare Innovation - and how these changes can help move the industry further

Service - and how this mindset shift can help everyone involved

You will love this book if you are impacted by or curious about the healthcare system.
Hope for Health: A New Wave of the Healthcare Experience is a non-fiction book that speaks to those impacted by the healthcare system and want to know more about this complex industry that impacts all of us who may be looking at health care for the first time.

The Book - Hope for Health: A New Wave of the Healthcare Experience

The book is written in 7 Parts

Part 1 contains the introduction + additional chapters. In this section I will introduce the book and learn of the enormous potential there is for the healthcare system.

Part 2 is a look at healthcare through the eyes of the purchaser. In this section we will look at why now is the perfect time for change to occur within the healthcare industry and in the ways that we view the healthcare industry.

Part 3 is a look at healthcare as a payer would. This section will look at how we might go about changing the healthcare industry and the ways that it might look like in the future.

Part 4 will go through the thought process of policy makers. Reimagining politics in healthcare and the impacts that these decisions have on so many people.

Part 5 is a first had look through the eyes of a provider. Looking at creative ways that entrepreneurship can reshape the industry in ways that we may not be able to imagine.

Part 6 is is what we can relate to as patients. Imagining the ways that a mindset shift can make the whole process more human.

Part 7 contains the conclusion. In this section we will review all that we talked about and start to look at “what now"

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in February 2020

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

About the Author

Jacob Schupp is currently creatively raising funds and building connections with people to help create a world free of Multiple Sclerosis. He is doing this as a Development Coordinator of Walk MS in Ohio at the National Multiple Sclerosis Society. Previously Jacob was a student at John Carroll University where he was the Student Government President, a tour guide, and a member of Lambda Chi Alpha. Jacob graduated in May of 2019 by majoring in Finance and minoring in Entrepreneurship.

I wrote this book because I have always been interested in healthcare. I personally don’t have a life changing healthcare related story but many people throughout the world do and I want to share some of those stories. My hope is that after hearing these stories and learning more about healthcare you will also have the same interests. I think that if everyone knows just a little more about the healthcare system the whole system could work better for everyone involved. After all, it impacts all of our lives every single day whether we know it or not.

As Mother Teresa said “We alone may not be able to change the world, but we can cast a stone across the waters to create many ripples”. 

For more information you can connect with Jacob at jschupp5@gmail.com and on LinkedIn.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #HopeForHealth and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jacob Schupp

story:
Presentation

To view my presentation click on the Gallery Tab at the top of the page and then scroll down to The Wedding Gift Presentation.

Summary

I am trying to support a poor mission school in a slum in Nairobi, Kenya with the sale of my book, "The Wedding Gift."  I was 40 years old and happily planning a Catholic wedding when my mother (Pauline Hofmann) was given terrible news about her health in her fight against cancer.  Not in a million years would I have thought that the events that transpired in the months before my wedding would have ever happened to me.  The week before my wedding was the most difficult in my life.  This is a mother/daughter memoir and proceeds from the sale of this book will be put into mother's education fund that supports a poor mission school in a slum in Nairobi, Kenya, Kariobangi region.

                                                 **********

I wrote most of the book in the year after my mothers death and my wedding.  My fiance and I both lived in Cincinnati, Ohio at the time and I was running a small personal fitness training and consulting business.  I sat down at the computer after her death, really just to record some memories of her, of our enlightening conversations and to never forget the shocking events and twists of fate that surrounded her failing health and passing.  However, something took over me while at the keyboard and I was flooded with words and ideas and suddenly a book took shape.  I could never stop typing.  Little did I know that this book writing adventure would be the most therapeautic action I could have taken to help me deal with my mothers death and all the major changes that occurred in my life at that time. 

Three Main Goals

1. To save lives and educate the poorest of the poor children in a slum in Nairobi, Kenya, Kariobangi region. 

2. To keep my mothers spirit of volunteerism alive and thriving in Kenya.

3. To help those who are struggling with the loss of a loved one.

After my mothers death an education fund was set up in her honor, as a missionary, by a Catholic priest.  This fund supports the mission school in the Kariobangi slum outside of Nairobi, Kenya.  These kids in the school go without, food, water, clothing, shoes and school supplies on a daily basis.  Their only meal in a day may only come from the school.  Many children have lost parents to AIDS and some at young ages have to support and care for even younger brothers and sisters.  These children are struggling and hurting and they view the school as a life saving institution.

Throughout my mothers life, she financially supported many kids in that mission school on their quest for a better life with education.  Some have even gone on to get degrees in higher education.  I want this to continue.  I am passionate about it...I want to do this in honor of my mother and for all those little boys and girls in school in Kenya that just want to live and go to school and get educated.  They value education and know how important it is in enriching a life and changing a country. 

It would be a dream come true to be able to raise at least $2700 for this project.  I hope to have the book published by Dec. 15, 2012 if not before then.

Find out how you can impact a childs life now, see perks at right.

How The Money Will Be Spent

1.  $1500.00 is the exact amount that needs to be paid to a small hybrid book publisher that has agreed to get the book in print and marketed within their system.

2.  An additional $1200.00 will be used in the following ways:

     a.) To purchase extra copies of the book.

     b.) To ship some copies to the African Mission School in Nairobi, Kenya.

     c.) To pay a web designer to help get it on-line for purchase on a website separate  from the publisher.

     d.) To design and buy marketing materials to send to specific booksellers in the U.S.

     e.) To buy a nice Giving Tree plaque in honor of my mothers work to be placed in the mission school in Nairobi.

A portion of the funds raised will go directly into the Pauline Hofmann Education Fund.

Note: This is a fixed funding campaign, if we do not reach our goal of $2700 your money will be refunded. 

About The Book

The book is written, has been edited and is now ready to go to a publisher.  I worked with two editors at different times in this process and both strongly recommended that I get it published.  I remember clearly the advice given from each one, "Quite impressive for a first timer, you can do it, keep working on it," and, "Of all the books that I have read and edited, this is the only one that I have ever cried reading."  Some say this is the next Brian's Song.

It is 142 pages long, with 23 chapters.  I am the sole author of the book, written in a conversational style.  It is an easy read, Catholic in nature and tone. 

Chapter  1     The News                                                                       

Chapter  2     Shock                                                                                

Chapter  3     Friendship                                                                         

Chapter  4     The Before                                                                        

Chapter  5     The Giver                                                                          

Chapter  6     Jealousy                                                                      

Chapter  7     The Conversations                                                       

Chapter  8     Separation                                                                            

Chapter  9     Alone                                                                                     

Chapter  10   The Surrender, Saying Yes to the Lord                         

Chapter  11   The Gift                                                                      

Chapter  12   Why                                                                                

Chapter  13   The Week                                                                       

Chapter  14   The Note                                                                      

Chapter  15   The Visitor                                                                      

Chapter  16   Emptiness                                                                  

Chapter  17   Grief                                                                                 

Chapter  18   The Day                                                                       

Chapter  19   Paradise                                                                

Chapter  20   The Dreams                                                                       

Chapter  21   The Psychic                                                               

Chapter  22   Undying Love                                                           

Chapter  23   The Cycle of Life  

What Others Have Said About The Book

1. A Professor at Xavier University in Cincinnati commented, "Very descriptive and emotional, can you come talk to my class of counseling majors."

2. A published Poet at the University of Cincinnati saw the first rough draft and said, "Good stuff here, this could be the start of something great."

3. A writer/actor in Columbus responded with, "Your book is so lovely."

4. A personal training client of mine said, "I cried my eyes out reading it, it was so touching."

About the Education Fund

The Pauline Hofmann Education Fund (PHEF) was set up by a Comboni missionary priest who benefited directly from the financial support over many years from my mother and father.  This order of priests, nuns and lay people work tirelessly in mostly African nations.  The Comboni Missionaries North American Province is located in Cincinnati, Ohio.  My mother volunteered at this mission center for almost 30 years, up until she lost her battle with breast cancer at the age of 70.  My father still makes a weekly visit to the center to work for a day, he is now 83 years old.  To learn more about the Comboni Missionaries, visit their website at www.combonimissionaries.org.   Monthly withdraws are made out of this fund for the school in Nairobi.

The Mission School

Located in the downtrodden Kariobangi neighborhood outside of Nairobi, Kenya, the Comboni mission school serves 247 children between the ages of seven and 15.  It is estimated that 20,000 children live there in the entire community.  Many of these children are HIV positive or have AIDS and many are faced with unimagineable poverty in the filthy slums of Nairobi.  Nairobi is one of the largest cities in Africa. Quote from Frather Paulino who runs the parish and school, "HIV/AIDS has been so disastrous in our parish that no one can count the number of orphans. I am trying to feed, dress and put these children back in school, this is a nightmare."

Impact the life of a poor child today, view perks at right to see how.

Speaking Opportunities

I have been asked on a few occasions to share my story and speak to local groups on grief and how to handle challenges and stresses in life.  This is of great interest to me, and I would love to be able to share the book and help others who may be struggling with the loss of a loved one. 

How You Can Help

See perks at right. It doesn't take much to make a big impact in Africa.  Here is your opportunity to instill hope and help a child feel love.  $100 pays for one child to attend the mission school for a year.  This is a fixed funding campaign so you must donate using PayPal.  You do not have to have an account with PayPal in order to contribute.  Don't worry, its secure, quick and easy.  Unfortunately, your donations are not tax deductible because I am not a non-profit 501 (c) (3) organization.  Any donation over $50.00 will get your name listed in the acknowledgement section of my book.

Need More Info?

To learn more about me, visit my personal training website, www.femaleathletesfirst.com and click on About Us. 

Thank You

Please help me make some noise about this campaign by sharing it with others. Don't forget to use some of the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
The Story Thus Far


Hi there. My name's Andy and I love films and writing. I am on a quest to make my 2011 a Fantastic year. But I need YOUR help.


The Deal


First, we need to time-travel to the long, long ago of 2010. This is when I first started my blog, rockets and robots are GO! I love films and writing, and I combine those two passions here, where I write about every film I see in the cinema, among other things. The challenge I see for myself is to continually push and improve on what I do. So it’s time to step up my game. It’s time to break out the f words: Fantastic Fest.

Fantastic Fest is held every year at the Alamo Drafthouse Theatre. It is the film festival for the weird, genre, esoteric and just plain fantastic. These are films you might not get a chance to see anywhere else, or they might be films that get that crucial leg-up from Fantastic Fest. Not only that, but there are events during the week long Fest that sound too crazy not to miss. Sure there's Cannes, Sundance and many, many other film festivals. But Fantastic Fest is the one film festival in the world I have dreamed of attending.

The thing is, the Fest is held in Austin, Texas and I... I am in Wellington, New Zealand.


What I Need & What You Get

To get to Fantastic Fest I need the following:

  • Festival pass ($205 USD)
  • Return airfare ($2,800 NZD, roughly $2,000 USD)
  • Accommodation (running just over $1,000 USD for the Fest)


Like I said, I write about every film I see in a cinema. That includes festival screenings (at last year’s NZ International Film Festival I was able to schedule 47 films in 2 weeks. I wrote up every single one. And around my day job too). At Fantastic Fest I plan on cramming in as many crazy great films and events as I can and I will be writing up every single experience. My goal is to make it feel like you, the reader, are there with me having the time of your life. I may very well break my brain doing it, but do it I must.

It may help if you look at it like this: I’m a writer being sent on assignment. But instead of being paid by a newspaper, magazine or website I am “paid” directly by my (lovely, intelligent and awesome) readers. Though this isn’t technically accurate as I won’t be making a dime off this, I plan to really make you a part of this adventure. Do not mistake this for a holiday! I will be busting my ass to bring you, the reader, the best coverage possible from this amazing one-of-a-kind film festival.

It’ll be part review, part travelogue and all adventure!

The Impact


If you can help me with this, you’ll be helping to fulfil a big dream. If I don’t reach this funding goal of mine, that’s ok. I’ll know I tried and that I had great people supporting me.

BUT! If I do make it, if I do achieve this... well, you'll have helped me achieve a dream of mine. This could be the start of something truly awesome; for me, for my writing, for my life.


Other Ways You Can Help

Of course donations/pledges are welcome and appreciated (PLEASE NOTE: all amounts are in US dollars!). But the best way YOU can help is to get the word out! Tell your friends, tell your family, tell your barista! Blog it, facebook it, twitter it (there are a bunch of super-useful buttons at the top) and help...


...get me to the Fest on time!

story:
Short Summary

The name Argosy has a long history. The first magazine to go by that name was founded here in Britain in 1865. The more famous American version followed in 1882 under the stewardship of the pioneering Frank Munsey. With this revival of the concept, we want to go back to the Argosy’s roots.

Frank Munsey is known as the inventor of the “pulp magazine”. He used the most advanced printing technologies of his time to produce a low-cost short story magazine on uncut “pulp” paper. He followed this up by building an empire on various affordable magazines, and others soon borrowed his technique. A revolution in short fiction began.

Short stories are a wonderful, meaningful art form. In taking up the Argosy banner, we aim to continue Frank Munsey’s industrial heritage to pioneer a revival of the pulp short story. We can’t claim to have invented the e-book as Frank Munsey invented the low-cost pulp magazine, but we can follow his example and use e-book technology to distribute our short story collections in the most economical way possible. E-books allow for quicker editing and typesetting, and modern technology allows us to accept submissions from authors all around the world and distribute to readers everywhere, and to keep volumes available indefinitely where dead tree edition magazines are restricted to their printing schedules.

We may be repeating history, but doesn't mean we'll limit ourselves to mere imitation. We want to be the pioneers of a new pulp revolution, as Munsey was all those years ago.

What We Need & What You Get

With this project, we want to reward you with more than just kind words and tacky merchandise, so each reward beyond the first will come with a copy of Argosy, with the higher rewards offering you subscriptions at a significant discount, physical copies of the first volume and even a professional review of your short story, which could land it in the pages of Argosy itself.

The perks we've made available have been perfectly crafted to give you the greatest freedom of choice, so you can decide whether you want a limited edition print copy of Volume 1: Fantastic Frontiers, the first two digital volumes, a years subscription, a professional review of your short story by the Argosy team, or any combination of those perks. It's completely up to you.

The money raised from this project will go towards completing our first volume, Fantastic Frontiers--rewarding our current writers and attracting a few more to contribute the last few stories in the collection. Most of the work is already complete and we already have some fantastic stories from some brilliant authors, and with your help we can get Volume 1 published by the end of the month by getting even more writers involved to finish off what is already going to be a superb collection. Already we have an amazing cover piece by the award winning artist Tais Teng, and if we raise enough we'd like to pay to do some illustrations too.

Your contributions will also pave the way for future volumes by drawing in talented writers and artist. As a stretch goal, we want each story to have a personalized illustration. But even if we don't reach our goal, those funds raised will still go towards advances for future writers and cover artists.

Most of the work for our first collection is already complete, and we've already begun collecting works for our future volumes. Following the Frank Munsey principle of low production costs and high quality products, we're able to reduce the risks associated with the printing industry to practically zero. Using digital formats, there will be no risk of returns, and by using the crowdfunding model we can ensure that all the funding we need to produce that product is there right from the start.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't donate, you can still help us out in other ways. Spread the word about our campaign and our upcoming volumes by linking to this indiegogo, our website, facebook page or twitter account. If you do donate, make sure you review the volumes you receive on goodreads or your own blogs and websites. And don't forget to follow us and like our facebook page:

  • Website
  • facebook
  • twitter
  • YouTube

It's completely up to you.
