This campaign is important to me and all the people involved because we are currently in a period of time where the world is in turmoil, and inspiration, hope and faith is crucial to our well being. Supporting this campaign will allow us to reach out to people and touch their hearts with these real life experiences. 
(Pictured: Line with her mother and statue of her three aunts: All nuns)What We Need & What You GetI would love to make the book available in English, French and Spanish so that all the refugee families involved can have it available in their native language and share it with others globally. I need all the versions of the book reviewed with final edits, as well as the book cover designed, and all the interior designs completed for all three versions. We are asking for $23,000  of our $40,000 target to get this project to the next stage so we can approach potential publishers globally. The funds will go to the people required to finish this project professionally (as mentioned above). So far, we have had nearly 30 volunteers from Australia and Canada to get the project to this point. They are amazing individuals. (Pictured: Valerie - Liaison who organized all the refugee meetings)Any person that donates up to $100 will get a free copy of the ebook upon release and donations above $100 will automatically get a paperback version of the book delivered to them, as well as their names acknowledged within the book / website. Any large contributions will receive free publicity on our website.
I need to meet
professional translators, designers, and e-book conversion specialists that can
help complete the book set up. I need as many people to know about this project
so that the biggest publishers and marketers are interested to help me share
this book with the world. I would like the media to be inspired to talk about
the project, radio hosts to engage with the stories, journalists to write about
the project and people like Kyle and Jackie O, Studio 10, Sunrise, The
Circle, SMH, Celine Dion, Angelina Jolie, Ellen and Oprah to be excited about the project
and share it with their audiences. 
The ImpactThis book is educational, inspirational and will leave you feeling a deep sense of compassion towards these beautiful families that I have had the honor to meet with and embrace. One woman worked tirelessly throughout her life to set up one of the refugee / immigration centers in Quebec to allow the Government and United Nations to send refugees to that area.  I am a proud Australian Author and I want to complete this book and share it with a world audience because these stories are the same for all refugees globally, regardless of whether they are sent to the USA, Canada, Europe or Australia. I need your help to get this project finished and published. There are still many negative attitudes in communities world wide in relation to the ongoing issues with the huge refugee crisis in the world. When you take a moment to really understand who they are, and walk in their shoes for one moment, you will see that attitude fade. With a deeper understanding of the human race, together we can make a difference. I am determined to have a successful launch of this book. If you would like to view my last book released, titled Arjun Rising, you will find that available on Amazon. You can also view my website www.littlescreenbigscreen.com to see other successful projects I have completed.       (Pictured:  Lachuman's family inside the camp in Nepal)Other Ways You Can HelpIf you cannot contribute financially, that doesn't mean you cannot help. We need promoters, marketers, media contacts and people like you to be excited about the project and support it by sharing it with your friends. 
If anyone knows of any
business men/women and/or philanthropists globally - I would love
to personally give these ten families some more clothes for their
children, a new computer for their homework, and by a miracle, a family
car to get their basic needs met during the cold, snowy winter days and nights.
I can film the event of giving these items and turn it into a documentary of
how the kindness of human beings can change peoples lives. 
Thank you for your time
and support and please give us a helping hand today and put a smile on another
face.
(Pictured: Veronique, Sihem and Annie helping launch the campaign)                       French Description 
Ces derniers
mois, j'ai accompagné une canadienne québécoise admirable, ainsi que dix
familles réfugiées d'Afrique, du Bhoutan/Népal, du Kosovo et de la Colombie.
Pendant le temps que j'ai passé avec eux, ces familles m'ont fait confiance et
m'ont laissé témoigner de leurs histoires de vie, de ce qui s’est passé, d'où
ils sont venus et de comment ils sont arrivés ici.
Ce fut une rare occasion,
car beaucoup d'entre nous savons que les réfugiés risquent souvent leur vie en
racontant ce qui leur est arrivé. 
Ces histoires
dévoilent la vérité sur ce qui arrive à ces gens sur le terrain. Elles nous
emportent dans un voyage à travers leur village d'origine, la torture subie à
la main de miliciens violents et leur périple vers un nouveau pays. Elles
mettent vraiment en évidence la profondeur de leur foi, qui leur a permis de
survivre à tout ce qu'ils ont enduré.
(Pictured: Rupa with her brother - refugees from Bhutan / Nepal)Ce livre est
éducatif, inspirant et vous laissera un profond sentiment de compassion envers
ces merveilleuses familles que j'ai eu l'honneur de rencontrer et de côtoyer. 
Une femme a
travaillé sans relâche toute sa vie pour mettre sur pied un des centres pour réfugiés
et immigrants au Québec qui accueillent des réfugiés reconnus par le gouvernement
et les Nations Unies.
Je suis une
fière auteure australienne et je veux compléter ce livre et le partager avec un
public international, car ces histoires se répètent pour tous les réfugiés autour
du monde, qu'ils soient envoyés aux États Unis, au Canada, en Europe ou en
Australie. J'ai besoin de votre aide pour mener à terme ce projet et publier ce
livre.
J'aimerais
beaucoup que ce livre soit disponible en anglais, en français et en espagnol,
pour que toutes les familles réfugiées qui y figurent puissent le lire dans
leur langue et puissent le partager partout dans le monde. Il faut que toutes les
versions du livre soient révisées jusqu'à leur version finale, et que la conception
de la couverture et de tous les détails intérieurs soient complétés pour les trois
versions. Je devrai rencontrer des traducteurs professionnels, des graphistes,
ainsi que des spécialistes en publication électronique qui pourront m'aider à
finaliser la mise au point du livre. J'ai besoin que le plus de gens possible
soient au courant du projet pour que les plus grandes maisons d’édition et
agences de marketing s'intéressent au projet et m'aident à diffuser ce livre à
travers le monde entier.
(Pictured: Angelique with Line Chaloux whilst capturing her story)Je souhaite que le
projet suscite la couverture des médias, que les animateurs de radio soient
interpellés par les histoires, que les journalistes écrivent sur le projet et
que des personnes comme Celine Dion, Ginette Reno, Quebec TV personalities, Daniele Henkel, Angelina
Jolie, Ellen et Oprah se prennent d'intérêt par le projet et le partagent avec
leurs publics.
Nous espérons
dépasser le montant cible pour garantir que le livre soit disponible dans les
trois langues et le promouvoir auprès des maisons d’édition et des médias
internationaux. Il n'y a pas de limite aux fonds que nous souhaitons amasser
car le plus d'argent nous avons en parrainage, le mieux nous pourrons partager
cette merveilleuse œuvre avec le monde.
Si vous
connaissez des gens d'affaires ou des philanthropes à travers le monde,
j'aimerais beaucoup pouvoir donner à ces dix familles des vêtements pour leurs
enfants, un nouvel ordinateur pour faire leurs devoirs, et, qui sait, peut-être
même une voiture familiale pour subvenir à leurs besoins de base pendant les
hivers froids et enneigés. Je pourrai filmer l'événement de remise de ces items
et en faire un documentaire sur comment la bonté humaine peut transformer la
vie de quelqu'un.
Merci de votre
temps et de votre appui.
Aidez-nous
aujourd'hui et faîtes naître un sourire sur un autre visage.
(NOTE: French Description provided by David M. Da Silva)Merci, Angelique PapadeliasEmail: faithinourfreedom@yahoo.comwww.littlescreenbigscreen.comwww.FaithinourFreedom.comhttps://www.facebook.com/faithinourfreedomhttps://twitter.com/faithnrfreedomhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=etp3Jzezppk

story:
Short Summary

I am Dr. Lucinda M. Deason.  I have a doctoral degree in Political Science with a major in Public Policy and Administration and Research Methods from Michigan State University.  I am a former Tenured Associate Professor that taught at the University of Akron.  I was molested by my maternal uncle when I was 4 years old.  I was stalked three times during my life by an ex-husband and former guys I dated.  Further, on 4 separate occasions different guys who were acquaintances attempted to rape me.  I overcame the trauma from these experiences and decided to write and self-publish a book to provide females ages 12 and up with a variety of spiritual, mental, and physical strategies to enhance their personal safety and reduce the likelihood them being raped.  I have written the entire book. I am now in the process of revising and editing the book.  In addition to the book, I have been conducting free workshops with females to equip them with some of the strategies I cover in my upcoming book.

We live in a violent society where females are attacked on a daily basis. In 2011 statistics indicate that or the reported rapes, approximately 20% of women in the U.S. have survived a completed or attempted rape.  The Justice Department estimates that one in five women will experience rape or attempted rape during their college years, and that less than five percent of these rapes will be reported.  Females age 24 and under suffer from the highest rates of rape.

Research shows that females who defend themselves from a sexual predator are less likely to be raped or the severity of the attack is minor in comparison to those females who do not defend themselves.  The females who do not defend themselves are more likely to be severely injured and/or killed.  I experienced 4 attempted rapes in my lifetime and some of the spiritual, mental, and physical strategies I cover in my book and workshops helped me to escape.  I want use my book and free workshops to empower and equip females with effective personal safety strategies.  

What We Need & What You Get

I want to raise $15,000 to cover the cost of printing the book, creating a website, and travelling to colleges and universities over the next 3 years.  I plan to use the money I raise from this campaign to help me cover the cost of printing, creating a website, and conducting free personal safety workshops that teach at-risk females spiritual, mental, and physical strategies to enhance their personal safety based upon my book over the next 3 years.  The contents of the book and workshop will help females to enhance personal safety and reduce the number females who are at high risk for being sexually assaulted.  If I don’t reach my funding goal, I will use the funds to cover printing cost for my book first, the website, and then whatever is left over, I will use to help me travel to colleges and universities around the country.

Perks:

$20.00 or less:  Personal acknowledgment in the book

$50 or less:  Autographed copy of the book and personal acknowledgement in the book

$100 or less:  Exclusive invite to the book release party, 2 autographed copies of the book, and personal acknowledgment in the book

$500 or more:  Access to any of the workshops over the next 3 years, exclusive invite to the book release party, 5 autographed copies of the book, and personal acknowledgment in the book.

The Impact

I have published numerous scholarly articles.  I have also conducted numerous personal safety workshops. The evaluations from the workshops indicate that information and exercises in the workshops have improved the participants’ knowledge, skills, and abilities to reduce the likelihood of them being raped. 

Research shows that females who defend themselves from a sexual predator are less likely to be raped or the severity of the attack is minor in comparison to those females who do not defend themselves.  The females who do not defend themselves are more likely to be severely injured and/or killed.  I experienced 4 attempted rapes in my lifetime and some of the spiritual, mental, and physical strategies I cover in my book and workshops helped me to escape.  I want use my book and free workshops to empower and equip females with effective personal safety strategies.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please use the Indiegogo share tools to advertise my campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Myspace, Instagram, and any other social media you have access to help me complete my book and ultimately empower and equip female with strategies to enhance their personal safety.

story:
If you believe independent artists, literature, and transgender visibility are important, donate today! 

About SHOW TRANS

A nonfiction novel about sex addiction, sex work, navigating the MSM scene, a trip West, dissociative identity disorder, and the struggle to find love, connection, and self-actualization as a non-binary trans person. This book will be my most autobiographical (and arguably scandalous) work to date. Check out my Original Plumbing interview: http://originalplumbing.com/index.php/arts-entertainment/books/item/840-how-trans-an-interview-with-elliott-deline-about-his-soon-to-be-released-book

Help me get this book finished and out there! And pre-order your copy, along with other fancy prizes. All donors will be listed on my website and in a thank-you at the introduction of the book.


Who I am

 I have 2 previous books, Refuse and I Know Very Well How I Got My Name. In 2011, Refuse was a finalist in the Rainbow Book Awards in several categories . In 2013, I Know Very Well How I Got My Name was the winner for Best Transgender Fiction. I have also written for Original Plumbing, The New York Times, Trans-Genre.net, and other publications.  I had a short story in The Collection, a transgender anthology which won the 2012 Lambda Literary Award.  My work has received favorable reviews from Kirkus Reviews, Out in Print Queer Book Reviews, Lambda Literary, and Publishers’ Weekly, to name a few.  Mark Simpson, a British journalist for The Guardian and the author of Saint Morrissey, called my first novel “irresistible.”  Kirkus Reviews referred to my work as “well written, nuanced…pioneering examples of transgender fiction.” My writing has been read by gender studies and literature classes at New York University, Trent University, The New School, SUNY Fredonia, Onondaga Community College, and more. Despite this, my work remains largely unknown to the general public as well as within the transgender community. This is because I have extremely limited promotional power. I work almost entirely on my own with no budget.


Short Summary

I need money to...

A.) Attend these events to promote my upcoming book:

1.  OutWrite Book Festival, D.C. Several days in August. Vendor Fee: $40. Travel and Lodging. This includes a panel I will speak on, Writing Trans Characters.

2. Queer Confessions reading in Toronto. Travel, lodging.

3. Queer Between the Covers Book Fair, Montreal. Several days in August. Vendor fee, travel, lodging.

And hopefully several other readings at bookstores, colleges, and events around the country, after the book is published.

B.) Stock Books to sell at events. 100 copies of Refuse: $300+ , 100 copies of novella: $300+, 100 copies of the new book will most likely also cost $300+


Other expenses I will likely incur in the next few months include: 

1. Printing and shipping copies of my books for bookstores. Because of this expense, I've only been able to stock my books in about 5 bookstores in major cities. I want to keep expanding.

2. Entering contests (fees)

3. Purchasing promotional material such as postcards and business cards. 

4. Purchasing shipping labels, paper, printer ink. 

 

The Impact

1. There aren't a lot of trans authors who have published novels. It's important we are represented at larger LGBTQ literary events. In addition, most books with transgender characters are not written by transgender authors. Mine are among the few exceptions.

2. Few successful queer writers live outside expensive major metropolitan centers like NYC, San Francisco, LA. Millions of queer people live elsewhere but don’t see their lives reflected in queer culture. I am from Syracuse, NY and write from this perspective. It makes for fresh writing. I think that my less than glamorous lifestyle resonates with many people.

3. I receive an estimate of 2 or 3 emails/messages a month from transgender people telling me how important my books were to them. A lot of these people have told me they never read anything else like my books and that it helped them accept themselves. Some of these people have been as young as 13.

4. I find it inspiring to believe that independent artists can succeed despite the climate of the publishing world. I don’t have any of the traditional assistance or funding that most authors possess. It’s just me on my laptop. And yet the internet has enabled me to reach thousands of readers in the past 2 years. Please help me continue on this journey, and I will continue to write as best and as truthfully as I am able.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don’t donate, you can still help. Please help spread the word! And follow me @ elliottdeline.com or facebook.com/authorelliottdeline to keep up to date on my newest projects and when I may be visiting your town.

Thank you so much everybody!

story:
Дорогие друзья!

Мы - команда организаторов проекта "25-летия AIESEC в России" - рады представить наш специальный проект в честь этого знаменательного события - книга "The Story that empowers".

AIESEC - это люди. И рассказывать об AIESEC и его истории могут только они. Именно поэтому мы решили создать книгу, которая расскажет о ключевых событиях из истории организации, а так же соберет в себе истории ее выпускников, стажеров, руководителей проектов, которые поведают о своем опыте в организации и после нее. Страницы книги расскажу о том, какой вклад организация сделала в нашу страну и в  каждого человека, который с ней соприкоснулся. 

    Для издания более 1000 экземпляров книги, которые во время празднования 25-летия мы хотим вручить выпускникам, айсекерам и всем кто помогал AIESEC, необходимо 700 000 рублей. Планируемые источники финансирования:
    • поиск компании-партнера 
    • получение скидки на издание книги у издательства/типографии
    • дотационная помощь от членов организации и ее выпускников
    Основные статьи расходов:
    • перевод книги на английский язык
    • дизайн
    • печать книги
    Если количества собранных средств будет недостаточно, то будет напечатано меньшее количество экземпляров, а для желающих будет организована печать под заказ. Так же книга будет размещена на онлайн ресурсах.
    Мы верим, что эти истории смогу вдохновить еще много молодых ребят, дадут им веру в себя и помогут достичь большего,  поэтому рассчитываем на помощь выпускников и членов организации.

      Как еще можно помочь проекту

      Вы также можете помочь нам, рассказав об этой инициативе друзьям и знакомым, возможно кто-то из них откликнется и окажет нам помощь!

      Заранее огромное спасибо всем желающим оказать поддержку!
story_txt:
Дорогие друзья! Мы - команда организаторов проекта "25-летия AIESEC в России" - рады представить наш специальный проект в честь этого знаменательного события - книга "The Story that empowers".

дотационная помощь от членов организации и ее выпускников

Основные статьи расходов:

перевод книги на английский язык
дизайн
печать книги

Если количества собранных средств будет недостаточно, то будет напечатано меньшее количество экземпляров, а для желающих будет организована печать под заказ. Так же книга будет размещена на онлайн ресурсах.


Мы верим, что эти истории смогу вдохновить еще много молодых ребят, дадут им веру в себя и помогут достичь большего,  поэтому рассчитываем на помощь выпускников и членов организации.

  Как еще можно помочь проекту Вы также можете помочь нам, рассказав об этой инициативе друзьям и знакомым, возможно кто-то из них откликнется и окажет нам помощь!
Заранее огромное спасибо всем желающим оказать поддержку!

story:
*** Please go to our new campaign for February ***

Help us raise enough each month to fund a central campaign headquarters and intensive canvassing. 

The Westminster constituency of Glasgow South West stretches from the Clyde at Govan to the city boundaries at the south and west. It comprises all of the Greater Pollok and Craigton wards and part of the Govan ward. 

The current MP is Ian Davidson but having secured a majority Yes vote across Glasgow, not least in the Glasgow Pollok and Glasgow Southside Scottish Parliamentary constituencies, we intend to unseat him and elect an SNP representative.

Please give what you can to fund our campaigning...

story:
First, a BIG Thank You to Rawganique.com

The Perks provided in this campaign need to be highlighted.  Every item is hand-made with organic, GMO-free, small-scale, sweatshop-free, chemical-free hemp.  A TON of research went into finding a company that represented an environmental consciousness that reflects that of Project Eco-Quest.

Please visit www.rawganique.com to learn about over 1000 organic products they make themselves.  For specific information on the products selected for our Perks, click on the "Bath" tab.

Also, check out their YouTube page

Rawganique on YouTube

HUGE Thanks to Klaus and his team at Rawganique.  They are truly living the dream.


Project Eco-Quest:  Today

After establishing bank accounts and organizing administrative duties, the first challenge we must rise to is being approved for 501c(3), non-profit status.  This will allow greater flexibility with fundraisers, and launch us into grant-making activities.

Project Eco-Quest:  Tomorrow

The following step will be to apply for grants and hold fundraisers to gain funding for a veggie-waste-oil fueled RV as a vehicle to visit top Artist Residencies. Through interviews, tours, and hands-on experience, we will collect information about the benefits and challenges that exist in these places.  Additionally, we will examine where sustainability practices work on-site to lower operating costs and bring benefit to the residents. Using a deep understanding of sustainability and ecotourism, alongside personal experiences on the research tour, we will fuse the data into a full length book for publishing.

The entire experience will be chronicled through blogging and video.


Project Eco-Quest:  Long Term

A Self-Sustaining Artist Residency where the residents double as workshop instructors and mentors for apprentice residents. Both groups of talented and inspired individuals are provided room & board as well as supplies in exchange for the educational services they provide to guests. An on-site Eco-Resort provides upscale accommodations for guests with packages including workshops, guest speakers, materials, locally sources organic meals, and holistic healing for total wellness.

What We Need

For the time being, there are three specific buckets in which all funding will land:

1.  $2500.00 - 501(c)(3) Status Filing Fees, Accountant, and Admin Costs

2.  $25,000 - Artist Residencies of America, Sustainability, and Ecotourism Research Tour (Including multimedia documentation, and all writing staff)

3. $250,000 - Purchase land and build Prototype Artist Residency/EcoResort to begin implementation of philosophies and concepts explored in research and writing.  This will include "tiny houses," a bunk house, and a main lodge.


    The Impact

    The ultimate goal is to intelligently fuse the information collected on the research tour into a book which can be used as the basis of data for an optimized, self-sustaining, Ecotourism philosophy based Artist Residency/EcoResort hybrid.  As a published work, the book will serve as a resource in the Artist Residency industry as well as throughout Ecotourism channels worldwide.  As we keep a close eye on the balance and metrics of this new type of ecosystem, we can improve as we duplicate the model into additional locations.


      Risks & Challenges

      Ecotourism Policy is a big part of what makes this project so ambitious.  These policies are discussed and negotiated from the highest levels of United Nations meetings to the town hall meetings in even the smallest communities.  The main points focus on how tourism and travel will affect a local ecosystem, a local community, and the environment at large.  Our society has entered a time where it is no longer acceptable to move forward without analysis of a travel destination's impact.  We must approach travel, tourism, and community with a holistic vision for harmonious stewardship with Nature and the Earth.

      The challenges with Ecotourism are paradigm based.  Though the core philosophies have been around for over 20 years in an official capacity, many businesses and individuals do not understand the positive impact that championing for Ecotourism awareness will have.  The population at large does not fully understand the true role of stewardship and careful design required to strike a balance between industry, the environment, and fulfilling lifestyles for members of a harmonious community.  However, the sustainable travel dream, through Ecotourism efforts like Project Eco-Quest, is within reach.

      The path ahead is simply a series of small changes.  When presented and understood holistically, the changes become long-term sustainability solutions instead of something that may at first appear as a restriction, compromise, or sacrifice.  How our world does business is changing every day.  The simple fact is that some industries will have a harder time adjusting to stewardship than others.  Ecotourism will not only lead by example, it will be an industry that facilitates the necessary changes on a global scale.


        Other Ways You Can Help

        If you are unable to help out financially right now, please have a look at some other ways you can spread the word:

        Project Eco-Quest Website
        www.projectecoquest.com

        Please share our non-profit's website which contains links to additional options for contribution, or just share it to raise awareness of this vision.  While you're there, please remember to LIKE us on Facebook, and subscribe to the newsletter.

        LinkUpLevelUp Blog
        linkuplevelup.wordpress.com

        Please share our blog on connecting musicians, artists, writers, and holistic healers with one another for training and knowledge sharing.  If you know anyone in the creative arts, please send them our way!  Once the Residency/Resort is open and functioning, we will need lots of help from talented creatives looking to BOOST their skills and careers.  While you're there, please remember to LIKE us on Facebook, and subscribe to the newsletter.

story:
¿Qué?

Las Ruinas de Valhalla es una novela que trata de personas normales, o quizás no tanto, en busca de sus sueños olvidados y promesas incumplidas.

Mara lleva seis meses junto a Jon y se siente feliz al lado de un hombre atento, cariñoso y educado como él. Aun así, después de todo este tiempo, Mara apenas conoce nada sobre el pasado del hombre al que ama. Una noche, ya cansada de evasivas, Mara insiste a Jon para que le cuente la historia de su vida. Durante esa noche, Mara descubre un pasado lleno de luces y sombras escuchando la historia de su pareja  con la ayuda de una caja llena de recuerdos.

Así empieza Las Ruinas de Valhalla, un viaje a través del tiempo, una mirada al pasado, en la que un antiguo integrante de una banda de Heavy Metal vuelve a liberar sus demonios interiores, unos demonios que, hasta ese día, creía muertos y enterrados.

Are you ready?

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Maese Pako.

Este es el pseudónimo tras el que podemos encontrar a Pako Santos, un profesor de educación secundaria que compagina su labor docente con la vocación literaria que practica desde los dieciséis años.

Lector empedernido, incansable observador del género humano y airoso superviviente de una dilatada carrera como músico en diversas bandas de Heavy Metal, ha publicado diversos relatos cortos en diferentes concursos de ámbito nacional e internacional, siendo este su primer asalto al género de la novela.

Sin duda alguna Maese Pako, narra cosas con conocimiento de causa.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 850€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.
  • E incluso podrías asistir a un concierto-presentación de la novela.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Las Ruinas de Valhalla que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Maese Pako vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
We did it! 100% funded and growing!

Wow, three days and we're fully funded . . . what now? Now, we shower our generosity on our friends, our local libraries, and on scholarships to Rivera Sun workshops! With great, joyous hearts, we thank everyone for being so miraculous and invite newcomers to go "beyond the beyond" as it says in the Heart Sutra, supporting and uplifting a whole community through our love.

Three New Perks to Share the Blessings

"Love Your Library" - A copy for your home library; and a copy for your local library. Rivera Sun practically lived in her local library as a kid . . . and has been a card-carrying member of a public library since the age of five. Let's give a book to your local community through the "Love Your Library" perk.

"One for You; One for a Friend" - Grab coffee, a good book (Billionaire Buddha) and get together for a real treat of a conversation! Send a copy to  your friend and spend some quality time together discussing love, life, and the whole darn thing.

"Awaken the World Scholarship Fund" - Get a copy of the Billionaire Buddha and give someone else the gift of a workshop on creativity, art, change-making, nonviolence, or strengthening community self-reliance. Rivera Sun is on tour nationwide with her Seeds of Change Tour. At every one of the 40+ cities, she offers scholarships to her workshop. Here's one way to truly help awaken the world!

Billionaire Buddha - Awakening the 100%

You can become a part of the community that publishes Billionaire Buddha!

It takes courageous people to publish world-changing books. Ordinary, extraordinary people came together last year to support Rivera Sun's novel, The Dandelion Insurrection. Thousands of readers across the world are being inspired by the story. 

Now it's our turn.

Rivera Sun, "the author of the story of our times", strikes again with this powerful novel about wealth, class, connection and love. Inspired by a true story, told with the vibrant imagery and poetic prose you love in Rivera's writing, Billionaire Buddha is a novel of heart, soul, and incredible transformation!

Billionaire Buddha: from fabulous wealth to unlimited blessings, the price of enlightenment may bankrupt billionaire Dave Grant. Emotionally destitute in the prime of his career, he searches for love and collides with Joan Hathaway. The encounter rattles his soul and unravels his world. Capitalism, property, wealth, mansions: his notions of success crumble into dust. From toasting champagne on top of the world to swigging whiskey with bums in the gutter, Dave Grant's journey is an unforgettable ride that leaves you cheering!

       "Come hear my story; come listen to the truth about my wealth; come see me for a human being, not a former billionaire  . . .  come give me a chance to be worthy in your eyes." - Billionaire Buddha

You're invited to be one of the courageous people who publish this book!

Contribute a small or large amount. The People's Publishing Campaign honors everyone's contribution as we all work together to bring this book into the world. Each perk sends you a unique gratitude gift straight from Rivera Sun's wild creativity. From "The True Story of the Billionaire Buddha" to her own personal adaptation of "The Heart Sutra" to handwritten letters, Rivera pours her heart into her thank-you gifts to you … and reaches out personally to connect!

"We're all the eye of the Universe - what will happen when we all wake up?"

A Message From Rivera Sun . . .

Greetings everyone! Thank you! Billionaire Buddha is an amazing adventure from start to finish. I love that you're joining in at the People's Publishing stage. Read the novel before anyone else and tell everyone you know! Be part of the adventure of releasing the First Edition! Share the quotes, tell a friend, support the publishing of the First Edition, donate to the vision; there are many ways to join in the fun! I welcome every bit of participation, large or small, and thank you all deeply from the bottom of my heart.  

I am honored to be part of the new generation of 'interdependent' authors that have moved beyond 'independent' to embrace our connection to our readers and supporters. Billionaire Buddha comes into the world through the love and support of People's Publishers around the world! Thank you! 

"The dignity of all human beings resides in our kindness to one another." 

Meet the Man Who Inspired 

the Billionaire Buddha…

Dariel Garner is a former member of the 0.01%. Through conversations with Rivera Sun about his personal journey of giving his millions away, the story  of the Billionaire Buddha emerged. If you are an awakening Billionaire Buddha, a member of the 1% who has been looking for an opportunity like this, help us publish the book, tell the story of the truth from on top of the world, and meet author Rivera Sun and Dariel Garner in person. Thank you! 

"Who has more opportunity to awaken? The prince in the palace who never sees suffering? Or the pauper who drowns in the river of life?" - Billionaire Buddha

We can be reached at info@risingsundancetheater.com

Other Ways You Can Help

If you'd like to offer something beyond value - ideas, inspirations, ways to get the word out - or even if you have only love to offer, send me an email: info@risingsundancetheater.com or contact me on Facebook (Rivera Sun) and Twitter (@RiveraSunAuthor). Everyone is appreciated on this journey!

Thank You! Every gift is a blessing.

"Can you imagine? the mountains echoed. Imagine, the wind sighed. Imagine, the grasses whispered. Imagine, the earth hummed. Imagine that a man - a world - could change so much that he begins to speak in poetry. Imagine that one generation could change the course of all the generations of humanity yet to come. Imagine that the human story does not end in the chapter of today."

Like this idea?  Share it on Facebook.  Friends love being involved in uplifting, change-the-world projects ... don't leave them out of the fun!

Imagine, the earth hummed. Imagine that
a man - a world - could change so much that he begins to speak in poetry.
Imagine that one generation could change the course of all the generations of
humanity yet to come. Imagine that the human story does not end in the chapter
of today."
Like this idea?  Share it on Facebook.  Friends love being involved in uplifting, change-the-world projects ... don't leave them out of the fun!

story:
I am struggling writer trying  to complete a novel based in 1980s Kashmir  and follows the life of two childhood friends, Vidya and Daria who grew up in the peaceful valley of Kashmir, enjoying the same amusements and parental care, but forced to make different choices as adults that would test their loyalty to their principles and each other, when the two are at varience.

The story is attempt to bring forth the socio-political environment of 1980s and the politics of South Asia that shaped the lives of the people living in the valley.  The story is an attempt to trace the forces beyond the control of the common man and showcase the dilemmas and choices that the Kashmiri population had to make everyday to do what was right and yet survive.

I do not offer any perks or any other incentives for contributing to this project, expect my heart felt thanks for your generosity and kindness. I was sucessful in raising money for the first phase of this project that enabled me to get access to many historical resources that would ensure true accuracy of the time I attempt to depict.  In this second effort  I am trying to raise money to make a trip to Kashmir and get a better understanding of the land and its people so that I can make this work of fiction as authentic as possible. I do appreciate any amount that you can spare and I understand that you may be sacrificing some of your other needs to make this happen. I am humbled by your efforts and kindness.

story:
Short Summary

In Search of Emiline is the final book of a two-part series and documentary about the life of Emiline Watts Brewer, my great-grandmother. After first being introduced to Emiline’s story, I immediately knew that she epitomized the many struggles of former slaves who were determined to move forward with new lives as freed people. Despite the hardships she endured as a slave, she persevered, succeeded despite the odds and went on to live a remarkable life. Her success has encouraged scores of her descendants to achieve and greatly contribute to society.

 

Emiline Watts Brewer

 

Unlike many women of her time, Emiline had a profession as a respected midwife who delivered both black and white babies in her town. So inspired by her work, one of her grandsons who tagged along behind her and carried her bag when she went to help mothers with their deliveries became a health professional. Another grandson was one of the first African Americans to graduate from Northwestern School of Dentistry. A third grandson graduated from Meharry Medical School (now Meharry Medical College) and became a physician; a fourth was a pharmacist.

Although Emiline was denied education during slavery, she stressed its importance and the power of knowledge in liberating a person. She passed this message down to her descendants who valued also education and excelled in their professions.

 

 

Emiline’s civic-minded husband Robert Brewer purchased land and built the Oro United Methodist Church when former slaves refused to sit in a local church’s segregated balcony. Following in his footsteps, Emiline who was concerned that Black children had to walk too far to attend a neighboring church, asked her son Isaiah to portion off some of the Brewer land and build the Wesley Chapel Church (now the Wesley Chapel United Methodist Church). Not far from the church, the Brewers built the Wesley Chapel School, one of the famous Rosenwald schools. The family owned, ran and taught at another Rosenwald school- The Colored School in Guess. The Rosenwald schools are now National Historic sites.

 

 

Emiline built the Wesley Chapel United Methodist Church in 1904

 

 

 Two years ago on the same day as the dedication of the memorial in Washington, D.C. to honor Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. who once dreamed the descendants
of slaves and slave owners would meet one day, Emiline’s story became full
circle. A group of her descendants met with members of her slave owner’s family.

 

 The two families remain united around Emiline. They have known about her and their relationship to the Brewers since childhood. Today, we constantly email, telephone or visit each other. And just recently, I was contacted by branch of the Watts family-the descendants of Jerome Watts. He was the son of Thomas H. Watts and brother of Townley Blair Watts. These family members also knew about Emiline and their relationship to the Brewers.

See more about the Brewers and Watts families..Robert and Emiline, their children, their accomplishments, the Watts children, Watts descendants, etc......at the Gallery!!!
 

Jerome Watts, Thomas H. Watts’ son

 

I have been very dedicated to working on the In Search of Emiline project for the past two years.


I am a writer who has written several books including: A View from the Top:
the Inspiring Success Stories of 15 Black CEOs, Business Leaders and Entrepreneurs (CMI Business Books); Success Strategies for African Americans (Dutton); The Black Woman’s Career Guide (Doubleday); Careers For Women Without College Degrees (McGraw-Hill); How To Change Careers (Putnam). To date, Children Go Where I Send Thee: The Brewers Uncover Their Roots, one of the books in the In Search of Emiline two-part series has already been completed.  The second book is about 50% finished and provides more fascinating information about Emiline’s story. The documentary is in pre-production.


Why We Need The Funding? 

 

The main focus of my project is to finish the second book in our series and
also preproduction of the In Search of Emiline documentary. Up until now, I have personally paid for all the research, writing and production costs in association with the first book. As I am getting closer to completing the second book about Emiline, I will need your help in raising additional funds to publish, print and convert it into paperback, hardcover and as an e-book. The raised funds will also go for completing pre-production of the In Search of Emiline documentary. To accomplish finishing this stage, I am presently in the process of planning, scripting, storyboarding, selecting vintage footage,preparing for shooting in South Carolina, developing a filming schedule, choosing musical compositions to be used, script-locking for finalization, etc. In the future, we will begin filming more of the Brewer and Watts family members as well as a historian specializing in the AnteBellum South, scenes in Chesterfield County, etc.


SOME NOTEWORTHY DESCENDANTS OF EMILINE:

 

The Brewers claim scores of teachers, physicians, dentists, pharmacist, attorneys, architects, musicians, ministers, government workers, a puppeteer, an engineer and many others. Some of our most notable family members include:

Third Generation Brewers:

  

Reverend Dr. Thomas Elliot Huntley, leader of the first Negro Ministers’ Prayer March On Washington and friend of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.

 

 Arthur Brewer, Sr., President, Chesterfield County Garment Corp.

 

Nannie and Thomas Brewer ran one of two Brewers’ Rosenwald schools

 

 Lincoln Brewer (with wife Juanita) was first Black motorman with NYC Tranist.

 

 

 Attorney Walter B. Nivens famous “Elmer Davis” case heard by the U.S. Supreme Court and won. 

 

 

Fourth Generation Brewers:

 

Tuskegee Airman Second Lt. Robert C. Robinson, Jr. was killed in action at age 22.

 

 

Dr. Charles Herbert Flowers, Jr., a Tuskegee Airman and primary flight instructor.  The Charles H. Flowers High School in Springdale, Maryland is named in his honor.

 

Fifth Generation Brewers:

                                 

  Actress and Comediene Kym Whitley and Jonathan Whitley “Raising Whitley” on OWN.

 

 VIDEO CREDITS:


Jean Rene Ella who gave us permission to use his incredible music for the video.

Slaves on Smith Plantation, 1862. Photo by T.H. O'Sullivan. Public domain.

http://www/shmoop.com/civil-war/photo-slaves-plantation.html

Emiline’s obituary…Permission given by Editor, Pageland Progressive Journal

Black and White Soldiers. Brandy Station, VA, February 1864. Unknown photographer. Public domain.

http://www.shmoop.com/civil-war/photo-black-white-soldiers.html

Lincoln picture...

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:AbrahamLincoln_head_on_shoulders_photo_portrait.jpeg

The March on Washington at the Lincoln Memorial, August 28, 1963. Public domain. http://www.shmoop.com/civil-rights-desegregation/photo-lincoln-washington.html

Many thanks to Filmmaker Louise Fleming (Witney and I).

 

PHOTO CREDITS:

Kym Whitley's photo courtesy of Dwayne_with__name.

Second Lt. Robert C. Robinson' s photo courtesy of the Craig Huntly Collection.

Thanks to the Charles Herbert Flowers High School for Dr. Flowers' photo.

Special thanks to Vanessa Brewer-Tyson, Nelda Brewer Davis for family photos and videos of the Watts; Venise Wallace for photos.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, please help us in other ways:

  • Post information about In Search of Emiline on your Facebook and let your friends know about it.
  • Tweet about it.
  • Send emails to your friends letting them know of the project.

Send emails to your friends letting them know of the project.

story:
I'm Alice, a native Brit who has lived in Northern California since 1998.  Late last year I abandoned San Francisco and moved to Sonoma Co. to live a slow food lifestyle. My new blog, Alice Dishes, will chronicle my personal adventures and lessons learned trying to live a real food/slow food lifestyle. I'll also write reviews and share tips in a section called "Alice Bites", which will cover suppliers, chefs, restaurants, food, and even kitchen gadgets, in the real food world.

Sure, I could have put up a hobbyist blog on Tumblr, but that would have been far too easy. I want to create a beautiful, entertaining and informative site, and potentiallly turn this project into a book down the road, so I'm raising funds to design, develop and launch my own site.

Your contributions will be used to pay my awesome designer, who helped me come up with the Alice Dishes logo and created the layout of the blog, my fab web developer and my highly critical writing coach who's ensuring that this really is a blog you'll want to read. I don't need much, but if you can spare a few cents, I'll be forever grateful. After all, it would be too ironic to be a starving food writer. And if I don't raise my entire goal, I still plan to launch (but don't let that hold you back).

If you can't donate hard cash, then you can still help me get the word out about www.alicedishes.com after it launches which should be within a couple of weeks.

For a taste of Alice Dishes, read on:

The Fast Road to Slow Food

"Late last year I uprooted the merry band that is my family – my third-grader son and our two black Labs I call “The Muppets” – from our long-time home in San Francisco. Our destination was South Sonoma County, just thirty minutes north of the Golden Gate bridge–a land literally rich in milk and honey, not to mention free range chickens and their golden-yoked eggs, bountiful organic fruits and vegetables, and vineyards along every highway. 

"It wasn’t a decision that I took lightly, or for that matter, one that came easily. We were leaving a lot behind: a jewel of a home that I had painstakingly restored from top to bottom believing I would live out my days under its roof; our friends; a loving school community, and proximity to my day job, which mostly revolves around Silicon Valley. Not to mention San Francisco itself, a place I think of as the food capital of the world.

"Yet I yearned for a Slow Food lifestyle that would allow me to buy seasonal fresh veggies straight from the farm and procure pastured meat from the place it was born, grazed and made ready for my table.  I hoped to hone my skills in the kitchen by cooking only what was in season: finding 101 ways to turn zucchini into a tasty meal was a problem I was dying to have. I wanted my son to grow up knowing where his food came from: seeing carrots at the farm store complete with their flouncy green tops and still muddy from the field, not packaged in convenient bite-sized pieces."

To enjoy the rest of this essay, and enjoy many others, you'll have to wait until the official launch of Alice Dishes - hopefully, just in time for Thanksgiving.

story:
We did it! What’s next?

Great news everybody! Thanks to your generosity, I’ve reached my goal of raising the money I need to publish A Dance to Freedom. I’ve been working on this book for several years, and I can’t tell you how much your support means to me at this amazing moment. Because of you, more people will have access to the work of Alice Miller through my story. Just think, your contribution may help free someone from an emotional prison. Your support may help someone find the freedom to be themselves for the first time. And your belief in this project may even save a life — or several lives. I really can’t thank you enough for your confidence in this, my life’s work. I hope you know how important this is, not only to me but also to our society as a whole.

Now that we’ve reached our goal, I’d like to set another one. If we can raise another $7,500 in the remaining days of the campaign, I’ll upgrade everyone’s signed paperback copy of my book to a signed hardcover copy. Please help me spread the word!

No matter where the campaign ends up on March 11, you’ve already made it a success. I can’t wait to start providing you with project progress reports as we begin the design and publishing process and move toward a July release date. I love you all, and I thank you from the bottom of my heart for making my dream of helping others a reality.

Sylvie Imelda Shene, March 2, 2014

Help me free the world from lies and illusions.

Hi. I’m Sylvie Imelda Shene. For years, I was trapped in an emotional prison caused by traumas I faced as the youngest of 10 children growing up in a poor village in Portugal. I was able to escape my family, but years later, when I was a topless dancer at a gentleman’s club in Phoenix, Arizona, I met a man who triggered the feelings of anger and fear that were buried deep inside me, and pushed me into the depths of despair.

Alice Miller saved my life.

This toxic relationship led me to the works of psychologist Alice Miller. Her words spoke to me in a way that no one else had been able to. And believe me, I had tried everything from 12-step programs and self-help books to meditation and yoga.

Alice Miller did so much for me, and I was fortunate enough to communicate with her directly on numerous occasions before her death in 2010. She inspired me to tell my story, so more people could break free from the lies and illusions that prevent them from being true to themselves.

I'm passionate about helping others face their childhood traumas.

If someone had told me 30 years ago that this poor girl from rural Portugal would be living in America and writing a book, I’d have thought they were crazy. But here I am with a finished manuscript in hand, filled with personal stories from my dancing career plus wisdom that can help liberate people from the pain of the past.

With your help, I’ll raise $17,500 or more to turn my manuscript into a real book within the next six months. The money I raise through this campaign will cover the costs of design, editing, production and printing — and hopefully shipment to you!

Thank you so much for your support.

In exchange for your support, you’ll be among the first to receive this life-changing book, which is part memoir and part how-to guide. Each chapter gives you important steps to take on your own path to freedom. I’m also offering extra perks to show my gratitude, everything from your name in the acknowledgements to a seat at my table during the official book-release party.

Thank you so much for contributing and/or sharing this campaign with people who can benefit from my story. Your support could change someone’s life dramatically…Maybe even your own!

Special Thanks!
So many people have already helped me get to this point, and I want them all to know how much I appreciate their efforts. Huge hugs go to the management of The Little Woody in Phoenix, for letting me shoot the trailer shown above in their amazing bar and restaurant. That place rocks!

I also want to thank Charles Peterson for shooting and editing all the video, with a shout out to Chris Willembrecht for all his help, as well. Carrie Fee and Carl Calabrese captured the essence of me and my boyfriend back in the day, and I thank them for their wonderful acting abilities. I also want to thank my friend Kianté, who dj'd for me at Bourbon Street, for stepping up as the MC. For making the set look crowded, I owe a debt of gratitude to Eric O'Neill, Paul Wilson, Perry Herst, Steve Furedy, Xzetera Retterer and Eric Massey. 

Finally, the manuscript would never have been possible without the writing talents of Ed Sweet and Jon Roemer. Thanks so much guys!

life-changing book, which is part memoir and part how-to guide. Each chapter
gives you important steps to take on your own path to freedom. I’m also offering extra perks to show my gratitude,
everything from your name in the acknowledgements to a seat at my table during
the official book-release party. 
Thank you so much for
contributing and/or sharing this campaign with people who can benefit
from my story. Your support could change someone’s life dramatically…Maybe even
your own!Special Thanks!So many people have already helped me get to this point, and I want them all to know how much I appreciate their efforts. Huge hugs go to the management of The Little Woody in Phoenix, for letting me shoot the trailer shown above in their amazing bar and restaurant. That place rocks! I also want to thank Charles Peterson for shooting and editing all the video, with a shout out to Chris Willembrecht for all his help, as well. Carrie Fee and Carl Calabrese captured the essence of me and my boyfriend back in the day, and I thank them for their wonderful acting abilities. I also want to thank my friend Kianté, who dj'd for me at Bourbon Street, for stepping up as the MC. For making the set look crowded, I owe a debt of gratitude to Eric O'Neill, Paul Wilson, Perry Herst, Steve Furedy, Xzetera Retterer and Eric Massey.  Finally, the manuscript would never have been possible without the writing talents of Ed Sweet and Jon Roemer. Thanks so much guys!

story:
My Story

My name is April Stallworth.  I am a Christian Life Coach, Founder of the God's Uttermost Woman Ministry, Mother of a Teenage Daughter and a Woman of God.  These are the positions I am most proud of and where God can use me the best.  I am passionate about equipping, motivating and empowering the women of God to know who they are in Him.  I want them to know that they are royalty because they are Daughters of the King. God is so in love with them and has tremendous plans for their future.  I know, because I am a living testimony of his grace and mercy.  I am living my best life now and I am called to help other women do the same.  I know that I can do this in a major way through the self-publishing of my first 2 books. 

The Impact

These books will be used as a vehicle for hope, inspiration, encouragement and awareness.  Women will begin to see, think and behave in ways they never have before.  Women will begin to connect with God or deepen their current relationship with Him.  This will result in a greater confidence, stronger self-esteem and the finding of purpose for their lives.  Armed with that, women are less likely to fall into abusive relationships, depression, isolation, negative self-talk, sexual indiscretions or living up to the stereotypes of this world.  I am so sick and tired of the images we see on reality television, music videos and in song lyrics.  Those things don't represent the true essence of the virtuous women that God created us to be.  Now is the time to make a change.  Our culture is in serious trouble.  I'm not willing to sit idly by and let God's women continue to be hurt.  I know these books and my speaking to and with women will have a tremendous impact on their future.  Women just need the tools and resources in order to become who God intended them to be. 

What I Need & What You Get

The amount of money raised from this campaign will go directly towards the self-publishing of my first two books.  The first book is entitled, "It Wasn't Always That Way", which is a daily devotional book for women that will encourage and inspire them.  It is a collection of a year long devotional that I wrote in 2008.  I received such tremendous feedback each day the devotional was sent out.  I know women were relating to my daily struggles and triumphs as I walked with God.  I want to be able to expose this book to the masses of women who need a daily word of encouragement.  My second book is entitled, "Finding the Relationship of Your Dreams".  This book is my life's testimony.  It chronicles how I came to know the greatest love of my life, God.  I reveal to women how the longing in their heart will never be filled by a man, a career, a child or any material thing that they may have previously tried to use.  Instead, that place within them is reserved solely for God.  I learned that life lesson after a series of painful relationships and poor choices.  But thanks be unto God, that is not the end of my story.  My story is one of healing, wholeness, security, stability, purpose, vision and triumph that I want to share with the world.  If I don't reach my goal in this forum, I will use whatever is raised towards my self-publishing project and truly believe that God will make up the difference.  I know that whatever God ordains, He provides for.   

Other Ways You Can Help

"The effective prayer of a righteous man can accomplish much" (James 5:16)  I know that prayer changes things.  Your prayers are powerful and I need them now more than ever.  I also need your support to get the word out about this campaign.  Please forward this information to everyone in your circle of influence.  There are share tools right here on this page so that you can post this campaign on the various social media outlets.  In advance, I thank you for your love, support and prayers. I appreciate them more than you will ever know.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Niccolea Miouo Nance and I am a poet and painter currently residing in Phoenix, Arizona. I have only within the last few years begun the transition into full-time artist and this August was invited to sail around the world with a friend and as a writer I just couldn't pass it up!

I have never been on a boat in the ocean or even sailed so this is going to be a grand adventure of epic proportions! Like the literal meaning of epic. Like Homer's Oddessy epic. Seriously. Then comes the part where I need to actually get to where the boat is so that this adventure can begin!

This is obviously HUGE for me, but it can be huge for the rest of the world too! We have decided to make this more than just an amazing adventure where we learn to flow with the wind and sea, but we want to actually be a positive addition to a global culture of peace! Your contribution gets me to the beginning of the journey and helps me write the prologue!

 

What I Need & What You Get

I need the funds to get to Oregon and to pay my share for a few months before casting off in late June or early July. This will cover my share of gas money and hotel costs for the one-way road trip from Phoenix, AZ to Astoria, OR (Goonies town!) and will help pay for the dock fees and electricity and food while I learn to sail.

To encourage giving, I will provide prints of my artwork in various sizes as perks! THANKS SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I get that sometimes you just can't give cash. So if you could please share this campain, that would be great as well! Use those indiegogo share tools! :-)
 
Also, there is a facebook page for the trip. If you could please like our page that would be super great too!
https://www.facebook.com/TheEmunaEndeavor

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Lori Hanson, an award-winning author, coach and motivational speaker. I started Learn2Balance five years ago with a mission to help people improve their quality of life holistically. I've spoken to many thousands of women, college students and teens and regardless of their situation in life stress is a root cause. That's why I created my Stress Survival Kit series.

Stress is a huge issue for strong, driven, working women who juggle many roles in life. When I tell women about this book, they all want a copy right now, "I need to read that book!" I've heard over and over. Several women have asked to be on the list to get one of the first copies.

So I've started an Indiegogo campaign to ask for your help to get the book designed, published and promote it nationally. The book is 95% written and with your contributions I'll reach my goal of having it available for my fall women's programs. As much as I love being a keynote speaker, 60-90 minutes doesn't always sink in over the long haul. The audience needs a book to take home with them to continue to study and connect with the Learn2Balance message to reduce stress, live in the moment and enjoy life.

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign will help us cover book production costs, printing and a national publicity campaign. The good news is I have a great team of people I've worked with on my three previous books that do my covers, design and printing. I haven't done a big publicity tour since my first book, It Started with Pop-Tarts came out. But my favorite publicist who gets great results is ready and waiting to help me once again. And because this book has a broader appeal than Pop-Tarts which was about bulimia, the national stage is very reachable for publicity.

My goal is to raise $9,850. This will cover production costs, printing of 500 books and a three city tour plus promoting in New York on the morning talk shows. It also include national radio publicity campaign. The budget breaks down as follows:

Book Production:

  • $   175 Book cover (brand is already established so this is small)
  • $1,200 Book design         
  • $   750 Editor                     
  • $1,250 Printing (500 books)       

$3,350 Total Production

Book Publicity Campaign & Three City Tour

  • $2100 Publicity three cities (San Francisco, Los Angeles, Chicago)
  • $1500 Publicity National TV (New York)
  • $2500 Publicity National Radio (35-40 shows)
  • $  250 Press Kit                               
  • $1250 Travel (3 cities)                  

$5500 Total Publicity Campaign

  • $1000 Shipping Indiegogo gifts

$9850 Budget Grand Total                      

Stretch Goal
This budget is obviously grass roots as it only includes printing 500 books, and a lot of those will be shared with my Indiegogo contributors. Our stretch goal is $14,500, that will allow us to print more books (1000-1500) add pictures and illustrations in the book and include a fourth city in the publicity tour (Phoenix or Seattle)

Cool Perks for You!
We've created some totally cool perks for you. If you donate $10 you get a copy of the book in ebook form. You'll notice the wolf theme throughout the perks as that ties into the message in the book. Wolf packs and human packs and how they relate to each other.

We've included some fun packages that range from book copies, to DVDs of my recent Women Who Rock Seminars (Rock Your Mindset, Rock Your Passion). You'll also find packages that include free subscriptions for our Balance for Busy Women Program. This is a monthly mailer that's delivered to your doorstep, or that of an alpha female you know who needs regular inspiration and reminders about balance and living in the moment. Our members love the content we share including the special guest interviews with celebs and practitioners.

One of the best perks we're providing is a free ticket to our first annual Learn2Balance Professional Women's Retreat in Golden, Colorado on September 28th. Nine speakers on one stage and all there to help women relax, network with like-minded women and have some fun. These sessions include variety with interactive segments, you won't just be listening to people talk all day. You'll leave empowered, energized and relaxed. Our tag line is Set Your SELF F.R.E.E. (Find Relaxation, Energy & Empowerment)

We've got awesome wolf pack perks for you because we are truly grateful to have your support so we can help the women who are struggling day-to-day to find peace, relaxation and joy in their lives. And just think, if you're the husband or other half how much easier it will be for you when they figure it out!

Partial Goal
If for some reason we don't reach our full goal, I'll use the money you contribute to take the process as far as I can. I'll cut back on the publicity tour if needed and find other creative ways to share the book. However, I'm confident that working together we'll reach the goal for this project.

The Impact this Project Will Have

There is a strong need and demand for this information and this book. Not just because of stress, but from the misconception that being an alpha female is simply mirroring masculine traits. Being a strong leader is more than being aggressive and snarling at those who stand in your way. Often times when women "come on too strong" they are labeled a bitch, and it isn't as a compliment to an alpha female!

I've included interviews with four successful alpha females in this book. They agreed to share their story as examples of what happens when you lead by caring about and looking out for the pack. Mirroring wolf traits. These interviews include:

  • Dawn Gallagher, a model who appeared on over 300 magazine covers, a best-selling author, mom and now TV host in New York.
  • Dr. Cathie-Ann Lippman, who practices alternative medicine in Beverly Hills, California.
  • Victoria and Annette Quintana, two sisters who co-founded Istonish, Inc., and work together as CEO and Chairman, respectively in Greenwood Village, Colorado.

All of these women have unique business and life experiences they share that will enlighten, inspire and motivate readers to seek a different path as the leader of their pack.

In addition to the interviews this book has lots of stories and anecdotes to relax and entertain the reader so they can begin to see the light. I've purposely made it a lot of fun to read because the topic is a deep one, contemplating lifelong habits and how to shift them to improve your quality of life.

There is a toolkit at the end of each chapter, followed by five affirmations. After reading through, it's a great resource to pick up and find just the message or tip you need for that day.

It is my belief that this book can and will become a best-seller and the message will be shared globally in multiple languages wherever women are struggling to lead and deal with the stress that accompanies the pack.

With healthy, everyday practices, we can succeed and kick ass in life with confidence, compassion, gratitude, balance and health.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you personally are not in a place to contribute financially you can still help out. If you know of women's organization, conferences or gatherings where this book would be a benefit, please let us know and share the information about our campaign.

  • Share the Indiegogo links via Facebook and LinkedIn
  • Tweet information about our campaign and help us get others on board (or on the sled...wolves).

Thank you so much for taking the time to visit, read, watch and understand why this campaign is so important. I am blessed to have you as a part of this process and grateful for your support.

- Lori Hanson

story:
Short Summary

I am a law student preparing for graduation. Before entering law school I was involved in many educational activities which utilized multiple different platforms including distance learning. My dream is to reach and educate citizens concerning their Constitutional Rights. Specifically the historical basis, reasoning behind, importance of protecting, and consequences of losing our Constitutional Rights. 

As A Matter Of Law campaign is to setup the nonprofit organization to reach and teach citizens who do not have or may have minimal information as to our Constitutional Rights. Because an educated citizenry is necessary to a free society and a just government.

What Is Needed & What You Get

  • $25,000 is needed to license A MATTER OF LAW as a nonprofit, setup a website and begin to develop educational materials as well as marketing in order to gain sponsorships.
  • A MATTER OF LAW website will, with your permission, list your name thanking you. 
  • The A MATTER OF LAW website will offer a means for every donor to submit suggestions and input.
  • With $1,000 donation you receive a note thanking all you awesome, awesome people.

THE IMPACT--> Saving Our Constitutional County

A Matter of Law

Encouraging Citizens To:

SEARCH for the TRUTH

ASSESS the FACTS

THINK for THEMSELVES

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t make a monetary contribution, but would like to help:

We need all patriots to spread the word about the A MATTER OF LAW campaign as much as possible! The schedule for this effort is very tight (as our freedoms and liberties are being erroded every day), so as your donations come in, they'll be going right to establishing the nonprofit and developing the educational materials. Indiegogo has wonderful share tools to help!

If you can't help us with a financial donation, we understand. How about some good old-fashioned donation of your time? There is a need for help with promotion, analyzing feedback, and more! This effort is literally a blank canvas, so if you have any ideas on how to make it awesome and want to donate some time that may even turn into a paid position, the contact email is (wearethey@reagan.com) and we'll work something out!

THANK YOU FOR HELPING PRESERVE OUR CONSTITUTIONAL COUNTRY!

All prayers are appreciated!
