story:
In a Nutshell

I've always been interested in stories, so when I had the opportunity to travel to Rwanda 8 years ago, I was determined to find a story. But because the genocide had occurred only 12 years earlier, most Rwandans were still in survival mode. The second time I went, I had the unexpected opportunity to visit a Pygmy tribe where I was able to trade stories. When looking around the country, I noticed there was no library and the books I found in book stores and high end hotels were priced the same as in the United States. Since that visit, Rwanda now has one of the FEW libraries on the continent and many more citizens are going to University for a quality education. On my last visit, I was able to work with the Children's Librarian during International Read Week. I am a professional storyteller and she quickly put me to work, telling stories in 4 different schools and at the library, yet I found no traditional Rwandan stories in the library to tell. With her help, I will be making contacts in the publishing world in Rwanda. I have also made friends with one of the liaisons with the Pygmy tribe just outside of Kigali and will be traveling with him to the tribe to collect stories. I will also be working with a local art studio which currently works with orphans teaching art. I am proposing that we use these children to illustrate the stories I collect from the Pgymies. A portion of the sale of each book will be going to the Pygmy teller and to the student illustrator of each published book. This way, these underprivileged people will have an opportunity to attend University, something for them that is only in dreams. This project will be a win, win for everyone involved.

How Can You Help?

Of course, everything costs money and that's where you come in. I am not working with a non-profit organization; I'm just a regular person doing something I think is worthwhile in this world. Your donation will help with all travel costs, airfare, taxis, bus fares, hotels, food, translators, publishing, and art supplies. Airfare will take the lion's chunk of the donations, usually running between $1,200 and $2,000 depending on the time of year for travel. I will be bringing all of my own art supplies because when I asked about getting something as simple as paper plates for paint, they weren't sure they could find them. Art supplies will be another big expense, along with the hotel costs. Surprisingly, taxis are expensive as well, so I'm going to try and learn the bus system, which usually means learning a basic amount of the Kinyarwandan language. I'll keep you posted on how that goes.

Speaking of that, one thing I'll do for you when you donate is you will receive a running blog of my travels. I've been writing a daily "diary" when I travel and you will receive them along with several photos from the events of the day. Here is an excerpt from one of my visits to the Pygmy people several years ago.

17 Janiver, 2011  ...."I hope to collect a couple more stories. Claude is tall and lean. He coaches and plays soccer (Rwandan football) and is very athletic. He usually does this Sunday mornings and then goes out to see the Pygmies on Sunday afternoons. He doesn’t go out every Sunday and I don’t think they are expecting him this Sunday, but he will go with us. He is not the same Field Operative who went with us last year when we delivered flour and beans. When we get to the end of the bus line, we depart and Claude starts looking for motorcycle taxis. This will definitely be a trip to remember. I have packed plenty of water and my storytelling felt board for my “Legs, Arms, Body” story for the Pygmies. It sticks out of my backpack and I can’t get it all the way closed. I’m afraid with the wind, that it will catch, pull the zipper open and I will lose it. As I mount the motorcycle, I think this might be a problem, so I wrap my arm back around the backpack to keep it closed. This leaves only one hand hanging onto the bar at the back of the motorcycle. I do not need to fear as I think my driver was more afraid than I was. He was so careful that he slowed way down and carefully negotiated the ruts, dodged water puddles, and kept the bike as upright as possible. He was so careful, it was comical. We got so far behind that at one point he had to stop and ask which way the other motorcycles had gone. I had to smile to myself as I might have been the first muzungu woman whom he’d had to taxi up into the hills outside of Kigali. Once again, I was a hit and the people along the way would shout out Muzungu! And wave. My helmet was too big and kept sliding forward over my eyes, but my blond hair waving out the back and light skin was a dead giveaway. My driver laughed as we went. I wonder if he’d ever been the star of a parade before. I was glad I had protected my backpack, because sure enough, the wind had caught the story board and had opened my backpack zipper. I didn't lose anything, but without my arm around the pack, I might have....."

I will also be making prints of the artwork created by the children for the books. These prints will be available for donors, along with bookmarks with the children's artwork and eventually the published books. The past visits to Rwanda have been out of my own pocket, and I've been able to make progress with important contacts in the country with this project, but now feel like I'm ready to make the next step to finalize, write, illustrate and then publish these treasures. That will take more money than I have, so I really appreciate your support!

I will use the funds I collect from supportive people like yourself to fund my upcoming trip. IF I don't get full funding, I will use what I collect to go as far as I can, maybe having to put the publishing part on hold or maybe not taking as many art supplies as I would like to. IF I get MORE funding that I request, then I can guarantee you that that money will be used to publish as many stories as I collect, complete with some wonderful artwork. The more stories I collect, of course, the greater the cost, so hopefully the Pygmies have years and years of stories to tell me.


Will This Project Affect the World?

You bet it will! The stories I collect will be one-of-a-kind because the Pygmy people are basically an illiterate people, meaning their stories have been passed down from generation to generation. These stories will be the original folklore of the people of Rwanda. Many more citizens of Rwanda are becoming educated and are essentially throwing their old ways out the window. I was talking to a Canadian couple the last time I visited and mentioned that I was afraid some of these stories might be lost in just a generation or two. They said it might be sooner than that. With this project I want to stress to the Rwandans just how important their literature is to them and the world. It reflects their culture, their history, them. I'm really looking forward to learning more about these people and sharing this story with you and the rest of the world. I hope you join me. 


    Risks & Challenges

    Rwanda is a mostly French and Kinyarwandan speaking country. I speak fair French and am learning more every day. Many Rwandans speak broken English and are learning every day also. My translator Claude will be going with me to visit the Pygmies and he speaks fairly good English, great French and Kinyarwandan and I will also bring another translator with me. I will be filming the experience so what I don't get translated on the spot, I will have other Rwandan friends help me with the translation before I leave. I will be hand writing the gist of each story and then filling out the details later in true storytelling fashion. Claude's wife will help me with the history of the people and how they came to this location just outside of Kigali.

    When I returned from my last trip, I attended a forum of publishers and I have one publisher in Illinois who is interested in the stories I collect. I feel confident that they will help me with this part of the project. I also was able to make several contacts of publishers in Rwanda itself. I will most likely publish the books both in Rwanda and in the US to save on shipping costs around the world. From what I hear, rejection is common, but persistence pays off. I feel this is an important project and I have the drive to make sure someone else feels that way also to get them published.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Can't send any money at this time but would sure like to help? Please forward this website to your friends around the world. I'm excited about the possibility of saving something that one day could be lost...original stories from Rwanda, Africa. 

    Another way to help is to donate art supplies. I will be taking what I can with me from the donations. I will be working with a local art studio in Rwanda and teaching art classes, but they have no art supplies. I will bring what I can each time I return. Contact me if you would like to donate art supplies.

    Thank you SO much for considering my project. I am humbled and excited all at the same time. Your support just proves to me what an important impact this will be for the world to come.
story_txt:
In a Nutshell I've always been interested in stories, so when I had the opportunity to travel to Rwanda 8 years ago, I was determined to find a story. But because the genocide had occurred only 12 years earlier, most Rwandans were still in survival mode. The second time I went, I had the unexpected opportunity to visit a Pygmy tribe where I was able to trade stories. When looking around the country, I noticed there was no library and the books I found in book stores and high end hotels were priced the same as in the United States. Since that visit, Rwanda now has one of the FEW libraries on the continent and many more citizens are going to University for a quality education. On my last visit, I was able to work with the Children's Librarian during International Read Week. I am a professional storyteller and she quickly put me to work, telling stories in 4 different schools and at the library, yet I found no traditional Rwandan stories in the library to tell. With her help, I will be making contacts in the publishing world in Rwanda. I have also made friends with one of the liaisons with the Pygmy tribe just outside of Kigali and will be traveling with him to the tribe to collect stories. I will also be working with a local art studio which currently works with orphans teaching art. I am proposing that we use these children to illustrate the stories I collect from the Pgymies. A portion of the sale of each book will be going to the Pygmy teller and to the student illustrator of each published book. story:
Short Summary

IMPORTANT ANNOUNCEMENT: 12 November!

The Editors are very pleased and proud to announce that ALL PERKS ARE NOW GUARANTEED!  We WILL be printing hardbacks, paperbacks, prints, etc!  EVERYTHING in these perks can be now delivered!  We still need to make as much as we can to try and pay the contributors what we think they’re worth but the Editors have committed to the outcomes right here and right now!  Thanks for the support so far, now let’s do what we can in the last month!

We have created an exciting Australian Horror Anthology: CTHULHU: DEEP DOWN UNDER.  Hundreds of pages of superb storytelling by 24 of the best Australian genre writers, backed by 24 brilliant artists producing amazing full colour plates for the book. 

We need to pay the contributors, and we need to pay for a print run and a marketing campaign so that this amazing collection can be unleashed. 

The collection has been edited by respected and experienced horror fiction writers and editors:  Steve Proposch (Bloodsongs magazine, current founder, editor Trouble magazine); Bryce Stevens (Terror Australis magazine, Bloodsongs magazine), and Christopher Sequeira (Terror Australis magazine, Sequence Productions comics).  

The Writers represent the cream of the Australian dark fantasy scene, with the finest genre novelists and screenwriters and even song lyricists amongst them: STEVE KILBEY, KAARON WARREN, AARON STERNS, JANEEN WEBB, JASON NAHRUNG, LUCY SUSSEX, JASON FRANKS, B. MICHAEL RADBURN, ROBERT HOOD, DMETRI KAKMI and many more.

The artists are amongst the finest in speculative vision-making: W. CHEW CHAN, BRUCE MUTARD, SARAH ELLERTON, PAUL MASON, GAVIN L. O'KEEFE and many more.

Perhaps the greatest living practitioner of the weird story, and certainly the most lauded exemplar of the Lovecraftian story, RAMSEY CAMPBELL, has written an original introduction just for this collection, entitled LOVECRAFT'S MONSTER.

We need to get as close as we can to our goal of $75,000 to take this book to the final stages of commercial reality and produce decent marketing and print runs.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to get as near as possible to $75,000 to make sure this very special, massive tome of words and pictures is properly proofed, prepped, printed and made available, and we need to pay these wonderful contributors for their work, and then market the project.  With 24 colour plates, too, we want decent quality paper and colour. A cheap newsprint job is unacceptable.
  • IMPORTANT NOTE: We don't have to hit the total to honour our pledges, but to do it the way we want to (properly), we need to get as near the target as possible. We aren't asking for charity to support this project, either. We want you to buy the book or one of the other pledges.
  • IF YOU PLEDGE, WE WILL HAVE THE BOOK OUT SOON, BECAUSE WE'VE ALREADY DONE THE WORK!  DON'T BE WORRIED THAT WE WON'T DELIVER. WE MADE "DELIVERING" THE PRIORITY WITH THIS CAMPAIGN! 
  • Much of the hard creative work in this book is already done. 24 stories written! 23 illustrations finished! The galleys are in! Author correction notes in! Cover illustration and design all done!
  • We have paperbacks, digital versions, hardback limited editions, posters and unique paraphernalia on offer, as well as original, one of a kind artworks as perks for this project.  
  • We did not create this book via open submissions, which would have been impossible with no budget to begin with. Instead, we approached a number of trusted professionals in our various networks, all of whom kindly took the risk of devoting their enormously valuable time to produce a story or illustration unpaid. None of these amazing creators have received a cent as yet. But we can leverage this fact, for you, the supporters. There are perks available that involve editorial and story consultations from the top editors and writers that are represented in this project. Want advice on writing or art? You can pick up one of the one-on-one coaching perks!
  • This is a world-class anthology, and we're returning to the promise of Lovecraft's first ever Mythos story, 'The Call of Cthulhu', which specifically featured Australia in it. So why not push the envelope and buy an original artwork of YOURSELF battling Lovecraftian horrors in Australia?!
  • You don't need to know a thing about H. P. Lovecraft or Cthulhu to enjoy any of the stories in this book.  If you like the idea of a collection of well-crafted horror and dark fantasy tales all set in Australia, but all VERY different and original; this is the project for you! There are some taut action stories, tales of black humour, psycho-dramas, and an abundance of shocking, cosmic horror, all set in the land down under, or including a key connection to Australia or New Zealand.
  • In all we have more than 50 creators to pay, and a significant amount of copies to produce to achieve our target. This project wouldn't work well as a print-on-demand book because the margins would be less than narrow, and we want to pay our amazing creators a decent, professional rate for their work. Your commitment to this project allows us to adjust our final print run to suit that commitment. Our pledge targets have been arrived at to reflect that fact. We have conducted print cost modelling and contribution modelling and concluded that a mainstream publisher would require a budget of $100K or more to generate a book like this in Australia, even considering the benefits of synergies and economies of scale.

The Impact

  • Australian readers have consistently told the Editors, as we've gone about our business, meeting genre fans in recent years, that they are hungry for locally set dark fiction; stories that are Australian without being cringe-inducing; geographically-specific, but thematically universal. This book attempts to deliver those goods in a large-production print-run that is properly marketed and distributed via the 'pre-sales' that this crowd-funding generates.
  • At the same time, this book is NOT just for Australians. We don't believe in parochial fantasy fiction for the sake of it. The stories in this book would be enjoyed by any lover of innovative weird fiction. This book was produced to be a great reading experience for anyone, from anywhere, especially those who like horror fiction and enjoy reading the Cthulhu tropes used in fresh and exciting ways.
  • Everyone appearing in this book is a respected professional, whether long-standing or emerging. Some have credits on screenplays for major films, or novels, or short story collections, or major local or international TV, film, comic-book or movie work to their credit. Crack this tome open and you won't be disappointed by amateur level work. 

Risks & Challenges

  • We've done so much of the hard work already that production of this book is almost guaranteed. All we need from you is a pledge of support through perks that we believe are all commercially priced, and will actually provide you with value for money. We are not running this campaign as a charity, but as a commercial reality. 
  • Don't have much cash but just want the book?  No worries, just buy it now, even just the digital version, through the pledge.  
  • Have more money and want a cool, original collectible?  Great; support us through that, too. 
  • Want a unique chance to get some creative professional support in your own horror-themed writing or drawing, tips on how to hit an internationally competitive standard? We are the perfect group of people to help you through a creative coaching writing or art pledge; folks appearing within this book have sold their work to markets across the globe.
  • NOTE:  we've made the fund structure for receiving the funds in US dollars so that we can receive both Paypal and credit card funds. The production team is actually spread across Sydney and Johns River, in NSW, and Castlemaine, in Victoria, and our go-to video-guy is in Katoomba, NSW.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share, share share! Use the Indiegogo share tools! Tell every friend you have who is interested in awesome genre fiction that this project is ON!
  • HEY! HEY! HEY! We're starting this party with a bang! This website will go up Wednesday 15 October, 2014, but the Project Official Launch is SATURDAY, 18TH OCTOBER AT MELBOURNE'S ARMAGEDDON EXPO - POP CULTURE CONVENTION!  CHECK IT OUT!  http://www.armageddonexpo.com/au/comics-sci-fi-fantasy-trading-cards/cthulu-deep-down-under/
  • WE WILL BE AT BOOTH 74 ALL WEEKEND AT ARMAGEDDON CON, SELLING POSTERS and spruiking this project, and on The Cartoon and Animation Stage on SATURDAY 18TH OCTOBER 2014 at 4pm we will be talking to the people about the project!  About a dozen artists and writers on stage!
  • KEEP AN EYE ON THIS SITE! There are more than 50 creators so we will try to feature a message from each of them each day of the campaign!
  • You know this is one FHTAGN-TASTIC PROJECT! A TENTACULAR SPECTACULAR, WE SAY, IN THE NAME OF GREAT CTHULHU HIM (IT) SELF!!

Don't have much cash but just want the book?  No worries, just buy it now, even just the digital version, through the pledge.  
Have more money and want a cool, original collectible?  Great; support us through that, too. 
Want a unique chance to get some creative professional support in your own horror-themed writing or drawing, tips on how to hit an internationally competitive standard? We are the perfect group of people to help you through a creative coaching writing or art pledge; folks appearing within this book have sold their work to markets across the globe.
NOTE:  we've made the fund structure for receiving the funds in US dollars so that we can receive both Paypal and credit card funds. The production team is actually spread across Sydney and Johns River, in NSW, and Castlemaine, in Victoria, and our go-to video-guy is in Katoomba, NSW. 
  Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Share, share share! Use the Indiegogo share tools! Tell every friend you have who is interested in awesome genre fiction that this project is ON!

HEY! HEY! HEY! We're starting this party with a bang! This website will go up Wednesday 15 October, 2014, but the Project Official Launch is SATURDAY, 18TH OCTOBER AT MELBOURNE'S ARMAGEDDON EXPO - POP CULTURE CONVENTION!  CHECK IT OUT!  http://www.armageddonexpo.com/au/comics-sci-fi-fantasy-trading-cards/cthulu-deep-down-under/
WE WILL BE AT BOOTH 74 ALL WEEKEND AT ARMAGEDDON CON, SELLING POSTERS and spruiking this project, and on The Cartoon and Animation Stage on SATURDAY 18TH OCTOBER 2014 at 4pm we will be talking to the people about the project!  About a dozen artists and writers on stage!
KEEP AN EYE ON THIS SITE! There are more than 50 creators so we will try to feature a message from each of them each day of the campaign!
You know this is one FHTAGN-TASTIC PROJECT! A TENTACULAR SPECTACULAR, WE SAY, IN THE NAME OF GREAT CTHULHU HIM (IT) SELF!!

story:
What is it about?

There are lots of Roma theatre artists and lots of shows but hardly anyone knows them. Roma plays are just as important to know as the stories of any other nation! That is why Independent Theatre is going to publish and distribute the first Roma drama collection in the world, presenting plays by 5 European Roma artists in English and Hungarian language, completed with digital materials, too.

Why is it important?

The stories of Roma people are most often told by others, albeit every community shall speak up and identify itself through its own stories. The protagonists of the plays face difficulties, make decisions, take responsibility and initiate change. Thus, they empower the youngsters and motivate them to take their fate into their own hands. As the protagonists of the plays are diverse and led by different values, youngsters can decide which way to start based on various aspects and example.

The plays will be available in English and in Hungarian language in e-book format so the international public can get easy access to the publication.

What will be in the book?

The collection presents the plays of five European Roma artists. Franciska Farkas, the renown Hungarian actress makes an honest confession of her life.  The play by Mihaela Dragan draws a picture of Romanian Gypsy women's lives and challenges. Through Michael Collins' own experiences we learn about the difficulties that Irish Travellers have to face. The drama written by Richard O’Neill tells about the personal struggle of the Scottish Traveller Jess Smith with the Scottish first minister for the recognition of Traveller people's human rights. Dijana Pavlovic's play reveals the story of Mariella Mehr, writer and a member of the Swiss Jenish minority as well as the details of the biological genocide in Switzerland during the 20th century.

Completing the plays, the e-book will include performance photos, short video scenes and interviews with the artists, and thus sheer words come to life.

What do we need?

Publishing a book is a long process, even after the text is finished: as we are dealing with plays written in various languages, they need to be translated into English and Hungarian, the translated text have to be edited and proofread so that no flaw may remain in the book. The text have to be typeset, a cover is designed and is finalized by graphic post-production. After, it is converted into an e-book or is printed. Twenty copies of the book will be sent to Roma youth groups. The next task is that of the reader: everything is ready, s/he shall simply lose him/herself into the stories.

We have funding to buy the rights but we need your support to translate the plays and to publish the book. For now, our goal is to collect 1500 EUR. If we do not reach our goal, we stick to the e-book publication as it is much more affordable then print a book. 

As you see, we got a long way to walk – come with us and support our work so that the most possible people get to know the Roma heroes' stories!

What do we offer?

Everyone, who supports our campaign, will get access to the e-book, including not only the five plays, but many photos of the theatre performances, videos of short scenes and interviews with the artists.

If you cannot contribute, you can also help us by sharing our campaign and follow our Facebook-page: https://www.facebook.com/IndependentTheatreHung..., where you can also find some interesting pieces of information on Roma theatre.

story:
After a deadly virus wipes out 80 percent of the world’s population, Matt Macaine, an ordinary urban resident, must now live in a corrupt society ruled by gangs after the government’s collapse.

Unwilling to abide by new rules, Matt escapes his apartment and ventures on a cross-country trip to unite with his family. He eventually realizes the virus and gangs are not the only threats in this post-apocalyptic world.

Is it a mistake to leave the confines of his home, or is fleeing worth what he uncovers?

 

Here is a glimpse of the the first two pages including the opening incident:

 

The two illustrations below are created based on the story in Apartment 905.

Read the story of Matt Macaine fighting to survive in the post-apocalyptic world conquered by viruses and gangs.

 

Apartment 905 will not only take you through a breath-taking story, it will also inspire you about the preparations to do before the stuff hits the fan (SHTF).

A few tips & tricks from the book:

Apartment 905 intelligently blends the three concepts that every survivor should know into the story: Lucifer Effect, Grey Man Theory, and Triple-A Rule.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Hello! I'm Ned.

Thank you for checking Apartment 905! This is my fourth book.

I'm a software engineer living in Charlotte, North Carolina (USA).

My love for writing started the moment I developed my first website while in middle school. I shared my experience with computers on this website and wrote several articles that were published in computer magazines.

After graduating from computer engineering as the first in his class, I wrote three technical books. I've been also actively blogging about technology since 2004.

I'm an avid consumer of post-apocalyptic books (Fav. Ready Player One), movies (Fav. 28 Days Later), and TV shows (Fav. The Walking Dead). I enjoy spending my spare time learning about survivalism and prepping for the unexpected events (Especially for a grid down scenario after EMP).

Say hello by messaging here or on my website! Tell me your favorite doomsday movie!

 

Since I am self-publishing Apartment 905, I need your support to bring this page-turner fiction to your doorstep!

I finished writing the book and I already have a cover design. However, I'm relying on your contributions for funding the services below.

  • Line editing & Proofreading
  • Formatting for both printed and ebook versions
  • Audiobook narration
  • Printing & Shipping

Please select a Reward from the right side of this page to make a contribution.

Thank you for your support to an independent author for releasing an inspiring pandemic story!

story:
As a lockdown project Keg de Souza and I decided to write a book for our 3-year-old Ernie, inspired by a song we made up together one night called ‘foot feet’, which was about how confusing pluralisation can be. This made us think a book about irregular plurals for toddlers would be a fun way to teach kids about the peculiarities of the English language. We then decided to incorporate the concept into a counting book to give it dual purpose as a learning tool for both Plurals and Numbers. And that’s the origin story behind Plurals Can Be Weird (you will see) a cute counting / plurals book.

After Keg painstakingly assembled the book by collaging paper cut outs together to produce a single copy for Ernie, we thought the finished product turned out to be ‘pretty good’ and thought it pretty much stood up to most of the children’s books we have encountered as parents. So we have decided to publish our efforts in order to share the work with the world and as a way to supplement our income which as working artists has been decimated by the current outbreak.

About the Artists

Keg de Souza is an Australian artist working with mediums such as; inflatable and temporary architecture, food, film, mapping and dialogical projects to explore the politics of space.  This investigation of social and spatial environments is influenced by her formal training in architecture and experiences of radical spaces through squatting and organising. She often creates site and situation specific projects with people, with an emphasis on knowledge exchange. Keg is a member of various collaborative groups, such as SquatSpace Artist Collective and is represented by Booklyn Artist Alliance, NY for her artist’s books and zines, which she has been self-publishing for over 15 years.

http://www.kegdesouza.com/

What the New York Times described as sounding like "John Coltrane playing a volcano" is in fact the unique work of maverick musician Lucas Abela whose infamous obsession with sheets of broken glass has astonished and bemused countless people around the world. Abela ecstatically purses his lips against panes of amplified glass while deftly employing various vocal techniques ranging from throat singing to raspberries to turn discarded shards into crude musical instruments. The results are a wild array of oddly controlled cacophonous noise teetering on the edge of music. A one of a kind act that quite simply needs to be witnessed to be fully appreciated, let alone understood.

http://dualplover.com/abela/

Our goal of AUD$2000 will be enough to produce a small print run of the book on quality recycled paper stock (160gsm pages with a 300gsm cover). Anyone interested in obtaining some of Keg's zines may wish explore the unique perks which all come with a copy of the book. If we don't reach our goal we'll decide whether there is enough pre-orders to make it worth our while by covering the excess but honestly dont think this will be an issue the book is delightful and Ernie loves it as will most babies & toddlers.

story:
The Story of My Book

As captured by renowned storyteller David JP Phillips, “One hundred thousand years ago, we started developing our language—it’s sound to say that we started using storytelling to transfer knowledge from generation to generation. Twenty seven thousand years ago we started transferring knowledge from generation to generation through cave paintings. Thirty five hundred years ago we started transferring knowledge from generation to generation through text. Twenty eight years ago PowerPoint was born. Which one do you think our brain is mostly adapted to?”

My name is Akshay Kamath and I am the author of Make It Matter: A Guide to Mastering the Art of the Pitch with Principled Storytelling. I wrote this book because I believe the value of storytelling in entrepreneurship is immeasurable, but the meaning of “storytelling” has unfortunately eroded over the years into an almost empty buzzword, all while it remains the defining, learnable skill that makes all the difference.

Once a young and determined student entrepreneur myself, I wanted to make my dent in the world. Instead, I was met with rejection and consolation at every opportunity to pitch my vision for a more equitable future for our youth. The moment I emphasized telling my audience a story was the moment that changed. But, this book is not about myself. It is an organized deep dive into successful pitching principles identified by many distinguished changemakers. I am confident that, by implementing these proven tactics, anyone can turn a simple vision into a powerful narrative that is positioned to make a difference.

A compilation and analysis of research and interviews, this book showcases successful changemakers who’ve harnessed the power of story to make an indelible mark across industries. In particular, you will have a lens into the narratives of

  • Scott Harrison, who reinvented the meaning of charity and the role of a humanitarian non-profit
  • Hasan Minhaj, who changed the way a generation of Asian Americans grew up to view social justice
  • Oprah Winfrey, who gave the world a new form of communication with the power of her example

After having suffered the endless loop of self-help books that, at times, can give false feelings of accomplishment, I’ve set out to craft the resource I wish I’d had when building something that mattered to me. In this book, you’ll find specific, actionable insights you can put into practice for a venture or initiative aligned with your passions. You’ll find principles that are as practical as they are encouraging. You won’t find empty platitudes. My hope is that you’ll walk away with a new perspective and tailored toolkit for delivering a purposeful pitch to any audience.

Whether you’re an entrepreneur with an interest in the impetus behind social movements or an aficionado of the art of telling or collecting great stories, you’ll enjoy this book.

 

The Book - Make It Matter

Make It Matter is a nonfiction book, written in three parts.

Part 1: The Construction
This section explores the value of and actionable steps to thread a clear and consistent message throughout your pitch, ensuring your way of thinking is aligned with that of your audience. You’ll learn how to assemble and spontaneously adjust a strong pitch backbone, a structural vessel through which emotional journeys become resonant and offer a shared experience to every listener.

Part 2: The Connection
This section navigates the pitch details that help cultivate sincere relationships between entrepreneurs and their audiences. You’ll learn to refine pitches and have your audience oriented to care genuinely about what you care about. More importantly, you’ll be able to develop a personal connection that attributes meaning to your words in the context of your listeners' lives.

Part 3: The Command
This section tours how entrepreneurs build a legacy for their stories. In examining the interaction of storytelling and leadership, you can differentiate your pitch from the rest in competitions and to investors, inspiring your audience to act (not just listen) and leaving an everlasting gift beyond the scope of a single pitch. You’ll learn how to disrupt patterns and make nuanced connections such that your audience, unsolicited, decides to act from the power of your story.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

Make It Matter will be published with New Degree Press. To help cover the costs for publishing my book, I’ve set up pre-order tiers. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor who’ll help me revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.
  • The cover designer who’ll replace this mock placeholder with a professional, custom cover design.
  • The layout editor who’ll put together the interior of my book and create my ebook.
  • The copy editor and proof reader who’ll polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts when I publish this summer.

When I reach 120 campaign backers, I will publish my book in paperback and e-book formats. I will be donating 10% of all proceeds to Save the Children for the delivery of essential medical supplies and psychosocial support to children suffering from the recent COVID-19 surge in India, and after reaching these publishing goals, 100% of profits from this campaign will be donated to local organizations supporting youth empowerment.

As a campaign backer, you’re not only buying a copy of my book. You're investing in an opportunity to ride shotgun on my path to publishing. By pre-ordering my book, you can receive an exclusive experience that includes the following:

  • You’ll receive a signed copy of my book when I publish this summer.
  • You’ll see your name in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You’ll be invited to join my Author Community for early access to excerpts from my book.
  • You’ll have an opportunity to share your insight in the selection of my book cover.
  • You'll be included in a Winner's Choice raffle to win prizes that include a gourmet coffee gift basket, a cookies and sweets gift tower, and a 3-month subscription for Calmbox (6 - 8 mindfully curated items delivered in a box per month).
  • You'll get a rare glimpse behind the curtain of the publishing process to see what it takes to go from first draft to print.

 

About the Author

Author Akshay Kamath is a management consultant in the healthcare industry, as well as Co-Founder & Team Lead of Nutrivide, an infant consumer products company devoted to ending dosing errors via the development and distribution of low-cost medical devices.

His commitment to service above self is typified by his efforts to tackle food insecurity and promote policies for healthy living in his community, where he volunteers at the Christ Church Food Pantry and serves as a Board Member for Wellspring Center for Prevention. A young social entrepreneur, Akshay has a broader passion for helping youth reach their full potential. Speaking to his experiences, Akshay has been recognized as a Finalist at the MIT-HMS Healthcare Innovation Bootcamp, as a Forbes Under 30 Scholar in Healthcare, and as a winner of the MIT COVID-19 Challenge series.

To learn more about this project, connect with Akshay at akshaykamath96@gmail.com and at
https://www.linkedin.com/in/akshaykamath1/.

 

International Preorders

For international pre-orders, please send me a private message.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers apprised of my anticipated publishing date. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people simply cannot contribute to my campaign. That's okay! If you find yourself in that position, but feel that this book may be a great read for others, I hope you’ll show your support by sharing my pre-sales campaign link (can be found at the top of this page).

Share it with any friends, neighbors, colleagues, or classmates who might enjoy my book or the opportunity to join my publishing journey. If you’ll use #MakeItMatter and tag my publisher (@NewDegreePress), we’ll help amplify your efforts. Share it and know that you’re making a difference.

Thanks for your support!

 

Stay well,

Akshay Kamath

A young social entrepreneur, Akshay has a broader passion for helping youth reach their full potential. Speaking to his experiences, Akshay has been recognized as a Finalist at the MIT-HMS Healthcare Innovation Bootcamp, as a Forbes Under 30 Scholar in Healthcare, and as a winner of the MIT COVID-19 Challenge series.To learn more about this project, connect with Akshay at akshaykamath96@gmail.com and athttps://www.linkedin.com/in/akshaykamath1/.
 

International Preorders
For international pre-orders, please send me a private message.
 
Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers apprised of my anticipated publishing date. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
I understand that some people simply cannot contribute to my campaign. That's okay! If you find yourself in that position, but feel that this book may be a great read for others, I hope you’ll show your support by sharing my pre-sales campaign link (can be found at the top of this page).
Share it with any friends, neighbors, colleagues, or classmates who might enjoy my book or the opportunity to join my publishing journey. If you’ll use #MakeItMatter and tag my publisher (@NewDegreePress), we’ll help amplify your efforts. Share it and know that you’re making a difference.
Thanks for your support! Stay well,Akshay Kamath

story:
About this project

For a few years after completing her PhD in History, Lena Leontyeva was wondering how to turn the scientific work she produced into an interesting book. She then thought that a traditional or legendary story such as a myth or namthar will be the best choice. 

 

“Nam Thar. Buddhist Myths” represents the history of Buddhism seen through the eyes of many figures, both historical and imagined.

The action of the book takes place over 2,500 years, beginning in the 6th century BC and ending in the second half of the 20th century AC. Arya, the hero, his girlfriend and two friends meet in five lives and go through different hindrances on the way to reveal the secret of Liberation. The plot is based on real events. Stories of the four fictional characters are interwoven with the real historical facts; Arya meets the most famous Buddhist teachers each of which is a historical figure. Therefore, the book will be useful not only to a wide range of curious readers, but also to students and enthusiasts of East Asian history.

The book is available in three languages Polish/Russian/English, and to cover production and printing costs Nam Thar Team launched two concurrent crowdfunding campaigns for the book, one on Indiegogo.com (Worldwide, Dec 8th, 2016), and the other on the Polish platform PolakPotrafi.pl (successfully launched on November 30th, 2016).

You can pre-order the book on Indiegogo.com until January 31st 2017.

 

 

How to support the project and help us publish the book? And how Indiegogo works?

 

In order to make Nam Thar the way we envision it, we decided to raise funds online. That's why we need your help…WE NEED TO RAISE 10.000$

 

THE PLAN IS SIMPLE

1. First we collect personal orders to pay for the cost of editing, design, and printing of the first edition of the book…and everything needed for the book launch.

2. Moreover, your support will help us sign a publishing contract and pay for the bookstore edition. The book is just the first step. We also plan to create beautiful audiobooks, short animations and later start working on a film adaptation. Stay tuned!

PRE-ORDER & MAKE A DONATION TO THE BOOK AND YOU GET SOMETHING BACK.

Choose the amount you’d like to donate, and we will send you something special to say thank you for being a part of it. Once funding is completed, we will contact you to arrange the receipt of your reward. 

IF WE RAISE MORE THAN OUR TARGET WE HAVE SUCCEEDED.

Needless to say we are on a tight budget – any money that is raised above our target is still very much needed and will help to pay for marketing and the bookstore edition, and if possible production of the audiobook.

Why support? 

We need to raise money to cover production, final bits of editing and printing costs. We want to make sure that the book is the best it can be. And if we raise more funding we plan to create beautiful audiobooks and later start working on a movie adaptation.

Let’s publish this book together;)

Lena’s story:

Lena Leonteva - Diamond Way Buddhist teacher, studied Mathematics and History. Lena also graduated from the Karmapa International Buddhist Institute (KIBI), New Delhi, with a diploma in Buddhist Studies. Following Lama Ole Nydahl 's* wishes, Lena turned her PhD dissertation about the transition of Indian Buddhism to Tibet, into a beautifully illustrated buddhist novel.

                      

Lena and Lama Ole Nydahl

* Lama Ole Nydahl - Lama Ole Nydahl was born in Copenhagen, Denmark. He studied Philosophy, English and German at the University of Copenhagen, and in the U.S.A, Tübingen and Munich. He is a qualified lama in the Tibetan Karma Kagyu Buddhist tradition. With his wife, Hannah Nydahl (1946-2007), he founded Diamond Way Buddhism, a worldwide Karma Kagyu Buddhist organization of lay practitioners.

Marzena's Story:

Marzena's adventure with Nam Thar started from a journey…

It was long time ago when she visited far East, a place called Kalimpong and one of its buddhist temples…it was then when she fell in love with the Tibetan painting style.

And it was then when she thought that she’d like to bring these paintings to life…

Later, during the same trip, she met Artur Przybyslawski* who was then studying at The Karmapa International Buddhist Institute KIBI, in Delhi.

Marzena and Artur Przybyslawski

She told him about her fascination for the Tibetan art and plans to bring it to life in a form of an animation movie, and he said: yes it is a great idea, but..I suggest you do it about buddhist masters, and it would be called "Namthar".

Together with a friend of her, Joanna Pawluskiewicz*, they showed the first attempt to animate a buddhist painting called the Refuge Tree, to the 17th Karmapa Trinley Thaye Dorje*.

He liked it very much since he is fond of the art of animation and after seeing their and their team's artwork he said: "I have always wished that someone would do something like that..."

Marzena and the 17th Karmapa Taye Dorje

Marzena, Artur and Joanna spent a long time working on the scripts for the film, and created a few stories about the buddhist masters.

Joanna and Maggie Lehnert-Kossowski

They planned to make a few shorts based on these stories, but had difficulties securing funding to produce these films.

Marzena and Joanna in Bhutan

Marzena couldn’t do it on her own, didn't really have enough historical knowledge on that subject, and when she started feeling like giving up she heard about Lena Leontyeva and her PHD thesis. She emailed her and Lena invited Marzena to work together and this is how they started writing Nam Thar.

*Artur Przybyslawski, PHD in Philosophy, is a lecturer at the Jagiellonian University in Krakow and is a Tibetan to English translator. Artur also works with KIBI in New Delhi and the International Institute for Tibetan and Asian Studies (ITAS) in Spain. He is an author of many books and publications about Buddhism.

* Joanna Pawluskiewicz - author, screenwriter, improviser. Credits include HBO, TVN and many more.

*17th Karmapa Trinley Thaye Dorje - is the leader of the 900-year-old Karma Kagyu lineage of Tibetan Buddhism. A world Buddhist leader and teacher. He has a unique vision of peace for all, a world in which we cultivate our Inner Wealth – our innate values of compassion and wisdom.

Nam Thar's Talisman - Kanishka's Coin

 

 

FAQ

When the book will get published?

Special edition of the book will be published within 1 month after completion of the Indiegogo campaign, February/March 2017. We will post the books to you beautifully wrapped.

When do I get to see the audiobook and adaptation?

Production of the audiobook and the script will take several months because we want to ensure the highest quality. Definitely the first half of 2017.

Risks and challenges

Clearly undertaking such a massive project has its challenges, and there will be a lot of work in order to make it the exceptional book and adaptation we want it to be. 

We are only a small team, who are all working hard and mainly for free or basic salary to make this a reality. 

Our aim is to complete the book in Spring 2017 and get it to bookshops around the world. 

The final hurdle will be getting the people necessary to make this all happen. We've teamed up with experts already (i.e. Norbu Denzong - master of Karma Gadri - a specific Karma Kagyu painting style of thangkas - scroll paintings; Norbu was a personal painter and student of 16 Karmpa Rangjung Rigpe Dorje, 1924 – 1981), but we will need to find more amazing people to make this project a truly compelling story and product. By getting the best team on board to make it a reality, we hope to limit that risk as much as possible.

Book Promotion:

We’re hugely excited for the Indiegogo campaign. Make sure you’re on board and stay up to date through www and our social media channels. Links included below.

Sign up for our Newsletter!

We encourage you to like, follow, share among friends and support us;-)

Useful links:

Website: http://www.namtharthebook.com/

Facebook Fanpage (English): https://www.facebook.com/NamtharTheBook/

Facebook Fanpage (Polish): https://www.facebook.com/NamtharKsiazka/

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC2OfbhSDFRq9ez...

Twitter: https://twitter.com/Namtharthebook        

Contact

Email: hello@namtharthebook.com                                                                     

 

Be a part of our book!
 

Lena & Marzena + Nam Thar Team

story:
Overview

I'm raising funds to cover distribution costs for my next book.

Artwork by Stefan Motmans

Summary

I'm Sam Qualiana, a screenwriter of independent films who has worked in numerous capacities on over 30 feature films in my career. My vocation has always been storytelling. I recently released my first novel Journey of the Avenger, which is available on Amazon:  
https://www.amazon.com/dp/B08BW8LZQY

I came up with the concept for Protectors of the Realm originally as a card game which I produced through Gamecrafter. More details here:
https://captbligh1.wixsite.com/metroshiagames


Now I'm expanding the stories from the card game and writing each set into a novella. 

I've already finished the manuscript for the first story, edited and formatted it and it's ready to distribute through Amazon. It's 138 pages and 28,000+ words

I'm hoping that with your help, I can get a jump on releasing this first story to the world. By contributing to this campaign you'll help me pay for the artwork for the cover and make physical copies of the novella.

What We Need

I'm looking to raise $500.00 for the campaign.

All of that money will go towards distribution costs for the book. 

I will be self publishing through Amazon, I now have the artwork, so I will be releasing the book very soon. I could have this done in less than 1 month.

If we don't reach the goal, all that will do is slow me down. I will still work on raising the money myself to get what I need, but it will take more time and resources to complete. 

The good news is that anyone who chooses the digital PDF copy, will get it as soon as the campaign ends, regardless if we reach the goal or not. 

The Story

Protectors of the Realm: Vol 1

It was a time of wizards and dragons, during the seven hundred and fifth cycle of the seasons. Lifetimes after the second rise of Agarnai, the monster God.

 

As a young apprentice, Hipanos was accused of murdering one of his peers, an elf named Kayteen. Therefore he was banished from the Academy of Magic.

Many years later he returns to the spotlight as a powerful wizard, self-trained in magic from the dark and the light. Hipanos masters the art of necromancy, and plots to leave his mark on the realm—seeking revenge on those who cast him out—no matter what the cost.


Meanwhile, in Tala Fee, Sir Anthony Maddox learns the Black Knight, Jonathan Waddingham has invaded the peaceful city of Broadan. With the help of the powerful wizard, Meldock, Sir Anthony must lead his army to counter Waddingham before he brings Broadan to ashes.

 

Learn the story of the most powerful wizards in the realm. Discover the decline of a man that rises to become an overwhelming force of evil and the choices he makes to lead him there.

 

When evil arises, the Protectors of the Realm are called to action. But every choice, whether right or wrong, may hold consequences.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that not everybody has a few extra bucks to spare. I wish I could donate to every friend's campaign that pops up, but in reality we can't always do that, so if you aren't able to donate even the smallest amount, I get it. 

Maybe you just don't like reading fantasy stories, that's fine too. It's not everybody's cup of tea. You're not hurting anyone's feelings having your own taste. 

But if either of those are the case and you still want to help, indiegogo has share tools that will allow you to at least spread the word. Even that small gesture can go a long way.

 

Thank you for your support, it means a lot to me.

Help us keep Skatronixxx.com alive! Skatronixxx.Com is the number one website for your nerdy reviews and news. 

The website is currently run by @skatronixxx and @mitch_rated to keep the internet entertained. However the site is actually being run at a loss to @skatronixxx who is paying for the upkeep of the site on his own.

@skatronixxx spens several hours a day on the site getting up at 4am every day to work on it, after which, he then goes to work and spends some more hours on it at night! This equates to roughly 5 hours sleep a night!

Help @skatronixxx and with your funding he'll be able to pay not only his writers but also people to help look after the site. 

 Help keep the internet entertained and keep Skatronixxx.com alive!!!

story:
About ROC Wheels

ROC (Reach Out and Care) Wheels is a 501-c(3) non-profit organization located in Bozeman, Montana. For the past 15 years our mission has been to mobilize children in less resourced countries using the gifts and talents of our global community. An estimated 65 million people are in need of wheelchairs and of those almost 6.5 children in less-resourced countries are in need of an adaptable wheelchair. 

In 1999, our founders, Wayne and Lee-Ann Hanson traveled to Kenya with a group of young adults. With the support of a doctor and a seating specialist, 50 children were custom fit into their adaptable wheelchairs which provided the therapeutic support they needed  to function to the best of their ability. It was exciting to discover how the Kenyan children’s lives were transformed when they were able to sit proudly and interact with their families, their peers and with the American youth. Great things happen when people are given the opportunity to reach out and care to each other.

After realizing how many wheelchairs were needed around the world, Wayne and Lee decided to develop wheelchairs and services specially designed for children with severe disabilities. They also realized how important it is to help the citizens in less resourced countries become more self-sufficient by training the care-givers, and equipping them to build their own wheelchairs. To-date, ROC Wheels has delivered over 10,000 wheelchairs which has provided freedom of mobility for both the children and their families. ROC Chair production has been established in  four countries. Inmates in the US build ROC Kits which are assembled by students in the public schools. It is exciting when people world-wide work together and accomplish great things through the power of partnering. 

The ROCKIT Project

Our campaign is directed to help us fund the tooling and production  of our newest wheelchair, the ROCKIT Chair. The ROCKIT Chair can be configured as 3 different wheelchairs; an independent wheelchair, 3 wheeled all-terrain wheelchair or adaptive stroller. The ROCKIT Chair is designed to serve children with even the most severe disabilities A comparable adaptable wheelchair sells for over $4,000 on the U.S. market because of the numerous seating and support features and the wheelchair’s ability to grow, tilt and recline.  It is also unique in its ability to fold compactly to accommodate public transportation. 

The ROCKIT is both a kit and a complete wheelchair. These kits will be sent to communities around the globe and help promote employment and development. In addition, completed chairs can be sent overseas to children that are in need of immediate support through one of our various wheelchair distributions. 

To reduce production costs we are currently seeking $70,000 to outsource tooling for the pieces and parts to build these advanced wheelchairs and set up the ROCKIT Kits.In addition, we are seeking $26,000 to build 100  ROCKIT Chair Kits which will be used to equip people in Guatemala, Kosovo and the Dominican Republic to develop a sustainable wheelchair delivery operation. By doing this we will be able to streamline our ability to equip people in less resourced countries to use the ROCKIT Kits to build chairs and provide employment. We will also be able to reduce the cost to make it more affordable and allow our global partner to purchase and distribute worldwide.

Your Contribution: Return on Investment

With your contributions, we will be able to continue our mission of outreach, mobility, and empowerment. 

Outreach: By supporting this campaign you will enable children around the globe to experience mobility. We will be able to distribute thousands of additional wheelchairs around the globe to places such as Argentina, Kosovo, Guatemala, and Mexico. In addition, your contributions will put hundreds of people to work on making the necessary tools and parts for the chair. in addition, it is our goal that these children will not only be helped by us but also reach out to others. With our world undergoing struggles on political and economic levels, this gift of mobility and community involvement promotes progress and peace around the globe. 
Mobility:  Mobility is more than transportation, it is what enables a child to experience their surroundings with their community and family. Many of the children that we help are often left on dirt floors with no hope of every leaving a 6x6 area on the ground. Not only is this unsanitary and harmful to the child's health but it also makes the child feel hopeless and insignificant. Mobility and proper support helps creates that hope and it is one of the greatest gifts.  
Empowerment: You will be making it possible for primary and secondary (K-12) students around the United States to participate in funding and building chairs, through our YEWTHS ROC program, to be sent to various destinations around the globe. These children not only gain valuable skills in teamwork, manufacturing, and volunteering, but also realize that they have gifts and talents that they can use to help the world. In addition, we currently employ inmates at the South Dakota State Correctional Facility to help create kits that will be used to make complete ROCKIT chairs by communities around the globe. 

    


Why $96,000?

In order to fully fund the new ROCKIT chair and the ROCKIT Kit,  we have been quoted $70,000. This would include plastic molds, fixtures, and the necessary tools for mass production. This would additionally fund the development of a curriculum to support self sustainability.and  In addition to the $70,000, we are asking for $26,000 to fund the production of another 100 ROCKIT chairs . This is in order to achieve the proper economies of scale to make production both efficient and cost effective. Although we know this is a significant investment into production this gives us the opportunity to exponentially increase the number of children we can serve.  

If we do not reach our goal by the end of this campaign, the funds will be held until we can raise enough money to accomplish our goals. We are confident that we will have raised enough through not only through this campaign but through other private funding efforts in the Bozeman community. Your funds will not go to waste because we will not stop until we can provide children the mobility that they deserve.

The Perks

$5 Perk: Personal Thank-You Email and Desktop Wallpaper
$25 Perk: ROC Wheels Pens and Stickers

              

$100 Perk: I ROC Hat                                      $100 Perk: ROC Wheels Hat

           

$100 Perk: ROCKIT T-Shirt                          $100 Perk: YEWTHS ROC T-Shirt

$500 Perk: Family Sponsorship

For donating $500 we will include all of the $25 perks along with 4 ROC Wheels T-Shirts so that your whole family can spread the word of mobility around the world. In addition, we will list your family or company name (if you choose) on our website as a silver level sponsor of the ROCKIT chair project.

$1,000 Perk: Gold Level Sponsorship

As a $1000 donor, we appreciate your sponsorship of ROC Wheels and the ROCKIT Chair project. We believe that you deserve recognition in honor of your donation and you or your business will be listed as a gold-level sponsor of the project. We will also send a great care package of ROC Wheel's t-shirts, hats, pens, and stickers so that you can show your support wherever you go. All donations are tax deductible and will be documented for proof of giving.

$10,000 Perk: Corporate Sponsorship

As a corporate sponsor of ROC Wheels it shows that your business is not only contributing locally but also globally. As a sign of appreciation, we will list your company as a corporate sponsor of ROC Wheels on our website and provide the link to your company website as well. In addition we will send you stickers, pens, hats, and t-shirts to spread the word about mobility around your community. All donations are tax deductible and you will receive a donation receipt through Indiegogo. 

Note: Actual shirt type and color may vary.

Another Chair = Another Challenge

When working internationally, we often face challenges that can be tough to overcome. Even though we have worked in some of toughest countries in the world such as Iraq and Afghanistan, cooperation with foreign governments can place road blocks in our way. However, in order to combat these struggles, we work with well-known in-country organizations to facilitate all of our wheelchair distributions. This has enabled us to go into countries that at first appear impossible to serve. 

Frequently Asked Questions

Is ROC Wheels an registered 501(c)3 non-profit organization?
Yes we have been a registered non-profit since 2001 and as a result, your donations will be automatically tax deductible through the Indiegogo service.
Can I donate in other ways?
If you would prefer to donate via check then please make the check out to ROC Wheels, Inc. and send it to 702 N. 19th Avenue, Suite 1B, Bozeman, MT 59718. If you would prefer to donate with PayPal then please visit www.rocwheels.org/donate
What does ROC mean?
ROC stands for Reach Out and Care and we have used this as our motto since early 2001. Our youth program is also called YEWTHS ROC and this stands for Youth Empowered With The Helper Spirit.
Is the ROCKIT chair rocket-powered?
Unfortunately, no. Despite what you may think, the word ROCKIT was actually created because the ROCKIT chair is not just a chair but it is also a kit that can be assembled by communities around the world.
Everyone makes wheelchairs, what makes you different?
Unlike a lot of other non-profits, ROC's focus is primarily on children with severe disabilities that are in need of a wheelchair that will adapt and grow with them throughout their childhood. The ROCKIT is one the first to fully meet and exceed this need, to make sure that these children are getting the best support and care.
 How are wheelchair's delivered?
Since our founding in 1999, we have delivered a majority of our chairs through wheelchair distributions to specific locations. ROC volunteers ensure that the chairs are properly fitted to each child and help train the parents/caregivers on how to use the different functions of the wheelchair.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that it is not always possible to contribute but we still love seeing people reach out and care in their own communities. If you feel like you have gifts and skills that could be used by our organization, please send us an email at info@rocwheels.org. Also, please be sure to share this campaign with your friends and family around the world with the share tools below. We want more people to know about this problem and how they can be a part of the solution.

For more information on volunteer opportunities and other ways to get involved, visit www.rocwheels.org/get-involved.
story_txt:
About ROC Wheels
 ROC (Reach Out and Care) Wheels is a 501-c(3) non-profit organization located in Bozeman, Montana. For the past 15 years our mission has been to mobilize children in less resourced countries using the gifts and talents of our global community. An estimated 65 million people are in need of wheelchairs and of those almost 6.5 children in less-resourced countries are in need of an adaptable wheelchair. 

In 1999, our founders, Wayne and Lee-Ann Hanson traveled to
Kenya with a group of young adults. With the support of a doctor and a seating
specialist, 50 children were custom fit into their adaptable wheelchairs which
provided the therapeutic support they needed 
to function to the best of their ability. It was exciting to discover
how the Kenyan children’s lives were transformed when they were able to sit
proudly and interact with their families, their peers and with the American
youth. Great things happen when people are given the opportunity to reach out
and care to each other.
After realizing how many wheelchairs were needed around the
world, Wayne and Lee decided to develop wheelchairs and services specially
designed for children with severe disabilities. They also realized how
important it is to help the citizens in less resourced countries become more
self-sufficient by training the care-givers, and equipping them to build their
own wheelchairs. To-date, ROC Wheels has delivered over 10,000 wheelchairs which
has provided freedom of mobility for both the children and their families. ROC Chair production has been established
in  four countries. Inmates in the US
build ROC Kits which are assembled by students in the public schools. It is
exciting when people world-wide work together and accomplish great things
through the power of partnering. 
The ROCKIT Project




Our campaign is directed to help us fund the tooling and
production  of our newest wheelchair, the
ROCKIT Chair. The ROCKIT Chair can be configured as 3 different wheelchairs; an
independent wheelchair, 3 wheeled all-terrain wheelchair or adaptive stroller. The
ROCKIT Chair is designed to serve children with even the most severe
disabilities A comparable adaptable wheelchair sells for over $4,000 on the
U.S. market because of the numerous seating and support features and the
wheelchair’s ability to grow, tilt and recline. 
It is also unique in its ability to fold compactly to accommodate
public transportation. 
The ROCKIT is both a kit and a complete wheelchair. These kits will be sent to communities around the globe and help promote employment and development. In addition, completed chairs can be sent overseas to children that are in need of immediate support through one of our various wheelchair distributions. 
To reduce production costs we are currently seeking $70,000 to outsource tooling for the pieces and parts to build these advanced wheelchairs and set up the ROCKIT Kits.In
addition, we are seeking $26,000 to build 100  ROCKIT Chair Kits which will be used to equip
people in Guatemala, Kosovo and the Dominican Republic to develop a sustainable
wheelchair delivery operation. By doing this we will be able to streamline our ability to equip people in less resourced countries to use the ROCKIT Kits to build chairs and provide employment. We will also be able to reduce the cost to make it more affordable and allow our global partner to purchase and distribute worldwide.
Your Contribution: Return on Investment


With your contributions, we will be able to continue our mission of outreach, mobility, and empowerment. 

Outreach: By supporting this campaign you will enable children around the globe to experience mobility. We will be able to distribute thousands of additional wheelchairs around the globe to places such as Argentina, Kosovo, Guatemala, and Mexico. In addition, your contributions will put hundreds of people to work on making the necessary tools and parts for the chair. in addition, it is our goal that these children will not only be helped by us but also reach out to others. With our world undergoing struggles on political and economic levels, this gift of mobility and community involvement promotes progress and peace around the globe. 

Mobility:  Mobility is more than transportation, it is what enables a child to experience their surroundings with their community and family. Many of the children that we help are often left on dirt floors with no hope of every leaving a 6x6 area on the ground. Not only is this unsanitary and harmful to the child's health but it also makes the child feel hopeless and insignificant. Mobility and proper support helps creates that hope and it is one of the greatest gifts.  
Empowerment: You will be making it possible for primary and secondary (K-12) students around the United States to participate in funding and building chairs, through our YEWTHS ROC program, to be sent to various destinations around the globe. These children not only gain valuable skills in teamwork, manufacturing, and volunteering, but also realize that they have gifts and talents that they can use to help the world. In addition, we currently employ inmates at the South Dakota State Correctional Facility to help create kits that will be used to make complete ROCKIT chairs by communities around the globe.

 In order to fully fund the new ROCKIT chair and the ROCKIT Kit,  we have been quoted $70,000. This would include plastic molds, fixtures, and the necessary tools for mass production. This would additionally fund the development of a curriculum to support self sustainability.and  In addition to the $70,000, we are asking for $26,000 to fund the production of another 100 ROCKIT chairs . This is in order to achieve the proper economies of scale to make production both efficient and cost effective. Although we know this is a significant investment into production this gives us the opportunity to exponentially increase the number of children we can serve.  
If we do not reach our goal by the end of this campaign, the funds will be held until we can raise enough money to accomplish our goals. We are confident that we will have raised enough through not only through this campaign but through other private funding efforts in the Bozeman community. Your funds will not go to waste because we will not stop until we can provide children the mobility that they deserve.

$5 Perk: Personal Thank-You Email and Desktop Wallpaper
$25 Perk: ROC Wheels Pens and Stickers

              
$100 Perk: I ROC Hat                                      $100 Perk: ROC Wheels Hat


            
$100 Perk: ROCKIT T-Shirt                          $100 Perk: YEWTHS ROC T-Shirt

For donating $500 we will include all of the $25 perks along with 4 ROC Wheels T-Shirts so that your whole family can spread the word of mobility around the world. In addition, we will list your family or company name (if you choose) on our website as a silver level sponsor of the ROCKIT chair project.

As a $1000 donor, we appreciate your sponsorship of ROC Wheels and the ROCKIT Chair project. We believe that you deserve recognition in honor of your donation and you or your business will be listed as a gold-level sponsor of the project. We will also send a great care package of ROC Wheel's t-shirts, hats, pens, and stickers so that you can show your support wherever you go. All donations are tax deductible and will be documented for proof of giving.
$10,000 Perk: Corporate Sponsorship

story:
Short Summary

"From the Blood of Abel" attempts to diagnose the root causes of humanity's violence, and then argues how the Bible offers a proper diagnosis. While this is not a light read by any means, it should be accessible for those interested in theology/anthropology/philosophy and especially those who are interested in peacemaking. 

The release date will be sometime in the Fall/Winter of 2016.

What I Need

I am asking for $2,000 in order to pay my editors, cover publishing costs, and if possible, for promoting the book. If I do not achieve my goal, my primary goal is to cover editing and publishing costs.

The Impact

In a time such as this, where violence pervades our world, this book is a timely one indeed. We are in desperate need of a solution to this problem, which I believe is found in the Gospel of Christ Jesus, or as St. Paul called it, "the gospel of peace." With your help, this book has the potential to impact others in a most profound way.

So thank you in advance for any assistance you can provide. I am reverentially grateful. 

Grace and peace.

story:
101 Albums You Should Die Before You Hear

We've given ourselves just six weeks to create a book unlike anything you've seen before. Everett True (Careless Talk Costs Lives, Plan B Magazine, Collapse Board, NME, Melody Maker) and friends are attempting to write and publish a collection of funny, cruel, clever, brutally honest, purely vitriolic and poetic criticisms of our most loved and most hated albums.  Accompanied by suitably sardonic illustrations. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need at least £5,000 to bring our book into life. We'll need to cover all of the financial aspects that go into publishing a book as well as paying our lovely contributors for their hard work. What we hope to achieve is something so attractive you'll want to have it on your coffee table and so funny you'll read it time and time again.

Risks & Challenges

Now you have the chance to be in at the start of a brand new project alongside some of the world's greatest* music critics. However, we've only given ourselves six weeks to do it. So we really need your help in making this book as great as we know that it can be! Go look at our perks and see what you can get in return for your help.

*Some might disagree.

PayPal

If for some reason you are unable to donate via this page, then please visit our website www.rejectedunknown.tumblr.com where you can donate via PayPal. Make sure you state which perk you would like in response to your donation.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to pledge, there are still things you can do to help! Get the word out and share our funding page on Facebook, Twitter etc. 

And stop listening to such bloody terrible music.


Illustration © 2015: Vincent Vanoli
