story:
Magyarul itt találsz meg minket.

 

The story

Peter and Robert are two university students in their mid twenties from Hungary. Their aim is to discover the United States from a unique and personal perspective you’ve never seen before. Twenty years after the fall of Communism two youngsters set out to discover the idealized West and the American dream of their childhood, or what’s left of it. All of our experiences and gathered knowledge will be put into a book for readers to enjoy and learn. The forty day long road trip across eighteen states will shed light on important contemporary topics and issues. To truly discover the country you need to know its people. This project is focused on people and their feelings and ambitions.

The product

The book will come out in two languages, Hungarian and English. Peter will be doing most of the writing in his beloved Hungarian, while Robert will be doing the translations almost simultaneously. We intend to tell our stories in a handful of loosely connected articles, or journey entries.

There’s more!  You see we understand that waiting for a book to come out can feel like an eternity, and that is why we will have a site during our journey with daily updates. Photos, video entries and short notes will help you keep up with our progress, feel part of the action!


Where do we stand

The project’s target is 3500$ which will be required for the printing of the book, post and packing costs and most important of all car rental. The plane tickets, transport tickets and deposits have been paid with our hard-earned money, so we’re definitely going. We have already invested thousands of dollars in this project so we need your help to give us a final go. Here’s where your money will go:

  • Gas, food, car rental
  • Printing the book that we’ve always dreamt of
  • If we are overfunded by some miracle, we will spend it on desperately needed equipment upgrades, including new laptop batteries, a proper camera and other shiny toys

Can we pull this off?

We hope so. When purchasing a plane ticket one can never really know what adventures await, we might end up in a ditch somewhere along the interstate or have the dullest road trip ever. The point is, we can’t give you any guarantees, but we will sure as hell give it our best shot, and we do know what we’re doing:

  • We are experienced backpackers, having visited more than fifteen countries
  • Peter is a veteran freelance journalist and writer, qualified editor, translator
  • Robert is an English teacher, and has years of experience in the field as interpreter and translator
  • Both active Couchsurfers
  • We hold valid driver’s licenses – huzzah!

… and more importantly, we are crazy enough to believe – heck, even know – that we can and will do this.

The Impact

There are many travel guides out there but none of them offers a personal approach with a unique perspective. Following the footsteps of Hunter S. Thompson the book will be made up of short chapters with some good old fashioned gonzo journalism. Despite the fact that plane tickets are cheap today many of our peers can’t afford to make this trip. Not to mention that Hungary needs to open up to the world and get a peek into the life of different people. Tolerance and acceptance can only be achieved through understanding. This project is surely informative and interesting for American readers as well. Seeing yourself and your society in a mirror may be interesting and it helps to have a better image of oneself. Our contribution to this effort may seem small but the results will be promising. We don’t want to offend anyone though our perspective might appear critical sometimes. We have experience with critical writing since our career at the university depends on it. Being objective is hard sometimes but we will do our best to keep standards high.

Other Ways You Can Help

All contributions are appreciated and we thank you for the help you’ve given. By spreading the word you’ve already done a great deal of pushing our cause forward. If you favor this project make sure to get the attention of your friends and family.

Don’t have a dollar to spare but still want to help out? No problem. Bring in five contributors and you will receive the “25 dollars” perk!

Spread the word! Visit our facebook site for fresh updates, follow us on twitter for personal insights, check out our Tumblr page and feel free to ask any questions here, or via our mailing address.

 

…

So this is us asking for your help! We will embark on the journey of a lifetime and we would very much like to share our experiences with you. Many wonders, joy, beauty and probably trouble await us on the road, but that’s alright. We’re here to explore  and that’s precisely what we intend to do, explore a country, its people and by doing so maybe even expand the understanding of us as a country, as a people and as individuals.

Kerouac might be dead, but sure as hell no one told us.

Cheers,
Peter and Robert

 

 

* Here's what's up: due to our limited time and resources we can only visit you if you live within a 100 mile radius of the following cities: New York, Washigton DC., Norfolt, Charlston, Jacksonville, Orlando, Miami, Key West, Tampa, Birmingham, Montgomery, New Orleans, Houston, Austin, Roswell, Albuquerque, Las Vegas, Los Angeles, Monterey, San Francisco and Chicago. Yes, we are not as spontaine and free spirited as we'd like you to beleive.

** They're real, google it.

Yes, we are not as spontaine and free spirited as we'd like you to beleive.

story:
Thank you kindly for viewing this. I am so very grateful to be sharing this with you. I believe that through story, art, and food, defenses are broken. There is so much beauty that deserves exposure and I have a burning passion to expose it. Many countries are looked at as failing  economies and wastes of space. Its sad, it really is. The goal is to create an awareness of the beauty that already exists in the world and celebrate it. One of the greatest gifts we have been given is creativity. I hope to use what I have been given to share with everyone, and that includes you :). Imagine smelling the experience of Laos while in your own kitchen...

I have spent a total of 4 years working in various non profits. If you see my age, you will find that it is my entire adult life. In the little experience I have had with it, I am finding that we all have the ability to do something fantastic, something unique and something more. Everyone has a story and everyone matters. Through reading the stories of women and cooking the foods they cook, we are creating a natural sense of togetherness. Learning can be fun, just support the creativity and utilize the things you have been given for good. 

The funds I am seeking for this project are going to be used to purchase my Around the World ticket which costs $3,500. They will also be used for ground fees while in each country.I already have the contacts and the culinary experience from the school I am attending. I would love the opportunity to buy the groceries for each family I stay with as a thank you for their recipe and hospitality. I am getting excited just thinking about it, aren't you!? 

Thank you again!  Your time and contributions are greatly appreciated. 

Sincerely, 

Katherine Smith

story:
Short Summary

After eight years, and many hours later, I have finally finished my songwriter's book, working title - The Songwriter's Voice. 

I left songwriting in 1976 and didn't return until 1998.  I was told I wasn't any good and I pawned my guitar for $25 and went to sleep.

When I returned I was so unsure of myself that I didn't think I was going to pursue it. But a mentor helped me through.  He is the catalyst for this book. I asked him questions by email, late at night and he always responded with candor.

This went on for three years. I started to think if other writers felt the same way as I did. So I asked them.  26 writers to be exact from all across Canada and the US. They responded - each and every one and this is their story.

All the writers answered the same questions thoughtfully and the similarities are remarkable. But so are the differences. It's a joy to read and very moving at times.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to find out how many books to print, so we're running this campaign for pre-order.  The book is about 150 pages and is not a "how-to" book about songwriting. It's about the mind and voice of many songwriters.  It will be available in soft copy and Kindle. 

The Impact

I hope by sharing the words of many songwriters, others will be encouraged to pick up the pen and dabble.  Who knows?  It's the possible moment of "a-ha" that will move them forward.  Anyone you know who has ever wanted to write will benefit from this book.  It gives insight into how the songwriter's mind works - in the business, in the performing, in the writing.  It's something to start the conversation.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't afford a book, please help us spread the word about this.  Schools that teach writing, music associations, anyone and anywhere writers gatther to ponder the process.  It's a great place to start a conversation.

story:
Short Summary

As a married father of two (soon to be three) girls, I don't have a lot of disposable income. What I do have is a burning passion to help make my city the best that it can be by becoming a City Council Member. Some quick facts about mysef:

  • 31 year old IT professional
  • As a child in a military family growing up, I never had the deep connection to any single place I lived. While the re-locations went a long ways toward making me the man I am today, I want my daughters to have deep roots in a good community. Part of my job as a father is to ensure that the community they live in stays on the right path, and the best way I can manage that is to serve as a City Council member.

What I Need & What You Get

Why am I asking for over $500 in funding?

While I have already purchase my campaign signs, campaign litereature is expensive. You may not be aware of this, but most city council campaigns are self-funded to the tune of thousands of dollars. I have just about maxed out on the amount I can afford to spend on this campaign. Left to purchase:

  • More campaign literature
  • More campaign signs
  • Door hangers
  • Fuel to travel to various neighborhoods to introduce myself to constituents.

Shoud I not reach my fundraising goal, the funds will be turned over to charity of my choice, but NOT political in nature.

The Impact

In contributing to my campaign, you will be helping someone who otherwise might not be able to compete with the 'monied' folks in his town. I entered the race knowing I was at a disadvantage, and now I'm out to prove that funding doesn't have to come from deep personal pockets, or by cozying up to local businesses - it can come from folks who believe in the common man being able to make a difference. That's what your contribution really means - it's giving me a chance to make a difference in my community.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help monetarily, there ARE other things you can do.

  • Go to http://www.facebook.com/AdamForCityCouncil and like the page - perception of popularity is important in political races.
  • If are local, contact me and offer to help in door-knocking, literature stuffing, etc.
  • If you aren't local, find a candidate near you at the local level you can help - no matter what you think, every local candidate needs help.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word!

story:
The Train kept a-rollin', all night long...


**UPDATE MARCH 9, 2014** My I.W.D. perk sold out and Indiegogo's promotion is over, thank you all!  I'm going to leave the bit about why Indiegogo included me in their endeavor, as I'm still proud and honored they did and it relates some important stuff about the book in general.  Only a few days left, we're in the home stretch!

**UPDATE MARCH 5, 2014** Regarding my campaign's inclusion with Indiegogo's International Women's Day initiative, see below...and check the perks for a new, I.W.D. offer! 


I'm Tripp, an aspiring writer from Pittsburgh or Monmouth County, NJ, depending on how you want to look at it.  I went to Dickinson College in Carlisle, PA (not Fairleigh), grad school at University of Maryland in College Park and I'm now living in Baltimore and working on my first novel.   

Here's why I'm doing this thing here: best, quickest answer is I want to finish the novel.  I've wanted to be a writer since I've seriously wanted to be anything (as in around the time I stopped wanting to be President, an astronaut, right field or pitcher for the Pittsburgh Pirates or an action movie star), I've been writing pretty much all my life, got my English major and a creative writing MFA, and I know I'm supposed to be a writer, destined or whatever if you dig that sort of thing, and it's far past time I actually got there.  The money I'll raise with this will go entirely to the writing.  It will pay for my living expenses so that I can work full-time on this project, first novel of a trilogy, and get it published.

I've already written most of book 1 and bits from books 2 and 3-I need a few more months to finish and edit the draft of book 1 and start shopping it around.  I'm not asking for much because I don't need much, just the time to get it done and the money to buy the time; all the money goes to me to pay the bills: rent and utilities, food, living expenses, etc...the extra $500 in there covers Indiegogo's fee.

                                                                                                                                              

International Women's Day

Here's why Indiegogo chose this to be one of its featured I.W.D. campaigns, taken from the email I sent them requesting the privilege of being included.  NOTE: Unfortunately, since at the outset this book doesn't seem like it would fit the parameters of female empowerment, I had to divulge some plot spoilers to make my case properly.  They're not too bad, but they will ratchet down the suspense a little as you read, so if you're like me and hate spoilers I have marked the spoiler-ific portion of this, you can just skip it and read the rest.

The novel begins as, down to its essentials, a "damsel in distress" tale.  The truth is though it goes a hell of a lot deeper. 

SPOILER ALERT

The young lady in question soon proves herself to be both a damsel and in distress only by the most literal definitions of the word.  Held captive, she quickly asserts herself using a growing new found strength of the physical, mental and emotional varieties.  By the end of the book and far more so by the end of the trilogy, the reader (and Susannah herself) discovers new, previously unknown depths of power within her.  First she subverts her captors in small, minor ways, but soon openly challenges them, hurts them, endangers them, and eventually overcomes them.  She escapes, joins my main character (much to his surprise; he thought he was rescuing her), and even while dealing with the PTSD caused by her capture and captivity joins him and others in a new quest to stamp out the sinister cabal who had previously kidnapped her.  Whether or not she survives to the end of this book or the end of the trilogy is beside the point, and I'm not telling either way; when it comes to her, or any of the characters, just remember valar morghulis, all men (and women) must die.  Live or dead though, it's a victory for Susannah.  It's a coming of age and a coming out...with a vengeance.  

END OF SPOILER

My other major female character is a villain but she is nonetheless compelling; she is beautiful and proud of it but neither vain nor exploitative of it, a recognized equal of her male counterparts, and frighteningly adept at the machinations of their dark agenda aboard The Black Train.  The other, more minor female characters throughout the story are strong as well-some rich, some poor, young, old, black and white.  Some have been weathered and  beaten down by the events of the story and by the world in general but all are proud, all know themselves and are content in the knowledge yet at the same time always striving to better themselves and their station in life.  Most importantly, the events of the trilogy take place in the late 1940s and early 1950s, so while these women are fighting an uphill battle they're also winning, slowly but surely breaking new ground and discovering new frontiers.  Female empowerment, empowerment of anyone and everyone who is held prisoner (literally as well as figuratively) by stereotypes and fixed ideas, is one of the major themes of the work, as is the deliberate yet organic subversion of the stock character archetypes-specifically female-so often found in fiction, especially the realms this trilogy occupies: crime/thrillers, fantasy, and popular fiction in general.  This is a concept of great importance to me, both as an author and a person.  Once you read The Black Train, its sequel Dog Star, and the final chapter of the saga, untitled as of now, I’m sure you will agree.

                                                                                                                                              

 


 

Here's a not-so-brief summary:

It's the first volume of a trilogy, and I'm calling the book, the whole trilogy or both "The Black Train."  It's a big damn thing, sprawling and ambitious in scope but focused and specific in execution, the story of a few small men who become enveloped in a series of events far larger than themselves.  The books are written as populist fare with an artistic and intellectual core, an exciting, page-turning adventure/thriller/horror/dark fantasy which, between the lines, offers complex examinations of and meditations on violence, courage, morality, friendship, and this great sprawling mass of a country we call America and even humanity itself, what we are (and aren't), and all the wonderful and terrible things we are capable of.

The novel deals with history, set 60 years in the past, and the way our past parallels our present and future, even when set in a fictional world (see: Deadwood, Rome, even Game Of Thrones, McCann's Let The Great World Spin, Lehane's The Given Day and Live By Night, pretty much everything James Ellroy has ever written), as well as class issues/struggles, racism, gender relations/politics, violence, technology and progress, the American consciousness and the notion of what civilization itself is, what it means, how it is maintained and advanced, sacrifice and struggle.  It's a big-hearted novel of big ideas, ambitious as hell, but still fun to read whether you pay attention to the subtext or not.  That, by the by, is what all art, and specifically literature, is supposed to do in my opinion.

The setting, at least at the outset, is Pittsburgh, PA, circa 1950.  William "Cully" Cullinane is a late-20s WWII vet, back in the States and trying to find his way.  He's found himself positioned halfway between his two best friends, from earliest childhood to the service to now: not straight enough (or with the requisite tolerance for BS) to be a cop like stalwart, obsessive David but not quite amoral enough to run around with the murderous, lethal Crack, though he tried the latter.  The life of a knockaround guy, freelance gun and muscle for various underworld figures, never quite worked but then again nothing else did either, and all Cully knows is he has a talent for the heavy work, violence, and he's not much use at anything else.  He finds himself almost by accident becoming an unlicensed private investigator, he wouldn't mind getting made legit he just keeps forgetting to get around to it.  He's got an ex-wife, no family to speak of, a reputation sliding down from dubious to downright bad and isn't rolling in dough but he's doing okay.  Then there's a knock at his office door (it's also his apartment and he's there rent-free, but that's another story), and the knock changes everything.

Seems there a little girl, a young woman really, lost somewhere out there.  Nothing new about that but this girl might be something special, someone that harsh realities of the darkness lurking in the world out there shouldn't be allowed to touch.  This little girl also has a rich daddy, a real rich daddy in fact, and he wants her found.  Cully's exact sort of work, and for good hard cash what could be better?  But there's a lot going on Cully doesn't know or understand; for starters, the father is not saying much, and what he does don't make a hell of a lot of sense.  He's sure she's been kidnapped, but there's no ransom.  He's desperate to find her but demands police involvement kept to the minimum.  And, by the way, just why exactly (let alone how) does a 17-year-old princess of the city who's so damn perfect get herself snatched without apparent reason or trace?

But money talks, and rumors abound.  

Cully reaches out and starts hearing things.  Disturbing things.  There's a young punk with the pretty blue eyes and the rebellious attitude all the girls seem to flock to, a low-end dope fiend with a story just might be too crazy to make up, gangsters sniffing around with smiles on their faces and brass knuckles in their fists, tales of bizarre goings-on at the outskirts on the city near the tracks, maybe near the Byzantine system of underground tunnels currently being constructed, coincidentally by the aforementioned loving and worried papa bear.  There's also some mysterious stranger who's not the romantic figure the term implies but instead a straight-up hard case, a tough guy whose motivations are unknown.  Then there's the specter of Doctor X, the unofficial name of the soul (if he has one at all) who may or may not be responsible for multiple seemingly-unconnected murders in and around the Burgh stretching back a decade or more.  If he or she or it even exists.  Is there a connection?  Is a connection even possible?  And at the center of it all is a sweet and pretty young lady, by all accounts an innocent among innocents.  

Cully's gonna find her.  Because he gave his word (one of the only things in this world he gives a damn about), because he took the father's money (he's an honest guy even when he ain't, and besides there's always the promise of more), but mostly because he wants to prove something.  To the father, to his friends, to the little girl, to the world, to himself.  He's out to prove neither the world nor Bill Cullinane is past redemption, beyond all hope.  Believe: dead or alive, spoiled or untouched, he's gonna find her.

And he just might.  But that's not all he's gonna find.  Somewhere, down the tracks, The Black Train awaits.  That right there is the problem with tracks, by the way; once you're on 'em you're on 'em, can't go left or right but only forward, and maybe when you think you're chasing something you're really only on a collision course.


This book is good.  I don't mind saying it.  Not just cause it's mine but because I know good and this story's got legs.  If it gets out there, it'll sell.  It might even sell huge.  This is your opportunity to get in early on what I think could, with a lot of hard work and a little luck, something pretty big (in terms of pop-culture and the publishing industry anyway), so come on, jump aboard The Black Train.  The going will not be all that smooth, and some of your fellow passengers might be a little scary...or even a little dangerous...but it's gonna be one hell of a ride, one you're not gonna wanna miss.

The Train kept a-rollin', all night long...

The novel deals with history, set 60 years in the past, and the way our past parallels our present and future, even when set in a fictional world (see: Deadwood, Rome, even Game Of Thrones, McCann's Let The Great World Spin, Lehane's The Given Day and Live By Night, pretty much everything James Ellroy has ever written), as well as class issues/struggles, racism, gender relations/politics, violence, technology and progress, the American consciousness and the notion of what civilization itself is, what it means, how it is maintained and advanced, sacrifice and struggle.  It's a big-hearted novel of big ideas, ambitious as hell, but still fun to read whether you pay attention to the subtext or not.  That, by the by, is what all art, and specifically literature, is supposed to do in my opinion.
The setting, at least at the outset, is Pittsburgh, PA, circa 1950.  William "Cully" Cullinane is a late-20s WWII vet, back in the States and trying to find his way.  He's found himself positioned halfway between his two best friends, from earliest childhood to the service to now: not straight enough (or with the requisite tolerance for BS) to be a cop like stalwart, obsessive David but not quite amoral enough to run around with the murderous, lethal Crack, though he tried the latter.  The life of a knockaround guy, freelance gun and muscle for various underworld figures, never quite worked but then again nothing else did either, and all Cully knows is he has a talent for the heavy work, violence, and he's not much use at anything else.  He finds himself almost by accident becoming an unlicensed private investigator, he wouldn't mind getting made legit he just keeps forgetting to get around to it.  He's got an ex-wife, no family to speak of, a reputation sliding down from dubious to downright bad and isn't rolling in dough but he's doing okay.  Then there's a knock at his office door (it's also his apartment and he's there rent-free, but that's another story), and the knock changes everything.
Seems there a little girl, a young woman really, lost somewhere out there.  Nothing new about that but this girl might be something special, someone that harsh realities of the darkness lurking in the world out there shouldn't be allowed to touch.  This little girl also has a rich daddy, a real rich daddy in fact, and he wants her found.  Cully's exact sort of work, and for good hard cash what could be better?  But there's a lot going on Cully doesn't know or understand; for starters, the father is not saying much, and what he does don't make a hell of a lot of sense.  He's sure she's been kidnapped, but there's no ransom.  He's desperate to find her but demands police involvement kept to the minimum.  And, by the way, just why exactly (let alone how) does a 17-year-old princess of the city who's so damn perfect get herself snatched without apparent reason or trace?
But money talks, and rumors abound.  
Cully reaches out and starts hearing things.  Disturbing things.  There's a young punk with the pretty blue eyes and the rebellious attitude all the girls seem to flock to, a low-end dope fiend with a story just might be too crazy to make up, gangsters sniffing around with smiles on their faces and brass knuckles in their fists, tales of bizarre goings-on at the outskirts on the city near the tracks, maybe near the Byzantine system of underground tunnels currently being constructed, coincidentally by the aforementioned loving and worried papa bear.  There's also some mysterious stranger who's not the romantic figure the term implies but instead a straight-up hard case, a tough guy whose motivations are unknown.  Then there's the specter of Doctor X, the unofficial name of the soul (if he has one at all) who may or may not be responsible for multiple seemingly-unconnected murders in and around the Burgh stretching back a decade or more.  If he or she or it even exists.  Is there a connection?  Is a connection even possible?  And at the center of it all is a sweet and pretty young lady, by all accounts an innocent among innocents.  
Cully's gonna find her.  Because he gave his word (one of the only things in this world he gives a damn about), because he took the father's money (he's an honest guy even when he ain't, and besides there's always the promise of more), but mostly because he wants to prove something.  To the father, to his friends, to the little girl, to the world, to himself.  He's out to prove neither the world nor Bill Cullinane is past redemption, beyond all hope.  Believe: dead or alive, spoiled or untouched, he's gonna find her.
And he just might.  But that's not all he's gonna find.  Somewhere, down the tracks, The Black Train awaits.  That right there is the problem with tracks, by the way; once you're on 'em you're on 'em, can't go left or right but only forward, and maybe when you think you're chasing something you're really only on a collision course.This book is good.  I don't mind saying it.  Not just cause it's mine but because I know good and this story's got legs.  If it gets out there, it'll sell.  It might even sell huge.  This is your opportunity to get in early on what I think could, with a lot of hard work and a little luck, something pretty big (in terms of pop-culture and the publishing industry anyway), so come on, jump aboard The Black Train.  The going will not be all that smooth, and some of your fellow passengers might be a little scary...or even a little dangerous...but it's gonna be one hell of a ride, one you're not gonna wanna miss.

story:
A book for the brave new designers...

The plan is connect old and new generations in a celebration of life through creation, i doesn´t matter if its a cup to drink coffee or a spaceship. Any idea is worthy if you can execute and enjoy creation.

  • Everybody has the right to create, but given the imminent arrival of a manufacturing and design revolution (mass 3d printer sales, free design software), everybody needs guidance and information to this world.
  • I intent to include the kids, the mothers, the grandma´s, people who want to create but don´t know how, but have the itch...
  • With your help, i will start an educational site about design, manufacturing using 3d printing and a really simple yet effective approach to executing ideas. My objective is to teach as many people as i can to create their own things to improve their lives. 

Would you like to be part of the group that connected all this in one book and website?

 " ...sometimes I've believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast." 

Through the Looking Glass-

The character of the book! He just want to help you create!


Who i am:

  • I am Ivan Weinreb, 3d artist and industrial designer, currently i design from faucets to holographic perception interfaces, 10 years experience in 3d photorealistic modeling, 6 years as commercial industrial designer, i 3d print my ideas every week, already with many designs on the market. Here are two of them:

The Butterfly: 

https://www.shapeways.com/model/1473442/the-butterfly.html?li=search-results&materialId=6

Vulcano:

http://www.trendhunter.com/trends/golden-ratio-faucet


Also wrote the book: Diseño para todos, currently on translation to english and available on iTunes:

https://itunes.apple.com/es/book/diseno-para-todos/id657084734?mt=11

and off course in blurb:

http://store.blurb.com/ebooks/398822-diseno-para-todos


The needs...

I need first to focus on getting the book online (ebook) and deliver the first edition in physical form (for this i will use Blurb). I start to publish the book on the Joy of creation blog on November 25, if everything goes ok the physical book will be sent 21 December.

  • We need to create a website, dedicated as a platform to publish everything related to the campaign, the book, and possibly later a podcast.
  • I we don´t reach the final goal, i will finish the book anyway, so even if 10 people buy it on the book perk, they will get it.

CONTRIBUTE

People who contribute must know that we cannot measure the final impact on the readers life, since this will be a very friendly manual to creation, and hopefully will ignite careers for people who don´t know right now that they can start today. In fact, is my bottom line to continue this initiative with or without funds. 

  • 3d printers are on the verge of becoming massive in the next 24 months.
  • Several huge houses like google and autodesk are giving away free 3d modeling software - very friendly versions, because the already know whats happening: Soon 3d printing will change the world as we know it.
  • I want to put my dent, and for that i need, not only the money, but the audience to listen to this: 
    Creation is a lifestyle, and a very healthy one. As soon as you start living it, your mind will begin to look differently at anything presented to you. You will change, and the world will change to you.
Participate even without money:

As the final objective of the campaign is to spread the Creative Lifestyle, it would really help us if you spread the campaign and the site. Your questions could help me to expand the content of the book by answering some of them on it. This book is going to be complete if it includes interaction during the process with you!

story:
Together, we can change the world -- one job at a time!

No matter who you are, unemployment has touched your life somehow.

  • Maybe you were laid off and haven't been able to find work for months (or years).
  • Maybe your spouse, you mother, or your neighbor had to leave their job because of circumstances beyond their control, and now they work two low-paying jobs just to pay the bills.
  • Maybe your child or grandchild will be graduating from college soon, and employment opportunities look grim. (Just thinking about all that student debt makes you cringe.)
  • Or maybe you're blessed with a wonderful job, and you just want to help others achieve the same level of satisfaction and self-worth.

Imagine if all those people had someone to hold them by the hand and calmly walk them down the path to their next great job opportunity.

YOU can help make that happen right now.

My name is Carlos Gil, and I am a statistic.

In 2008, I was laid off from my financial services job due to the sudden massive downturn in the U.S. economy. My wife was eight months pregnant. We lost our home. We lost our cars. We went bankrupt.

I was broke. But I wasn't broken.

During that terrible time, I experienced a whirlwind of emotions. I was sad, lonely, angry, bitter, and depressed -- but I didn't give up. Instead, I turned to social media for help. The support I found there, and the tools I learned how to use, inspired me to "pay it forward" and help others like me find jobs. I created grassroots awareness and built a thriving community of job seekers and hiring professionals called JobsDirectUSA.

Today, I remain dedicated to helping people learn how to use social media to help them find suitable employment. I'm asking for your help to spread the word by funding the publication of my book My Unemployed Life: Finding a Job in a Social Economy. 

In the book I recount the emotional roller coaster of unemployment including bankruptcy, foreclosure, and how I re-branded myself through social media and founded a business, which helped thousands of professionals find jobs during the recession. The book also provides practical step-by-step advice on how to overcome many of the obstacles candidates face in today’s competitive job market.

According to the U.S. Bureau of Statistics, the number of people working or looking for work is expected to reach 162 million in 2014.

As baby boomers retire and exit the workforce, recruiting departments are actively seeking qualified and savvy professionals. Due to budget constraints, many Human Resources departments now require their recruiters to rely exclusively on social media to source candidates. That means having a professional, branded presence on LinkedIn, Facebook, and other social media is as important (or more important) than a great resume.

This book was written for:

  • New graduates (or soon-to-be graduates)
  • People laid-off from their old jobs
  • People fed-up with their current employers
  • People seeking a new start in a different field
  • Retirees or underemployed people looking for additional sources of income
  • People re-entering the work force after extensive time off
  • Entry-level to senior-level job seekers

This book teaches how to leverage social media in the job search including:

  • How to choose the right social media platform for your goals
  • How to find where the jobs are
  • How to brand yourself on social media
  • How to attract attention in a crowded, noisy social media environment
  • What to do if your current social media presence is a little sketchy
  • Exactly what to say when approaching recruiters online (scripts included)
  • How to introduce yourself and follow-up with interested recruiters
  • What the Fortune 500 recruiters are really looking for (in their own words)
  • How to navigate the river of natural emotions you may feel during this process

For the last six years I haven't asked for help. But this project is bigger than me alone, and it's too important to let slip away. So, I am asking for your support to help make the book a reality. 

We need your help!

Together we need to raise $15,257 to cover the cost of publishing a high-quality book and distribution to those in need. The funds you contribute will help pay for copywriting, proofreading, print and digital formatting, cover design, editing, securing an ISBN number, printing, and distribution.

It's a big number, but I KNOW we can reach or exceed it!

I know because I've been in hopeless situations before, and somehow I've come out of them stronger. Who do you know facing job loss, bankruptcy, foreclosure, or depression?

  • Your spouse?
  • Your sister?
  • Your best friend?

Do it for them. Your donation, whatever the size, will help people all over the world facing similar situations.

What's in it for you?

The biggest perk you will receive is the satisfaction of knowing you're helping thousands of people improve their lives. But we would also like to reward your generosity in a tangible way.

$5 - Good Karma

You will receive a heartfelt 'Thank you' e-mail. I will also send you a shout out on Twitter plus an invitation to an exclusive job search webinar.

$15 – E-Book

In addition to the Good Karma package, you will receive a PDF copy of the book and a FREE downloadable workbook, which can be used to help plan your own social media job search strategy! 

$50 – Social Good

You will receive all of the above plus a physical copy of My Unemployed Life: Finding a Job in a Social Economy including free shipping anywhere in the world. Plus, a 60-minute Google+ hangout exclusive to $50 sponsors and above.

$100 - Hard Worker

You will receive a signed copy of the book. Plus, your name will also be printed in the book on a special "Thank You" page! In addition, you’ll receive all the perks from the packages above.

$250 - Social Media Superstar

In addition to all the perks listed above, you will receive two additional signed copies of the book. They will be mailed to anyone you choose. I will also give you a shout out on four social media channels: LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter, and Google+ with a link to your website or any website you choose.

$500 – Page Sponsor (limited to 30)

In addition to all of the perks listed above. You will receive a sponsored page in the book, My Unemployed Life: Finding a Job in a Social Economy. 

$1250 - Generous Philanthropist (limited to 12)

In addition to all the perks listed above. I will create a special YouTube video message from myself. In addition, you or your company will be recognized as a generous supporter during the Google+ hangout and exclusive webinar. I will also send you 25 copies of the book. 

$5000 - Corporate Benefactor (limited to 3)

In addition to the perks listed above, 50 copies of the book will be mailed to you so you may distribute them to whomever you choose.

These limited edition books will have an inspiring message for the reader. For example: 

"We believe in you!"  -- A special gift from ____. "

Also, a special page will be created explaining how you or your company helped make this book a reality, and how you are helping to change the world -- one job at a time.

People are hungry, and they want to work!

But the job-hunting game has changed, and the deck is stacked against them. By funding this book, you'll be helping to teach people all over the country and the world how to turn the odds in their favor. Please contribute today.

Together, we can change the world -- one job at a time!

Other Ways You Can Help...

Even if you can't donate to this cause, please consider sharing this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, or wherever you happen to be networking. You never know whom you might be helping.

Indiegogo makes it so easy -- just click one of the Share buttons!

From the bottom of my heart and on behalf of the millions of unemployed people in this country...

Thank you!

Carlos Gil 

**To learn about my story, and why this project means a lot to me. Click here.

story:
In the wise words of Mark Twain, "The difference between the right word and the almost right word is the difference between lightning and a lightning bug."

As a writer, I love the challenge of finding the right words in the right place at the right time and I think over the next lifetime I might just be able to pull it off once or twice. Help me take my next step in writing, academia, and life in general! Give what you can and help me find my way to Writing By Degrees in Binghamton, NY as a featured panel presenter.

Help me take my next step in writing, academia, and life in general! Give what you can and help me find my way to Writing By Degrees in Binghamton, NY as a featured panel presenter.

story:
Here's my campaign:

 

Hi, my name is Bryn and I am an amateur photographer. I have been a professional photographer in the past working on weddings and doing a bit for the local newspaper on a freelance basis, but when my son came along a few years ago I gave the photographer business up and got a ‘proper job’ as my Dad would say.

 

I love photography and want to get myself set up to start making a living from capturing the world around me. To do this I need help.  I sold all of my equipment a few years ago and my computer is really out of date and, basically, that is why I am starting this Indiegogo campaign.

 

My campaign is a simple photography based one. I have a set of images I took on a 9-day trip to Canada and I am going to create limited edition prints and canvases for any one who helps to raise the funds I need to get myself a new camera and computer.

 

If I achieve my goal I will be able to take up photography once more and to be able to go out and start to build a portfolio of work to further my ambition of becoming a professional photographer.  

 

 

What I Need & What You Get:

 

I am looking for funding to buy a new camera and lens kit along with a new computer and hopefully the latest Adobe software to realise my dream.  I’ve set a target of £2000. However, I know that I will need more to get the camera I really want. So with your help we’ll push through the funding target!

 

I am a Canon man so I’m looking for a Canon camera that is around the £1000 mark. This really does depend on how the campaign goes and the rest will become the base for the new computer system. I’d love to go to an Apple store and slap a wad of cash on the counter, but that might just be wishful thinking.

 

My perks / rewards are made up from images that I took on the 9-day trip to Canada I made to celebrate my 30th birthday.  I have 35 images that are going to be used to create limited edition prints and canvases for those who help me succeed in my campaign. Although I mention a photo book in the video, unfortunately, I cannot find a way of making this cost effective.

 

You can find the full range of images at a special web page:

 

 www.watsonmartincreative.co.uk/9Days/images.html

 

The Impact:

 

These images represent the beginning of my career and without your help I won’t get out of the boring 9-5 office life I am living. I want to live my dream and do something I am passionate about. Photography is that passion.

 

All of my images are going to be limited edition pieces of art. You won’t be able to get this set of images anywhere else after this campaign is successful. If I become a famous photographer you won’t be forgotten. Every day I’ll remember those that contributed to getting me started. 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

 

Not everyone will be able to contribute in a monetary fashion, I know, but they can help spread the word about what I am doing and trying to achieve.

 

Let all of your friends and family, colleagues and acquaintances know about my campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out. Tweet the link to my campaign page, post it on Facebook, and tell everyone you know about my campaign to help me achieve my goal.

 

Thank you for reading my campaign page, thank you for visiting the web page and viewing my images and if you have contributed to making my dreams a reality I can never thank you enough. I am truly grateful.
story_txt:
Here's my campaign:
 
Hi, my name is Bryn and I am an amateur photographer. I have been a professional photographer in the past working on weddings and doing a bit for the local newspaper on a freelance basis, but when my son came along a few years ago I gave the photographer business up and got a ‘proper job’ as my Dad would say.

 
I love photography and want to get myself set up to start making a living from capturing the world around me. To do this I need help.  I sold all of my equipment a few years ago and my computer is really out of date and, basically, that is why I am starting this Indiegogo campaign.
 
My campaign is a simple photography based one. I have a set of images I took on a 9-day trip to Canada and I am going to create limited edition prints and canvases for any one who helps to raise the funds I need to get myself a new camera and computer.
 
If I achieve my goal I will be able to take up photography once more and to be able to go out and start to build a portfolio of work to further my ambition of becoming a professional photographer.   
 

 
What I Need & What You Get:
 
I am looking for funding to buy a new camera and lens kit along with a new computer and hopefully the latest Adobe software to realise my dream.  I’ve set a target of £2000. However, I know that I will need more to get the camera I really want. So with your help we’ll push through the funding target!
 
I am a Canon man so I’m looking for a Canon camera that is around the £1000 mark. This really does depend on how the campaign goes and the rest will become the base for the new computer system. I’d love to go to an Apple store and slap a wad of cash on the counter, but that might just be wishful thinking.
 
My perks / rewards are made up from images that I took on the 9-day trip to Canada I made to celebrate my 30th birthday.  I have 35 images that are going to be used to create limited edition prints and canvases for those who help me succeed in my campaign. Although I mention a photo book in the video, unfortunately, I cannot find a way of making this cost effective.
 
You can find the full range of images at a special web page:
 
 www.watsonmartincreative.co.uk/9Days/images.html 
 

The Impact:
 
These images represent the beginning of my career and without your help I won’t get out of the boring 9-5 office life I am living. I want to live my dream and do something I am passionate about. Photography is that passion.
 
All of my images are going to be limited edition pieces of art. You won’t be able to get this set of images anywhere else after this campaign is successful. If I become a famous photographer you won’t be forgotten. Every day I’ll remember those that contributed to getting me started.  
 

 
Other Ways You Can Help:
 
Not everyone will be able to contribute in a monetary fashion, I know, but they can help spread the word about what I am doing and trying to achieve.
 
Let all of your friends and family, colleagues and acquaintances know about my campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out. Tweet the link to my campaign page, post it on Facebook, and tell everyone you know about my campaign to help me achieve my goal.
 
Thank you for reading my campaign page, thank you for visiting the web page and viewing my images and if you have contributed to making my dreams a reality I can never thank you enough. I am truly grateful.

story:
While the Indiegogo campaign is over, I am still accepting participants in the project and honoring the perk levels as described on the right hand side.  Just message me at info@awellworld.com and we'll get you satisfied!


You probably have lots of questions (whether you’ve watched the video above or not).  Here's where I’m going to answer some of them.  And, if you still have questions, you can reach me at info@awellworld.com.


What are the different ways I can support the project?


For those of you who have just watched the video and already know you want to support this project, now you just need to decide how.  The table directly below provides a simple breakdown of what each level of contribution gives you access to.  You can also review the perks column to the right for more details on all of the valuable offerings available to you.  And, if you continue reading down this page, you'll see more help underneath "Ok, I'm definitely in!  But, I don't know what I'm in for."



Who is Matthew anyway?


I'm an internationally active coach and wellness educator who has spent thousands of hours in self development training, spoken in front of 1,000+ person audiences, coached nearly 1,000 people and delivered hands on workshops to 1,000+ people in dozens of cities.  

Underneath all of that schnazzy bio stuff, I’m an American of Italian descent.  I grew up with a loving and supportive family.  I’ve been given many opportunities AND I’ve had my share of challenges in this lifetime.  I lost my father when I was 10.  Then, when I was 13, I realized I was attracted to men and somehow managed to suppress that until I was 24.  

So, when I finally got comfortable and proud of who I was, I had a lot of work to do!  I spent thousands and thousands of hours with multiple teachers and modalities, developing my capacity to live a satisfied life.  I’ve learned that there are certain fundamental facets to living a satisfied life AND I’ve witnessed first hand that there is no one blueprint that works for everyone.


"Matthew brought a very powerful listening to his coaching sessions with me. The clear, non judgmental space that he created provided a safe space for me to explore deep rooted thought patterns and beliefs around my self image..."  -Alison G., London, U.K.


What’s the book about?

It’s about how you build a satisfied life.  Living well doesn’t happen randomly.  It happens when you get to the source of what turns you on in life and then you begin having the conversations, taking the actions and setting things up the way that works for your highest and biggest expression.  With this book you’ll be building, piece by piece, your satisfied life.  You’ll learn the critical importance of timing; when to deeply examine things, when to get into action and when to let go of the wheel for a while. 

You’ll also gain a deep understanding and experience of just how the four pillars of satisfaction – healthy body, a broad range and sufficient depth of emotion, varied thought and unleashed soul are intertwined and the importance of each when it comes to true life satisfaction.



"It has been a journey of self-discovery, of making conscious subtle changes which have made a massive difference in little time and have touched every aspect of my life."  Silvia R. - Bournemouth, U.K.


What makes this book project so different?


As far as I’m aware, no one in the self development world has yet chosen to welcome in those they are working to support to truly co-create with them an experience of growth and change.  I fully recognize that I am not your answer.  And I've created this project to honor your inherent capacity to experience deep satisfaction in this lifetime.

For me, the most exciting part of this project happens when you contribute at the $75 level.  Why?  Because, at this level, you have a direct impact on the purpose of this campaign.  That is, to create a self development book like no other, where the material was co-created and the book was influenced by people's real life experiences in building satisfied lives.

At its core, this project operates from the assumption that you already have all the innate energy and capacity to live a satisfied life.  There are just two things missing.  1) some clarity as to what is important to cultivating your individual satisfaction; and 2) the awareness as to what committed actions you must take to bust out of whatever restrictions you have placed on your capacity to live a deeply satisfied life.



"It has been several months that Matthew has been helping me find the inner me. Much of my self-image was not evident to me and through his assistance and insights he has led me to find myself."  Kris S., Detroit, U.S.


What will my contribution make possible?


Well, there are two answers to this question.  First the practical impact.  Self publishing a book is NOT cheap.  I've spent a good deal of time with someone who has both self published and written a book for a major publisher.  So, I've been schooled on what it actually takes.  There's cover & design ($3,000!), three different types of editing ($4,000!), printing ($2,500) and so much more.  And if, for some reason, I don't reach my goal, I'll be making up the difference with my own funds.  This will decrease the amount of time and energy I can put into the research and crowd sourcing and possibily delay the completion of the book itself.

But beyond these practical things, and truly why this campaign is so unique, is that you are making it possible for a new kind of self development book publishing model to emerge.  I'm certain that being able to engage with real people who are putting the principles of the book into action in their real lives is going to make for a book that has a deeper and more sustained impact for people than one published in the traditional, "top down" way.  All this engaging with people and learning from the real world application of the principles takes lots of time and effort and you will be helping to fund that.



"I went into my relationship with Matthew having problems with lack of energy throughout the day. Let's fast-forward six months into the future. I now have more energy than I ever had..."  - Michael F. - Bronx, U.S.


How will you deliver on the promise of greater life satisfaction for those participating?


Well, that all depends on how you participate!  Even at the most basic level of contribution ($15), you’ll have access to the digital version of the book as well as ongoing access to special content for the duration of this IndieGoGo campaign.  At $25, you’ll have continued access to an online community where people will be interacting and supporting one another in crafting their satisfied lives.  At $75, you’ll be able to participate on one of the tele seminars and have access to additional detailed information in real time as you put these principles to work in your life.  And then, there are higher levels of contribution that afford you my personal attention, all the way up to and including a “stay-cation” retreat in your (or my) city!


Ok, I'm definitely in.  But I'm not sure what I'm in for!  :)


Because this project is multi-faceted and open to lots of different types of involvement, I've created a 4 part framework to help you choose how you want to be involved.  Let’s see which one fits for you.

SUPPORTER - If you love the idea but are not sure how deeply you want to be involved, you can simply contribute $15, $25 or $50 and participate as a supporter of the project.  This will unlock your access to the bonus content during the campaign and give you access to the book.

ENGAGER – If there is something about this book’s theme that calls to you, you can contribute as little as $75 to participate on a group tele-seminar or from $250 to as much as $1500 to work 1:1 with me.

EXPANDER – There are perks that are designed specifically for those who are wellness practitioners or are interested in contributing to the life satisfaction of those around them.  There are two levels of contribution for this group ($500 and $950).

EXPLODER – Here’s the participation level that’s being offered for just two very special people.  If you are ready to not only explore, not only engage, not only expand but to completely explode your life as it current exists and are ready to fully embrace your birthright of living a satisfied life, take a look at the VIP packages that are available.



"Matthew created a framework for me during a time of much soul-searching and transition in my life. With his support, I was able to get clear about my priorities and work towards my goals - both personal and professional - in a way that felt manageable and a lot less scary. Matthew's cheerful nature, willingness to listen when I needed it, and ability to propel me forward when I needed THAT instead, created an invaluable support system at a time when everything in my life was changing." - Lara D. - Seattle, U.S.


Are there ways to contribute to the campaign beyond supporting it financially?


Of course!  I've got special gifts planned for those that share the campaign via social media channels.  All you need to do is tag me in your post so I can keep track.  Then, just keep an eye on your Facebook or Twitter inbox for your special thank you surprise!

story:
In the very beginning and how we got here

DrunkenWerewolf started as a blog. It shuffled around for a bit before finally moving servers to become a proper website. This is when I began to take the project more seriously, putting all my spare time into promoting the music through the site. Then I had the bright idea to start a zine, buy a domain, introduce some new writers and really shift a gear in terms of development. DrunkenWerewolf rapidly morphed from a little (cheap) fledgling into this giant sized monster of infinite capability... at least in my eyes. One day it really will be, but not without your help.

We’ve raised what we can, where we can, when we can through various means, but sadly I can no longer pick up all of the slack myself. Don’t worry, this isn’t a sob story. I don’t take it lightly when I say DrunkenWerewolf is my life and I will never complain about running it, ever. But it costs money, and it’s become popular enough to grow to such a proportion it’s no longer something I can fund on my own.

From a non selfish point of view, DrunkenWerewolf really does help the unsung artist. We’re caring and passionate about the music that we love, and we’re honest in our constructive criticism. The website and magazine also provides reportedly insightful and top notch commentary on the music industry, alongside in depth interviews with and reviews of musicians’ work. It respects the little man, whether that’s a reader or a musician, but it also makes puddles around the feet of the big man. I want it to cause a tsunami, and this campaign will help us to do that.

Help you how, and for what?

It costs a lot of money to run the magazine, and while we’ll be self-sufficient one day, we’re not there yet. This campaign is designed to raise money solely for the production of the magazine, and the maintenance of the site. Nothing else. No salaries; I know campaigning to line your own pocket is a bit naff. If we overreach our goal, the money will be put in reserve for future production. If we don’t reach our target, we will pull a sad face and you will be refunded.

We’re not simply asking for a donation: there’s something in it for you, too! First off, we’ve got limited edition tote bags and prints on offer alongside an annual magazine subscription.

We’re also putting together a yearbook featuring, offering 50 of you the chance to lend your mugs to a special article designed by our leading illustration lady Emma Hardy. That will be included in the magazine and distributed around Bristol, so brush your hair! If you’re not keen on having your photo taken, you can get an issue of the magazine dedicated specially to you or a loved one – we’ve got 12 slots going, one for each month. Feel free to pick a specific one to coincide with a birthday!

Plus there’s tons of other neat little things, including pins, personalised playlists and t-shirts. Sound good? Good.

No moneys? We understand

Of course if you have no money, we totally understand (been there, are there) but that’s not to say you can’t help! Just as the pen is mightier than the sword, sometimes gobbing off about something is better than giving us a quid. You never know who’s listening, after all. If you could spread the word about this campaign and DrunkenWerewolf in general, we will be eternally grateful.

Yours hopefully,

 

Tiffany Daniels, Editor of DW

story:
Velocity Gamer

Velocity Gamer is what many people would call a 'small' gaming site. We don't rake in a whole lot of cash, and review copies don't come in when we need them. Although we have a fairly sizable dedicated reader base that comes to us for quality video game news, reviews, and editorials, the 'reviews' part needs help.

Our editors just can't afford all the games we need to review. We also would like to put games in the hands of editors so they can be informed come Game of the Year time. But our primary concern is having the money to buy games on launch day. That's where this campaign comes in.

How This Works:

Here's how we'll use the money we get from the campaign.

Editors will be assigned games by the Editor-In-Chief, unless they feel they're a very strong fit for the game. They will go out, buy the game, and review it as soon as possible. Only when said review is completed will they be reimbursed for their purchase.

If we reach our goal of $600, then after we have at least one of every game in the Big Six lined up, the excess money will go towards getting a second copy of that game, so our editors know what they're talking about when it comes time to hand out Game of the Year Awards.

The Big Six

This is what we need to review in order to be competitive.

  • Dishonored
  • Assassin's Creed 3
  • Hitman: Absolution
  • Call of Duty: Black Ops 2
  • Far Cry 3
  • Halo 4

Any excess money will go towards reviewing Pokemon Black and White 2, Skylanders: Giants, Medal of Honor: Warfighter, Epic Mickey 2, and PlayStation All Stars Battle Royale. We'd also like to catch up on some of the games we missed, just in case there are any games we'd like to recognize at the end of the year.

And that's it

We would love you forever if you donated. Here's our site, our reviews section, and our podcast. Take a look around and decide whether or not we're worth your money!

If you don't have an Indiegogo account, and you'd like to see your name on our site now, email me: mikecosimano@velocitygamer.com

Thanks for your time.

story:
My name is Lara Fairy Love, I am a Birthing Assistant, I assist people to Birth, Educating, Empowering and Supporting people to make their own choices and create the perfect Birth for them.

 To aid this work I have written a book called ‘The Princess and the Poo’ , it is a simple story in rhyme aimed at children and pregnant people, the story tells of the joys and wisdom to be experienced thru Childbirth  “...if you are brave enough to feel...”
 In this age of rising caesarian section rates ( 24% at the last count, way over the W.H.O. s safety guidelines of 4% ) and rising maternal mortality rates ( up 3% in the last 3 years ) ; in a country where our government is attempting to outlaw Independent Midwifery, by making it illegal to insure their work at the same time making it illegal to work without insurance , ( totally against the European Court of Human Rights ruling that it is every person’s right to choose , ‘.....where, when and with whom to give birth...’ ); where our children are fed T.V. dramas where Birth is always an ‘emergency’ and education focuses on pain relief rather than the on the biological facts about the wonders of our bodies, I decided that the way to inspire the masses to Birth the next generation better, would be to 1* inspire our Princess to have a home birth and 2* to get my book read in every junior school library in the British Isles!
  So I sent Princess Katharine and Prince William a copy of my book and an inspirational letter outlining the facts of where our country stands and how they could inspire a nation to reclaim their Births and create, a truly loving and empowered next generation.
 I received a letter back, thanking me very much and saying that they were very touched!
 The first mission was to travel to every school in the British isles and to read the story to them, create a play , and generate discussions with the children that will lead on to more education and empowerment about childbirth. We didn't go to every single one but we did go to ALOT!
The next mission is to go to the places that the book has been translated in , Spain, France , Holland and Germany , and to do more workshops there!
The way that we give birth and the way that we are born are defining factors in how we evolve as humane human beings! To educate our next generation so that they give birth to our grandchildren in love and peace is the pathway to really creating peace on earth! Peace on earth begins with peaceful birth.

What We Need & What You Get

To create this book tour we need travel costs! Each country has a host where we can stay and our food will be sorted . our work will be voluntary and all funds will go towards getting to each place and making sure as many books as possible get read and seen by as many people as possible!

The Impact

To give birth on peace, joyfully and lovingly is every human womans birthright! To be born in peace , held lovingly in your mothers arms , free from abuse and harm is every humans birthright!

 In this modern age we are fourtunate in this country to have so much  and to have progressed so far, however the ceaserian secton rate is going up and the homebirth rate is going down.

 Homebirth is safe and cost effective and could be utilized by up to 70% of the population saving our ailing NHS a lot of money! it costs £800 for a homebirth and £2000 for a c section!, at the moment our homebirth rate is 3% and could change drastically if we only educated ourselves and our children about birth properly!

 In an age of tv drama birth is always depicted as an emergency and our children and ourselves have grown to see birth as something abnormal and terrifying, instead of an amazing life changing extreme physical process, filled with love!

 Oxytocin ( fast labor in greek), the hormone responsible for  the birth process, and the opening of the birth canal, is only secreted when the body is relaxed and calm, as soon as there is fear the body switchs to creating adrenaline, the closing fight or flight hormone. Just this simple knowledge is changing hospital birth protocols all over the world  but if the women giving birth are still terrified because of the tv and lack of education then she will still need a lot of medical intervention to birth her baby.

Educated empowered birth is only going to happen if we educate and empower our selves and our children. Please help me start this process ! Peace on earth begins with peacfull birth! We will change this world one birth at a time!

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute there are still many ways you can help!

* Bookmark my website fairydoula.co.uk and send it onto a pregnant friend!

* Buy my book 'The Princess and The Poo' on lulu marketplace and read it to your children or grandchildren and yourself

* Follow me on Twitter @FairyDoula

* Find Fairy Doula on Facebook

* Check my blog Saarrukaa Goddess of Birth and Fire and give the info to everyone who you think needs to know

* Join Midwifery Today and send their e-magazine to anyone who needs it!

* Live Love

story:
Short Summary

My name is Joaquin Zihuatanejo and I am an award winning teacher and poet from Dallas, Texas.  I am asking you to help me get the six poets that make up The 2013 Dallas Youth Poets Team to the Brave New Voices Poetry Festival and Slam in Chicago this August.  

What We Need & What You Get

Through fundraising efforts of our own we have been able to raise the funds to cover the $1,650 that is the team registration and lodging fee.  What we need is your help to purchase flights for the six team members and two coaches on Southwest Airlines.  Every penny of your donation will go toward the purchase of those flights.  Getting these six amazing students from Dallas to Chicago is an expensive endeavor.  With your help we can make it happen.  

The Impact

We are teaching these youth poets that their voice is their power and with their voice they can write the wrongs of the world one poem at a time.  Someone once said that poetry exists to give the socially awkward a chance to finally be aplauded by their peers.  We applaud our high school quarterbacks under the Friday night lights of a footbal stadium, and we should.  But at Brave New Voices our amazing young writers and performers finally get a chance to be applauded under the stage lights of The University of Chicago and surrounding theaters.  This experience will stay with these youth poets always and you can help give it to them.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate please spread word about our cause through social media and through word of mouth.  And please know how grateful we are to you for reading this and spreading word about our movement.
