story:
We want to create a booklet of ice cream shops in Europe, spreading the simple joy to more people in the world！

Why is it worth contributing?

Ice cream, an icy snack that contains history and culture, has brightened up numerous classic moments since hundreds of years ago. Carrying people’s memories and stories, ice cream contains with feelings that move everyone. 

Through The Ice Cream Map, we hope to connect these ice creams together, collecting 50 European ice cream shops that not only own a tasty ice cream but also have a touching story, culture, and a spirit. Recorded in the blog and video, The Ice Cream Map will be a guidebook for ice cream lovers to visit these shops. It is a great adventure not just for taste buds, but more importantly, for soul！

Why is The Ice Cream Map so Special?

The Ice Cream Map not only introduces the ice cream, but also collects all the stories, culture, and spirit related to it. Under the guidance of this map, you won’t miss any ice cream shop. Ice cream should not only be a dessert enjoying in summer, but a blending of culture, spirit, story and feeling! 

Who are we?

We are a group of young people crazy for ice cream! Our lives become colorful because of it, and now we want to devote our efforts to accomplish this mission, making our dream come true!

Michael Chen: An energetic person who has been obsessed with ice cream since his childhood, willing to share the moment of happiness to everyone. He believes that The Ice Cream Map can connect ice cream lovers and spread this attractive snack!

Evon Su: A responsible, and imaginative girl with warm smile and a passionate heart for ice cream! A great supporter who makes the work done more quickly and successfully!

Leo Chang：A talented designer who always has tons of works waiting for him to design. Busy as he is, Leo does his best to let the sweetness of ice cream and passion of our hearts to be seen through painting and design! 

Alice Wei：A sweet, and smart girl with a logical mind and a passionate heart for ice cream! Love new things and team works. A good listener and an excellent supporter that help team work efficiently!

Evan Fang: An engineer who is good at coding, especially in Android apps. Work hard on web development recently in order to make The Ice Cream Map become better! Hope you guys enjoy it! 


Why is it so important for you to be a part of it ?

In your childhood memory, is there any ice cream store that once brought you happiness and sweetness? Is there any exclusive flavour of ice cream that you cannot forget, desperately wanting to share to everyone? 

Please tell us! We need your help to finish this big task!

 There are many ice cream shops in Europe that we don’t know yet. It would be a great honor if you recommend some shops that you like or you know. The ice creams shops you recommend are very likely to be included in The Ice Cream Map.Let us finish the ice cream map together and share the sweetness! 

Apart from helping us discover the ice cream stores, you can also join “I Scream For Ice Cream” Campaign, marking your favorite ice cream on the map!

How do we find ice cream shops?

1. Recommendation

No matter where you come from, we welcome you to recommend the ice cream shops that you think they are worth visiting! No matter the shop owns a special flavour, the story behind the ice cream is one-of-a kind, or the owner got a special experience, please let us know! Although we mainly focus on Europe, every place you recommend will become our next destination!

Click me to recommend!

2. I Scream For Ice Cream

Are you a super fan of ice cream? Do you want to show the whole world the most attracting ice cream shop? We invite you to join “I Scream for Ice Cream”! Once you join us, you are the “hero” who is given a grand mission: to recommend and introduce the ice cream shop you think that is a must-visit. Ice Cream Hero is a leader of ice cream culture, having an exclusive and creative perspective toward ice cream. Of course, a big stomach is needed!  Come and join us!

Click me to apply Ice Cream Hero!

What should an Ice Cream Hero do ?

1.Have an ice cream gathering to share the most impressive ice cream memory. Invite people no matter they are friends, family members, couples or the elders to share everything related to ice cream.

2. Recommend at most five ice cream shops in your country. They should own an impressive story, spirit or special flavours. Contact with them in advance and visit with Michael.

What can an Ice Cream Hero get  ?

1.   The Ice Cream Map*2( e-version *1+ real booklet*1)

2.  The name of Ice Cream Heroes will be shown along with the shop they recommend in the booklet.

Reminder:

1. The Ice Cream Map would not include all the ice cream shops that Ice Cream Heroes provide.

2. If a shop is being recommended twice, we will decide who recommend it according to the time order.

3. Ice Cream Hero participates the campaign voluntarily. No monetary transaction is involved. Thank you for your cooperation and help!

How many heroes do we need in every country?


Application will be due on 6/15. We will contact with you through email! Welcome to the world of ice cream!

Click me to apply Ice Cream Hero!

What else will we do during the trip?

Besides completing The Ice Cream Map, we will also:

1.  Record the trip in our blog and Facebook fan page, 

2.  Create Facebook club to connect with other ice cream lovers.

3.  A sticker will be pasted in the shops that we have visited. You can find them easily!

About Booklet and Map 

Two parts are included in The Ice Cream Map booklet. First part will record the journey. We will have a complete document of the ice cream shops that we have visited, including their characteristics, cultures, stories, and special flavour. The content will also be recorded down through blog during the journey. After the trip is over in July, the information would be edited, and published. 

Second part of the booklet is a real map of ice cream. All the locations of the ice cream shops that we have visited will be printed on it. Beside each shop, there is a blank for you to paste ice cream sticker when you visit that shop. Prizes will be given to the ones who have visited all the ice cream stores on the map!

The ice cream trip will end in July,2014. Eight months are expected to finish The Ice Cream Map booklet, including editing, publishing and shipping. The expected time for you to receive the booklet is May, 2015. Please follow us on our website and Facebook page. More information would be released!!

                                        

Budget


More Detail About Visiting Ice Cream Shops!

1.  How many ice cream shops are we going to visit?

Our goal is 50 Shops in Europe ! Announcement will be made when there are some changes.

2.  When are we going to visit these ice cream shops?

From May to July 2014. Sixty days in total.

3.  How are we going to know the progress of the project?

There are 2 ways:

First, when we visit an ice cream shop, we will write a post on our blog. In the meantime, we will  mark the shop on our website.(www.theicecreammap.com)

Second, you can follow us on other social media.

4.  How can I participate in The Ice Cream Map?

Share the ice cream shop that you like on our website.

If you really have a passionate heart toward ice cream, apply for Ice Cream Hero!

Share our plan on indiegogo. Let us build an ice cream map together! 


Follow us!

1.  Website and Facebook fan page would have the latest update about what we are doing right now!

2.  Facebook club. Facebook club is a platform for ice cream lovers to exchange thoughts and ideas. Come and share what you think！

3.  Fill out the Ice Cream Sheet in our website.  We will send you the latest information to you!

4.  Twitter

5.  Foursquare

6.  Instagram

7.  Blog


The ice cream trip will end in July,2014. Eight months are required to edit and publish The Ice Cream Map. The expected time for you to receive the booklet is May, 2015. Please keep following us on our website and fan page. More information about The Ice Cream Map would be released. Don’t miss it! More sweetness let you impressed!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Our Story

Brenda C Kayne, a Hymn writer from Florida and David Weiss, a Hymn writer from Minnesota, USA, have very kindly permitted me to translate their unique, creative social justice hymns into different languages spoken in Uganda. These will be used during praise and worship starting this Christmas!


This is an unprecedented project and whereas I do translation work fairly often, Translating Hymns adds a significant level of complexity because not only must the concepts be conveyed accurately in the target language,they must also match the musical structure and phrasing of the hymn.


Additionally, some idioms just don't translate well or have equivalents in the target language! That's why am not working alone. I have identified two like-minded linguists to work with in the first half of December to help make this project a reality. Our goal is to have the translations ready by Christmas!



Let's do this thing together!

Here's how:

1. Make sure to pass this page on to friends, family, co-workers, political representatives, church members, women's clubs, neighbors, facebook, twitter, bloggers etc.

THANK YOU AND BLESSINGS...

story:
UPDATE: WE DID IT!

Huge thanks to everyone who pre-ordered Dark Mountain: Issue 2! We passed our target with several weeks to go and the book is now at the printers. We're expecting delivery in mid-June. You can still order on here for a little longer, then the book will be on sale on our main website.

Meanwhile, it's also time to book tickets for:

UNCIVILISATION 2011: The Dark Mountain festival 
19-21 August, The Sustainability Centre, Hampshire 


The Story

We are Dougald Hine and Paul Kingsnorth, the initiators of the Dark Mountain Project.

Last year, with your help, we raised $6,140 to cover the publishing costs of Dark Mountain: Issue 1, our first book-length collection of essays, stories, poetry, conversations and art for living through times of global disruption.

A year later, we are in the final stages of putting together Issue 2. Once again, it will be a hardback book of around 250 pages, with contributions from writers ranging from familiar names to those appearing in print for the first time.

We've been blown away by the response to the first book. Looking at the drafts of Issue 2, we're excited at bringing together something which continues and deepens the conversation, moving closer to the texture of people's lives and out into the wilder edges of the kind of "Uncivilised" writing we called for in our manifesto.

The Book

Writing featured in Issue 2 will include:

  • Naomi Klein on the story of endless growth;
  • extracts from Jay Griffith's new novel about the life of Frida Kahlo and Melanie Challenger's forthcoming book on extinction and the modern mind;
  • new poetry from Mario Petrucci and Heathcote Williams;
  • fiction from Nick Hunt, Simon Lys and Antonio Dias;
  • a Canadian farmer's reflections on place and belonging;
  • a rehabilitation of the Luddites on the 200th anniversary of their rising against the Machine;
  • a conversation with the poet Glyn Hughes;
  • Matt Szabo's dissection of the dead language of "sustainability";
  • and a recipe for Black Isle pheasant stew.

There's also photography, woodcuts, illuminated poetry and free tracks from 'Dark Mountain Music', an EP by Australian band The General Assembly.

What We Need & What You Get

The Dark Mountain Project does not receive any external funding. As with Issue 1, we are working with Christian Brett at Bracketpress to design and publish the book. To cover his work and the publication costs, we are looking to raise £3,000 ($5,000) through pre-orders between now and the end of May.

This is not a call for donations - everyone who contributes will get a copy of the book as soon as it's published. For $25, we'll send a copy to you, wherever you are in the world. For $50, it will be a signed copy. And anyone who can pledge $100 will get a signed copy and have their name included in the roll of honour in the back of this issue.

Other Ways You Can Help

We're grateful for any help you can give us in spreading the word about the book.

Here are some suggestions, in case they are relevant:

  • post a link to this page on your Facebook or Twitter;
  • write a post about Dark Mountain on your blog;
  • give us a mention in your organisation's newsletter.

We are also available for interviews about the book and the project. You can contact us (about that or anything else) by posting a message here, or by emailing info AT dark-mountain DOT net.

Also, if you haven't seen Dark Mountain: Issue 1, you can find out more about it (and order a copy) from this section of our main website.

Short Summary

Hi there! My name is Gary. I am trying to accomplish a dream. Two, actually. My plan 

is to set up an affordable off grid home and writing about the successes and failures in 

doing so. My hope is that someone just starting out finds this info useful and even

improves my ideas. The "House In A Box" idea is not a new concept. People have used

everything from covered wagons to campers as a house. People are ordering portable

buildings (large, strong sheds), running electrical wire to tie in to "the grid", and run

into delays with permits, inspections, septic system tests... the whole 9. 

 

 

 

 

What I Need & What You Get

Breaking it down in more detail:

  • I already have the land and have tested the basic premise of living "off grid" by moving an aged camper to the site, so it is do-able. I have also schooled myself in the power systems for this project. What I need is $7500 to get the ball rolling. That is $1700 to have the Cabin set on site, $1400 for septic permits and tank and $2000 to have a land evaluation done and tap a well rather than joining "city water". The remainder would cover unseen costs and materials needed for the written part of the project.

  • I am planning a blog so you all can follow the progress. If I should decide to make it a subscriber only blog, all donors will have access, meaning you will be able to read. Donations from $15 to $25 will be able to interact and ask questions or make suggestions. Donations $26 and up get an acknowledgement in my planned book in addition to all the above and a digital copy of the book. Any donations over a hundred dollars, I have not given much thought to, but would be willing to engage in personal correspondance to work some suitable arrangement.

story:
WHY SHOULD I DONATE TO THIS PROJECT?

That's the BIG question, right??!!  Why would you choose to donate to help fund this project?  Well, allow us the opportunity to provide a few important reasons:

Empowering our children now will change the future.  Providing children with the tools they need to develop authentic self-love and compassionate self-esteem is something that needs to start early, and that is exactly what Kathryn the Grape does.

Kathryn the Grape's Piece of Love empowers children to be loving and kind to themselves and others.  Kathryn was recently on the news sharing about how THIS BOOK empowers children and why it is so important to get this message in the hands and hearts of children worldwide.

We are the only ones doing what we are doing! Kathryn the Grape is the only personal development series of books and music for kids centered on a real-life inspired character.

By donating to this campaign, and you are helping us help kids worldwide!

About Kathryn the Grape

Kathryn the Grape (KTG) is a messenger of love. Our purpose is to empower children and help them develop authentic self-love and nurture a positive self-esteem. We are passionate about helping children understand that they are remarkable, magical individuals. Kathryn the Grape encourages children to love and accept themselves and others, and this message is woven in everything we do. 

  Through our award winning books and music, teen-hosted radio show, and online resources, children learn important self-esteem building lessons. These lessons affect change on a core level and inspire children to ripple loving kindness and compassion into the world. 

We released our first book on 11/11/2010.  In the past two years we have been intentional about including real kids and teens in what we do!

  • 70 M.A.G.I.C.A.L. Kids are featured in our MAGICAL song photo montage video.
  • The 15 classmates in Kathryn the Grape's Piece of Love are based on real kids.
  • Two fifth grade girls launched and hosted our weekly radio show in 2011/2012.
  • 14-year old Matalyn Burgio is the current host of Kathryn the Grape's Magical Hour.
  • Six everyday kids sang back-up vocals on our music album.
  • KTG's Magical Kids Klub was created to shine a light on kids everywhere.
  • We donate to child-focused organizations through The KTG Fund.

www.KathrynTheGrape.com 

Why Kathryn the Grape's Piece of Love?

Kathryn the Grape's Piece of Love is a dynamic and vibrant peace-building story that helps children and adults understand the incredible impact our choices have on our planet and others.  With the help of real children as characters, you will learn about:   

  • Contributing your piece to creating peace on our planet.
  • How our thoughts, words, and actions have a ripple effect.
  • Being loving, kind, and accepting of ourselves and others.
  • Removing worried thoughts to be in the flow.
  • The affirmation, "I am love."
  • Being a peace builder by rippling loving kindness everyday.

Why Create an Interactve Mobile App?

The most efficient way to get Kathryn the Grape in the hands and hearts of children worldwide is through an interactive mobile app.  Through the development of an English language application on the Android and iOS platforms (iPhone and iPad) we will be creating a more interactive experience for children to engage with this peace-building story. 

Here are some of the benefits of our new app:

  • The tactile nature of a tablet device taps into different learning modalities, allowing access for all learning styles.
  • Each page is a new adventure in exploration.
  • Not only will the app spread a good message but it will also help in the learning process by providing read-aloud and touch text features.
  • A large variety of interactive methods such as swipe, tap, and pinch gives a multi-textural element to the child's app experience.
  • You can decide to read with your child or let him/her pace themselves.
  • Varied page turning animations provide variety during the app experience.
  • Children can physically drag objects and find targets that trigger visual rewards.
  • The app will be saturated with audio that can be turned on or off.

What's the Plan For EXCEEDING Our Campaign Goal?

In the awesome event that our campaign goal is exceeded, we have a plan in place for allocating funds to help with other important projects as follows: 

  • Translate Kathryn the Grape's Piece of Love into other languages.
  • Build an interactive mobile app for Kathryn the Grape Just Like Magic (book #1)
  • Build an interactive mobile app for Kathryn the Grape's Colorful Adventure (book #2)
  • Translate the interactive mobile app for book #1 and #2 into additional languages.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are several ways that you can help us make this app a reality!  If you are unable to donate but still want to support Kathryn the Grape, we would love for you to help us spread the word about our campaign by:

  • Sharing this campaign with your friends through social media or email!.
  • Connecting with us on Facebook.
  • Connecting with us on Pinterest.
  • Connecting with us on Twitter.
  • Subscribing to our newsletter.
  • Subscribing to our YouTube Channel.
  • Reviewing our books & music on Amazon.

THANK YOU for helping us empower children and change the future!

story:
ABOUT THE BOOK:

When I first started this project in 1997, this country had not yet invaded Iraq or Afghanistan. The devastating effects of bringing young men home in caskets had not been felt here for at least a generation. In addition to the thousands killed, more than 50,000 soldiers have returned home with injuries, many disabled, unable ever to work again. This frustrating effort has brought the issue of war and its inevitable losses back into focus. My book will highlight how the loss of just one soldier can reverberate through not only the current generation of the missing one’s family but potentially through the next generation as well. I didn’t start this book as an antiwar project. I started it simply to try to better understand my parents and their war. But I realize now that What There Was Not To Tell is, in its essence, an antiwar story. I want so much to bring this story to the broader public. But I need your help.

 

ABOUT ME:

My first book, The Place He Made, was published by Random House in 1995. It is the story of my husband who died of cancer at the age of 39. The New York Times Book Review called it, “a triumph of the human spirit…may take its place among the best of the literature.” Though the book sold well (50,000 in hardcover and paper), I was subsequently “orphaned” by my publisher and the resulting chaos was hard for me to deal with. Ultimately, I made the choice to produce my own books, feeling I could deal directly with my readers more successfully than I could through publisher or agent. As a result, since 2005, I’ve published three more books, each one selling online and by mail at least 5,000 copies.

I am a self-supporting, single woman who exists on free-lance income. I have spent at least five years (cumulative) creating this book but cannot afford to spend any more time on it without help.

 

WHERE YOUR MONEY WILL GO:

  • manuscript preparation
  • typesetting
  • copyediting and proofreading
  • interior design and cover design
  • printing and delivery of books for distribution

 

WHAT YOU WILL GET:

BOOKS and my CD!

 

HOMEMADE BREAD!

 

HOMEMADE COOKIES!

story:
Our Story

There's nothing like sitting down in a nice cozy chair with a cup of tea and a good book! A book that captures your imagination and transports you to another time and place. A book that sucks you in so thoroughly that by the time you look up at the clock five hours have gone by and you still want to continue reading! This is the kind of material we publish at Red Frog Publishing. Books with a soul! Good story, good characters, good writing!

What We Need

Red Frog is a small publishing house that's trying to get its foot in the door. That's why going to the LA book fair is so important. Last year was a great success, and we hope we can go again this April.


As we are still starting out, finding the funding for a booth can be challenging. Any donations will be greatly appreciated.


We just want to get our books out there! Thank you so much!

story:
Hi there!


I'm J.A. Toney. My friends call me Aaron. I'm a father of four, working man, and author. Being a dad is my most important and favorite job!
My campaign here is to raise money to properly publish my book Gabriel; Sinner. It is completely written and publish-ready. It's important to me to get it out there because I have a story to tell. It's also important to me because I want to show my children first hand that you really can accomplish anything you set your mind to. I tell them that all the time, it's time to show them!
By contributing to my campaign, you will be helping to share an amazing story of hope and love with a world that desperately needs both. You will also be a part of showing the world, not just my children, that we really accomplish our dreams. On top of that, you will be a part of a community that shows the world that people really do care about each other, and want to help each other succeed.

What I Need & What You Get


So, the nitty gritty...and the cool stuff!
I'm trying to raise $10,000. Here's the breakdown:
  • $3500 plus tax, so about $3800, to publish through Westbow Press.
  • $3000 to cover the perks and shipping to contributors.
  • $3000 to start a marketing campaign to get the word out.
So the cost of publishing is set in stone. However, depending on which perks are chosen most, the cost of perks could go down. With that in mind, any extra funds will be applied to the marketing campaign or uprgrading the publishing package.
What are the perks? I'm glad you asked! I think you're going to like this! Everyone gets a copy of the novel in ebook format. From there, depending on the level of contribution, you can get a signed hardcover or paperback, original 10 x 13 artwork inspired by the book, original postersize artwork inspired by the book, a t-shirt with the book artwork, and/or a phone call from me to discuss writing, the book, or pretty much whatever you'd like to talk about!

THE BACKUP PLAN


If for some reason we don't reach the goal, all of the funds that are raised will go toward publishing cost, and perks will likely not be sent. If we don't raise enough for that, then it will all go into an account and be held until there is enough to cover the cost of publishing. 


The Impact


This story is one that everyone can relate to. You will come away from it entertained, and encouraged. Everyone who has read it thus far has felt as though it helped them with their everyday struggles and perspective. 

Also, you will be able to walk into a bookstore, see it on the shelf, and have the satisfaction of knowing that you made it happen!


Other Ways You Can Help


I fully understand that not everyone can offer a monetary contribution, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Simply sharing this project with your network can go a long way toward reaching the goal. So if you can't make a donation, please feel free to share it with others and let them know that they would be making a huge difference in the lives of others. This is truly a life changing project, and I invite everyone to come and be a part of it.

story:
#POETICDOGS ARE ON INSTAGRAM AND FACEBOOK



#POETICDOGS ARE ON INSTAGRAM AND FACEBOOK

Hello there!

I'm Dan Bannino, an Italian based photographer and dog lover. 

Almost a year ago, I've rescued my dog Rothko from a shelter and from that day on my life changed.

Rothko was found in a gypsy camp, in very poor state and after his adoption I've realized how many dogs are in the same condition all around the world and how a single adoption could change their lives and help supporting the situation in a dog shelter.

His story is just one of a millions and so I've decided to give voice to Rothko and all his four legged friends.

We'd like to share with you their stories and we are hoping to spread the idea of people finally adopting dogs, instead of buying them.

#POETICDOGS, is a photo-project where dogs are besides famous writers: speaking through their expressions, sounds and movements, they're telling you everything saying nothing, just like an author would do with words in a fine poem.


Most of these dogs suffered hunger, sickness, loneliness and are still giving their blessings to every human being they see, in the same way a lot of great artists did in the past, leaving us the treasure and legacy of their rare art. 

The goal is to feature as many wonderful rescued dog as possible, raising awareness toward shelters' adoption.

Where the Money is Going

With your support, reaching our fixed €6.000 target, in the new year we will be able to visit more dogs, sharing more stories and help finance our friends with medical, food and other basic supplies.


Since printing a book is an expensive business, only by reaching our target of €6.000 we will produce by May 2015 the first edition of the book that will feature all their amazing stories.  

Read full dog's stories and receive daily updates on Instagram and Facebook.

Support our campaign and please don't forget to share on your Twitter and Facebook page this project, every little help counts!





As seen on:

 

 

         



Note : All perks include Worldwide shipping.
  • With a donation of €30 you'll receive the book ONLY by reaching our goal of €6.000.
  • With a donation of €500 you'll receive the first book from our series, super quality finished, signed by me and Rothko, with a personal dedication inside and in a limited edition of 10 copies, even if we won't reach the extended target!

Thanks,

By the fluffiest team ever!
story_txt:
#POETICDOGS ARE ON INSTAGRAM AND FACEBOOK#POETICDOGS ARE ON INSTAGRAM AND FACEBOOKHello there!
I'm Dan Bannino, an Italian based photographer and dog lover. 
Almost a year ago, I've rescued my dog Rothko from a shelter and from that day on my life changed.Rothko was found in a gypsy camp, in very poor state and after his adoption I've realized how many dogs are in the same condition all around the world and how a single adoption could change their lives and help supporting the situation in a dog shelter.His story is just one of a millions and so I've decided to give voice to Rothko and all his four legged friends.We'd like to share with you their stories and we are hoping to spread the idea of people finally adopting dogs, instead of buying them.
#POETICDOGS, is a photo-project where dogs are besides famous writers: speaking through their expressions, sounds and movements, they're telling you everything saying nothing, just like an author would do with words in a fine poem.



Most of these dogs suffered hunger, sickness, loneliness and are still giving their blessings to every human being they see, in the same way a lot of great artists did in the past, leaving us the treasure and legacy of their rare art. 
The goal is to feature as many wonderful rescued dog as possible, raising awareness toward shelters' adoption.
Where the Money is Going
With your support, reaching our fixed €6.000 target, in the new year we will be able to visit more dogs, sharing more stories and help finance our friends with medical, food and other basic supplies.





Since printing a book is an expensive business, only by reaching our target of €6.000 we will produce by May 2015 the first edition of the book that will feature all their amazing stories.  

Read full dog's stories and receive daily updates on Instagram and Facebook.
Support our campaign and please don't forget to share on your Twitter and Facebook page this project, every little help counts!

Thanks,
By the fluffiest team ever!

story:
Hi there,

My name is Rebeckah Hassam and I have always loved telling stories and
writing poetry. However one night, while feeling particularly exhausted after
a long shift, I awoke to find I had created a character that would be the
star of my first novel. The title of my book is Victoria first bite. As the
title indicates it involves a young vampire named Victoria who is less then pleased about her lot in life. After living a mundane life for the past 17 years she soon comes realize that the quiet town of Langley is full of more mystery and romance than she ever thought before......

I have now found a publisher who is able to help bring this dream into a
reality for me, but as I will be self publishing I will be paying my way to
make this happen. I believe that all dreams whether big or small should be
realized and doing this would be a huge dream of mine.

Any help for my project is appreciated; whether I raise all the funds or
part of the funds I would be extremely grateful. All the money raised will go
towards making this happen. I am hoping to have this book in my hands by the
end of the spring. The cost of publishing and getting 200 copies of my book
comes to aprox $1,750. There are other smaller fees which is why I am asking
for $2,000 to kick start my project.


Even if you can't help at this time I appreciate you taking the time to get
to know me. Please pass my story on using the Indiegogo share tools or follow
me on face book and see how my story evolves. Together with you I can get
another step forward to starting this new chapter.

With best wishes always,

Rebeckah Hassam

story:
Family of friends,

I am working on raising $5,000 to get a psychiatric service dog (PSD) - see my story below for more details. Please consider chipping in and/or spreading the word to friends - I am so thankful for your witness and support.

With gratitude,
Julia

My story

Something most people notice about me right away is that I'm physically disabled - I was diagnosed with a type of muscular dystrophy and hearing loss at birth - and so when I received a diagnosis of major depression, anxiety, and PTSD in my early 20s it was hard to accept the fact that my mind, in addition to my body, was impaired. 

But as I've journeyed forward into this reality, I am learning of the powerful relief that comes with admitting to myself when I am really exhausted and in need of help and support. As one of my favorite poets Sonya Renee says, "sometimes the biggest gift you can give yourself is to let go and let yourself fall apart."

Falling apart

I have been in the process of "falling apart" for several years now, and it has been frightening and full of unknowns, but has also allowed me to start healing. After years of apologizing for my pain and trying to hide the intense struggle of living with undiagnosed anxiety and depression, I have begun the slow, excruciating process of learning to love myself enough to ask for help when I need it. 

Hungry my whole life

I remember sometime within the past two years, I heard about Psychiatric Service Dogs, or PSDs, for the first time. I've always known about service dogs who help people who are blind or otherwise physically impaired - I still remember watching a classic Sesame Street segment that told the story of a little girl whose family helped to raise puppies for seeing-eye-dog training - but I had never heard of a service dog for mental health support. "What do they do?” I wondered. "Why have I never heard about this before?"

When I first began reading about PSDs – who are trained in specific tasks to assist people living with mental illness – I was stunned at how intensely I connected with the thought of getting one. I remember telling a friend, "I feel like I've been hungry my whole life and have just discovered food for the first time." 

Fearing that I might be getting swept up in an impossible idea, I did my best to keep myself grounded by reading about PSDs: researching dog breeds, PSD programs, costs, and everything else in between. 

Finding the right program

It has been over a year since I started that process of researching and learning everything I could about PSDs, and I am so excited to have finally connected with Crystal Callahan and her organization, PSD Registry.

This seems like a great match for my needs, and I am so lucky to have the chance to work with them. My service dog will be able to help me with many aspects of daily life, from reminding me to take medication to helping me find a safe place to recover when I'm having a panic attack.

If you're interested in learning about the many different tasks that PSDs can be trained perform in order to help their owners with day to day functioning, check out the International Association of Assistance Dog Partners (IAADP) list of service dog tasks for psychiatric disabilities.

I also highly recommend taking the time to watch this in-depth description of PSDs, from Mental Health Matters.

Will you join me?

Getting a PSD is one of the scariest, most important things I could ever dream of doing for myself, to help myself cope on a daily basis as I continue the slow process of processing trauma from my past and learning how to feel safe and grounded in the present. 

Will you join me in this work by contributing financially and/or sharing this campaign with your networks?

story:
About New Bedlam and our Goal

New Bedlam began as an off-hand joke in editor Jodi Lee's family. Through many experiences within her imagination, New Bedlam eventually took root as a small town in the middle of - somewhere - where writers and residents alike were tormented by the darkness within their souls. The darkness fought for release and now the monsters are real.

In early 2006, Jodi Lee and fellow founding members discussed what goes on in the depths of a writer’s mind when they are afflicted – perhaps blessed – with insomnia. Within days Jodi had outlined a proposal for an anthology set in the nearly-fictional town of New Bedlam, and by the end of the year the wheels had been set in motion. Courting Morpheus was finally published in 2010 through Belfire Press, one full year after The New Bedlam Project launched in April of 2009.

For two years, The New Bedlam Project survived as a free-to-read, blog-based webzine. TNBP is a paying market, registered with both Ralan.com and Duotrope.com, supported by small ads and donations. Some of horror and sci-fantasy’s most promising up and coming writers have been spotted on the streets of New Bedlam, possibly looking for a way out, or perhaps they seek Morpheus, ready to bribe him for just a few moments of sleep.

From a candle’s reflection in the mirror, to the darkest corners of imagination, New Bedlam has grown to encompass far more than anyone ever dreamed of. The monsters have definitely escaped their bounds, and the writers may never sleep again.

Even Morpheus dares not walk these streets alone…

What We Need & What You Get in Return

We're looking for $1500 in order to launch The New Bedlam Project into print, beginning with our forthcoming first yearly anthology, Return to New Bedlam and then with the collections Town Archives Vol.1 & 2. Any remaining funds will be used towards the 2013 anthology project.

Specifically:

$400 for Return to New Bedlam

  • Stipend for each contributor & artist
  • Purchasing & shipping contributor copies

$900 for Town Archives Vol. 1 & 2

  • $10 stipend for each contributor & artist
  • Purchasing & shipping contributor copies

$200 for Promotions, Future Anthology Projects

  • Stipends for each contributor & artist
  • Purchasing & shipping contributor copies
We've added some perks to our campaign, listed to the side there. Editor Jodi Lee is personally including a digital copy of her short story collection, Into a Long Ago Future, with each and every donation.
 
If we don't meet our goal, the funds we do receive will be used towards the Return to New Bedlam anthology first, then the Town Archives Volumes and on down the line.
 

What This Campaign Will Do For Others

The New Bedlam Project has caught the imagination of and been home to brand-new and established writers from around the globe. By donating to our campaign, you honor past, present and future writers with the knowledge that their work means something, has touched or will touch the hearts and imaginations of readers everywhere - that they've been heard. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute funds, and we understand that. You can still help us out by adding a link to your website, or sharing to your Facebook, Twitter and other networks. We appreciate any efforts to help us reach our goal!

story:
Standard Operating Procedures in

Four Volumes!


Who needs Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)? Everyone!

Every computer consultant, every managed service provider, every technical consulting company - every successful business - needs SOPs! One of the greatest books an entrepreneur can read is The Emyth Revisited by Michael Gerber. The conclusion of that book is very powerful: Document your processes.

When you document your processes and procedures, you design a way for your company to have repeatable success. And as you fine-tune those processes and procedures, you become more successful, more efficient, and more profitable.

Please support my project to write a four-volume set of books on Standard Operating Procedures for Technology Consultants. Topics in the 4-book set include:

  • Getting Started
  • Finances
  • Sales
  • Marketing
  • Client Management
  • Employees and H.R.
  • Company-wide Policies
  • Technical Support Policies and Procedures
  • Practical Examples
    (Monthly Maintenance, Backup and Disaster Recovery, and more)


Almost every consultant I talk to or coach has the same issues: They need better procedures. They need better processes. They are too busy to create this stuff from scratch. Key pieces of knowledge are in one person's head (often the owner). That ties the owner to the company and limits growth. It also makes the owner the choke-point for everything in the organization.

This four-book set will be over 600 pages and cover everything you need to set up, run, and fine-tune a great consulting business. 

Don't Start From Scratch! You may not implement everything exactly as I lay it out, but I discuss the issues and why you might create one policy or another. Then I propose some policies you can take and mold to fit your company.

Can you do all this yourself? Absolutely!

How's that working so far? 

These books will save you hundreds - and more likely thousands - of dollars in just a few weeks. Time and time again I've helped businesses create small changes that resulted in huge instant increases in profit.

At full price this set will sell for $99.95. But you don't have to pay that. Contribute now to this campaign and you'll receive a full set of books for any donation of $60 or more.

If fully funded, I expect to publish this set by the end of Summer 2014. Maybe much sooner if we raise more money.

Get these books out of my head and into your hands as quickly as possible!


Books Cost Money to Write

With lots of time I can get all this done. For example, I can trade consulting for services or use my own staff to produce the work. But when time is important, things cost more. Here's a breakdown of my budget for this project:

Cover Design for the "set" and all four volumes $ 1,000
Internal Layout $ 2,000
Proofreading $ 2,000
Misc. Production and Office Support $ 1,000
Graphics $ 2,500
Initial Book Printing $ 11,000
Audio Book and EBook Production $ 9,000
Web Site Production $ 2,500
Initial Marketing - Product Launch $ 5,000
Total $ 36,000


Not Completely a "Donation"

If you just want to donate money, I would be very grateful for that. But this campaign is designed to give you something for your money. These books will sell for $29.95 each or $99.95 for the complete set. That's a good deal. But you get an even better deal if you contribute to the creation of the book!

In addition to books, I have lots of other services and goodies we offer. So I've put together some offerings that include all kinds of options. If you think of something obvious that I missed, please let me know! 

My other services include:

  • Coaching (see SmallBizThoughts.com)
  • The SMB Preday Seminar in October 2014 (see www.smbpreday.com) 
  • The SMB Online Conference in June 2014 (see www.smbonlineconference.com)
  • Our 5-Week courses (see www.GreatLittleSeminar.com)
  • Business SWOT analysis - strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats
  • Speaking - keynote and breakout sessions

Everyone who contributes will be acknowledged in the books. (If you do not want to be listed in the book, please let us know.)


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but you can still help! Here's how:

  • Please bookmark this campaign and tell your friends about it on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Pinterest, Google+, and all your social media

  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!


Two Tiered Funding 

My goal of $25,000 will allow me to finish the proposed project by the end of Summer 2014. That is my sincere goal.

If we raise more money, we will simply be able to produce the product more quickly. It would obviously be great to get close to the $36,000 budget outlined above. But even if we go over that, we'll use the money to get the books - and ebooks and Kindle books and audio books - all completed must faster.

Again, Thank You for your support.


Let Me Introduce Myself . . . 

. . . In case you're new to me:

My name is Karl Palachuk. I have been making a full time living in I.T. since 1993.  I am an author, blogger, and business coach. I help computer consultants and managed service providers to be more successful. In the last few years I've written hundreds of blog posts on Standard Operating Procedures. Many of them appear on the SOP Friday site.

I created my first business - a computer consulting company - in 1995. During the next ten years that company evolved into the Managed Services model we use today.

I wrote my first book on Network Documentation. My other technical books cover

  • Managed Services
  • Storage Area Networks
  • Network Migrations
  • Service Agreements
  • Managed Services
  • and more

In the world of non-technical books, my favorite is Relax Focus Succeed (see www.relaxfocussucceed.com). Other topics include book publishing and inspiration.


I maintain a popular blog at http://blog.smallbizthoughts.com - and that's where the SOP project started. Many of my SOP posts are in the SOP Friday series.

We also sponsor two big events each year: The SMB Online Conference and the SMB Preday Seminar. The online conference is a three day online event featuring some amazing speakers. Each year we deliver at least 15 hours of content. The SMB Preday will celebrate its 10th year in 2014. That's a live one-day event that brings people from all over North America, and occasionally other continents as well.

For more information on me, Google Karl Palachuk.


In general, I am a proud member of the SMB community and have been active in it since I first found out that there were "computer consultants" out there sharing information and helping each other to be successful. I am proud to be able to offer services to this community and grateful for the support. 

My goal is that this Indiegogo campaign will help me bring another great resource to the SMB consulting community.

- Karl W. Palachuk

Follow me on . . .

Facebook http://www.facebook.com/karlpalachuk

Twitter http://www.twitter.com/karlpalachuk

LinkedIn http://www.linkedin.com/in/karlpalachuk

We also sponsor two big events each year: The SMB Online Conference and the SMB Preday Seminar. The online conference is a three day online event featuring some amazing speakers. Each year we deliver at least 15 hours of content. The SMB Preday will celebrate its 10th year in 2014. That's a live one-day event that brings people from all over North America, and occasionally other continents as well.
For more information on me, Google Karl Palachuk.

In general, I am a proud member of the SMB community and have been active in it since I first found out that there were "computer consultants" out there sharing information and helping each other to be successful. I am proud to be able to offer services to this community and grateful for the support. 
My goal is that this Indiegogo campaign will help me bring another great resource to the SMB consulting community.
- Karl W. Palachuk
Follow me on . . .
Facebook http://www.facebook.com/karlpalachuk
Twitter http://www.twitter.com/karlpalachuk
LinkedIn http://www.linkedin.com/in/karlpalachuk

story:
I am a passionate cat-lover, channeling my grief over the loss of my long-time calico companion, Kealani, into a project designed to help elevate the quality of life of cats around the world. With the help of an amazing team of talent, we hope to do good in the world, starting with the cats.

Kitty Karma: Big Stories of Small Cats Who Change Our Lives is an anthology of unique cat stories. Some are hilarious, others heartbreaking.  Kitty Karma was born of a creative vision to honour all cats, and hopefully to elevate the welfare and life of cats in need.

(Select your perk by running your cursor over the delivery date of the related perk. A box "Get This Perk" will crop up. Click on it and it's yours once you've checked out

We are contributing all net proceeds from the sales of this book to three needy cat charities. We see the book as an effective and novel means of generating sustainable donations to these:

1. Il Gattaro d’Aleppo (Cat Man of Aleppo) of Syria  

US$130 = food and medical supplies for a day for the cats OR US$3900 a month

2. ABayKitties, Big Island, Hawaii

US$20 = a bag of cat food that lasts 2 days. US$50 = a vet visit

Abaykitties looks after around 125+ ferals on the island.

3. Whangamata CAT in New Zealand 

Self-funding, but seeking US$360,000 = a permanent cat shelter to help/rehab abandoned & unwanted cats. The cat population multiplies during the summer tourist season.

Our writers are cat rescue volunteers, cat refuge and feral colony caretakers, cat bloggers, animal communicators, cat daddies, cat café owners and amazing parents, award-winning writers and journalists, all of whom have deep and special insights into the world of cats.

They have donated their stories for free because they care deeply about the cause.

My vision is to publish many more Kitty Karma books, selecting new recipient cat shelter organizations to support each time.

Select your perk by running your cursor over the delivery date of the related perk. A box "Get This Perk" will crop up. Click on it and it's yours once you've checked out!

Kitty Karma Goes Global!

We know there are cat lovers (and cat slaves) everywhere around the world who want to do good – not just for the cats they love, but for all cats. Especially for the ones in need. Crowdfunding gives all you cat-loving supporters a chance to get behind a cause we can all be proud of.

I have launched this campaign as I need some help covering the costs of design, production and distribution to get the book out to the public. The sooner the book is in the hands of readers around the world, the faster we can generate net proceeds from book sales to help our three cat shelters.

A life graced by a cat is changed forever. All the stories in this book explore their inexplicable bond with us and besides, cats are endlessly amusing and entertaining. But cats need our help. There is over-crowding in shelters, ferals are multiplying,  there is cat abuse and cruel practices in kill shelters. This book seeks to entertain as well as raise awareness so we can do better by the cats who love us unconditionally.

Book Details:

6" X 9"

28 stories, 25 chapters

300+ pages with original photographs in black and white.

Perfect binding

Color cover

 

Firstly, why a book as a way to raise donations to these cat charities? I view that a book has a longer shelf-life and a wider demand base than a T-shirt. It has the potential for a long-running inflow of revenues, and from those revenues, a sustainable stream of donations to the cat charities. 

We have stories that will appeal to cat-lovers and animal lovers that we can distribute around the world. As long as there is demand for the book, there will be net proceeds to donate to these charities. Plus, we are also seeking to raise awareness to the shadow aspects of the cat world - cat abuse, thoughtless cat surrenders and cruel practices at kill shelters - which are ordinarily overlooked or ignored.

We need funding to:

1.Get the book into the hands of the public. We need the start-up costs for production, design, printing, fulfillment and distribution.  To get a book that will appeal to many, be worthy of the cats that are featured  and will sell for a long time to come, we need a talented team of editors, designers and layout artists. This is the bulk of the costs.

2. Once the book is available for sale, we'll need to build and strengthen our outreach and distribution network. The more books we sell, the more markets we sell in, the more the cat charities will receive.

To honour your pledge, we've assembled a furr-tastic array of perks. Get free early-bird stories, electronic copies of the book, signed limited edition hard covers, an opportunity to get your own beloved cat’s picture featured in our M-M-Meow Gallery or, better yet, on the cover of the book.

To make sure you get the perk of your choice, please run your cursor over the delivery date related to the perk. A box with Pick This Perk will appear. Click on it and the rest is easy-peasy.

As someone passionate about cats and the joy and love they bring to life, I want, as I am sure you do, to give back to the cat caretakers. They are the ones who help rescue and care for the kitties, the mature, the abandoned and the disabled cats… those not yet fortunate enough to have found their forever homes. I hope you'll want to support this exciting project to help the cats and together, in our own small way, spread good around the world.

Who are the direct beneficiaries of the net proceeds from book sales?

Mohammed Alaa Aljaleel is Il Gattaro D'Aleppo. In a war zone, he has, over the past several years, taken his modest salary as an ambulance driver and selflessly used it to buy meat and other food for the cats orphaned or left behind as a result of the conflict in Syria. With more than 100 cats to care for, and more arriving every day, feeding these cats is an enormous and costly undertaking. Further, medication is unimaginably expensive. They need $3900 each month just to keep the cats alive.

Abaykitties is a volunteer-run organisation that supports, cares for, spays and neuters an aging and robust feral populations on the Big Island of Hawaii and is funded only by donations. They go through 10 bags of food costing $180 a week . But some months, Abaykitties receives only $50.00 in total donations  and they are left wondering how to feed the cats. Neutering/spaying are on a donation basis, a vet visit costs $50 and euthanasia for the aging cats $30-$35 at a subsidised clinic.

Whangamata CAT in New Zealand is a small group of volunteers providing safe refuge, food, and veterinary care for homeless, misplaced cats within the community. Currently self-funded by sales from their shop Kitschy Kat, they offer free neutering surgeries to eliminate unwanted litters and to control the cat population. They are seeking to funds build a  permanent cat shelter.

 

Moving Ahead I am committed to publishing this book, whether or not I meet my fundraising goal of $7500. However, falling short of the target means that it will take a while before I can funnel net proceeds to the charities. I have to cover some of the start-up costs from future book sales till I reach break-even. Our author contributors, our team, and the two recipient shelters have all put their time, energy and money on the line to improve the lives of cats and kittens. I shall do the same and you'll definitely get a book if you choose that pledge!

Budget We have carefully budgeted the campaign and production but there can always be unexpected or underestimated costs or hitches affecting timely delivery. Our team will work hard to overcome any problems and we will keep our supporters updated at every step!

Communication We hope to engage many, many cat lovers and animal supporters. We will do our best to answer your questions and welcome your comments and feedback. But with a small start-up team we ask for your patience as we go through the many messages we expect in our inbox!

 

 

Not everyone is capable of donating money, even small amounts. Not to worry. You can still help. Here’s how:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about the campaign. Talk it up with your friends, share with all your social media networks – over and over again! – and reach out to others you think might be able to contribute.

  • Remember, Indiegogo has easy-to-use social share tools. Use them, abuse them, and do it often.

Q. How many books do you have to sell to begin donating to the cat charities?

A. If we raise $7500, then every dollar of net proceeds from book sales will be divided three ways and donated.

Q. Is shipping included in all the perks?

A. Shipping is included for all perks where there's a physical product(s) to mail to you.

Q. How do I make a pledge or contribution?

A. If you would like to support ‘Kitty Karma’, there are two easy options;

Follow the cute kitty icons on the right hand side of the campaign page to the perk of your choice. Choose your perk, run your cursor over the delivery date and it will change to Get This Perk. Click on it and then Check Out.

OR

if you wish just to make a contribution without selecting a perk, Click ‘BACK IT’, the icon at the top of the campaign  page . It is located right next to the video. A blank box for the donation amount will appear. Fill in the amount you wish to donate and then Check Out.

Thank you for your support!!

Donation of 50 euros or US$60 made to Il Gattaro d'Aleppo.

Thanks to Paul Thompson for making this possible.

 

 

Our2-Day $200  Perk Challenge has ended. Thank you, Paul Thompson for rising to the challenge and for your generosity on so many fronts! Paul, as some of you may know, is an editorial contributor to the book and dad to the famous, lovable sailing Maine Coon, Skatty.  15% of this donation will go to Il Gattaro. Additionally, the Kitty Karma team has, in honour of our wonderful supporters, decided to donate a similar amount and we''ll send a total of $60 to Il Gattaro tomorrow. Watch this space for more news.

story:
Short Summary

I am Robert Filer the author of "The Adventures of Donna Sophia."  "The Adventures of Donna Sophia"  is currently in its fourth installment titled, "Doggy Spa Day" and is currently in its final stages prior to production.   Being a part of a multicultural family that is bilingual, finding material for children that are in bilingual families is very difficult.   Children's books provide a means by which learning is fun and interactive.

Reading out loud is an excellent way to learn and develop language skills.   To improve my own language skills in Spanish I would read to my nephews in Spanish.  To better understand what was being said, I would translate the book, and keep the sheet of paper next to me.   As I would read out loud, I could hear the proper pronunciation, see the translation, and piece the language together.  After several weeks of reading to my family, I was fluent in Spanish!  

When I had my first child, I wanted my child to learn both English and Spanish.  I looked everywhere for books, and found a very limited selection.  At the same time I had nephews that spoke only Spanish, and wanted to learn English.   It was from there the early ideas of "The Adventures of Donna Sophia" were created.  

Every dollar we receive helps us get the message out about the series.   The books are available worldwide, and we want to create an opportunity to learn for all people no matter where you are in the world, they have an opportunity to learn another language.   Learning a language from children's books is something that can be enjoyed by anyone, but makes is affordable to those who cannot pay hundreds or thousands on classes for language.   My me and my family it is is why we reach out to you today.  Help us reach the world, to reach those who want to learn English or Spanish, but just need the access to the simplest forms to learn and grow.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Any money raised will go to the basic startup costs associated with the book and events.  It covers the illustrations and costs associated with production.  The more money we raise the more we can do to get the message across.   Since there is not much available funding the costs go to the actual production, copyrights, and set up. 
  • Additional funds go to event planning and readings where we share the story with local schools, and children centers that specialize in lower income neighborhoods.  It allows us to put on events to places that usually cannot afford them.  
  • We offer all kinds of perks with our donations including:  signed books or toys, a proof from the book's production, shirts, and you can even get an opportunity to get a visit from Chief our mascot or special event.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • Please help us get the word out about our book in your community.  Share it on Facebook or Twitter, or refer us to your friends as the books and toys make great gifts for baby showers.
  • Tell your friends and family about us. 
  • Love to read to children, help us with reading events.   
  • Remember them to use the Indiegogo share tools!  Any help is appreciated.

story:
Hopeful Despair is about how to unearth one’s purpose through social impact work. Throughout the book, finding the hope in situations of despair is delved into through the retelling of stories of social impact workers coupled with the author’s own perspective and experiences. Hopeful Despair will be published in February, 2020 by New Degree Press.

Story of My Book

My name is Alyssa Skites and I am the author of Hopeful Despair. I wrote this book to discover what keeps various social impact workers motivated to continue their work despite the emotional drainage that often accompanies it.

The words of motivation by people fighting for all different types of causes are truly what makes this book worth reading. My goal was to transmit the humanistic side of the facts and figures displayed on the internet of the amount of people helped by specific nonprofit organizations or voluntary groups.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will become inspired by people who are doing great work, not necessarily because you have something meaningful to contribute to their cause, but because it does something to help you understand yours. I full-heartedly believe that the process of understanding the seriousness of the world can, in fact, transform your outlook to a more optimistic one. This book explores how acting upon your human agency will improve your own mental health, relationships, and overall happiness as you grow and find the warmth within yourself to make the world a little bit brighter.

In this book, you'll learn about the intersections of passion, commitment, advocacy, and creativity from individuals such as:

  • Chris Temple from Optimist https://optimist.co/
  • George Reginald Freeman from Pride Equality International http://prideequality.org/
  • Colin McElwee from Worldreader https://www.worldreader.org/

You will love this book if you are someone who has an extreme desire to improve the lives of others around you, no matter the capacity or reach.
 

The Book - Hopeful Despair

The book is broken into 22 chapters, touching upon some very heavy topics such as but not limited to:

  • Domestic violence: trauma it provokes and some resources for dealing with its repercussions
  • The severe lack of medical assistance for undocumented immigrants
  • Human trafficking events occurring all over the world
  • The lack of sanitary care for shelterless people: specific case of San Francisco

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Besides paying for the production and shipping costs of the books themselves, the money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in February, 2020
  • The Cover Design of my book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for my book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now (specific tiers have different perks) including:

  • Free shipping costs
  • A personally signed copy of my book when published
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering
  • Your name will appear in a special, acknowledgements section in the book (“with special thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of Hopeful Despair with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experiences of writing my book and how you can do the same
  • And more...

As you can see, by pre-ordering Hopeful Despair, you are not simply buying the book, you are contributing to my journey in a very intimate and transformative way.

 

About the Author

Alyssa Skites is an adventurer and knowledge-seeker by heart who was blessed to have already, in 21 short years, experienced a plethora of opportunities that have shown her the beauty of existing with an open heart and an open mind. Alyssa has lived, befriended and worked with people from the various places she has, at one point, called home including Washington, Wisconsin, Hong Kong, Sitges, Barcelona, and San Diego. Through these experiences, she now believes in not just the importance but the cruciality of intercultural relationships to expand one’s view and appreciation of the world.

Alyssa is admittedly passionate about more things than she can handle, leading her to sometimes be overwhelmed when trying to compartmentalize her priorities. When she does manage to find the time to relax, she loves going out with her friends, engaging in deep, philosophical or vulnerable conversations (this is relaxing to her, she promises!), as well as a nice morning soaking up the sun while reading anything written by her idol, Elizabeth Gilbert. In more recent years, Alyssa has begun to actively work on calming her racing thoughts by practicing mindfulness specifically through meditation and yoga.

Alyssa’s desire to help others was instilled in her from a young age through her parent’s belief in the importance of community service. However, it wasn’t until she moved to Barcelona, Spain that she gained a much more intimate knowledge of various social issues. From this, her desire morphed into something much more; it developed into an undeniable assurance that beneficiary work was what she was meant to do for the rest of her life. Through writing Hopeful Despair, this assurance has been nothing but strengthened.

For more information you can connect with Alyssa at alyssaskites@gmail.com and on Instagram (@alyssa_skites) and on Facebook (Alyssa Skites).

 

Risks & Challenges

Typically, the largest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to those who order it online. I have eliminated this risk by building both the mailing and the shipping costs of your signed copies within each of the pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone, including the final one of publication. You will be promptly notified when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you choose not to contribute in the ways outlined above, any of the following acts of support would be appreciated more than you know:

  1. You can share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #HopefulDespair and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify each effort.
  2. You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  3. If you have 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it, don’t hesitate to share it with them as well. This is easiest when done as a text message or direct message on social media. I would also be happy to personally connect with them if they would like any additional information!

Thank you so much for all of your love and support. This project would not be possible without contributions, no matter how large or how small.

With love and good fortune always,
Alyssa Skites
story_txt:
Hopeful Despair is about how to unearth one’s purpose through social impact work. Throughout the book, finding the hope in situations of despair is delved into through the retelling of stories of social impact workers coupled with the author’s own perspective and experiences. Hopeful Despair will be published in February, 2020 by New Degree Press.Story of My BookMy name is Alyssa Skites and I am the author of Hopeful Despair. I wrote this book to discover what keeps various social impact workers motivated to continue their work despite the emotional drainage that often accompanies it.The words of motivation by people fighting for all different types of causes are truly what makes this book worth reading. My goal was to transmit the humanistic side of the facts and figures displayed on the internet of the amount of people helped by specific nonprofit organizations or voluntary groups.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will become inspired by people who are doing great work, not necessarily because you have something meaningful to contribute to their cause, but because it does something to help you understand yours. I full-heartedly believe that the process of understanding the seriousness of the world can, in fact, transform your outlook to a more optimistic one. This book explores how acting upon your human agency will improve your own mental health, relationships, and overall happiness as you grow and find the warmth within yourself to make the world a little bit brighter.In this book, you'll learn about the intersections of passion, commitment, advocacy, and creativity from individuals such as:
Chris Temple from Optimist https://optimist.co/

George Reginald Freeman from Pride Equality International http://prideequality.org/

Colin McElwee from Worldreader https://www.worldreader.org/

You will love this book if you are someone who has an extreme desire to improve the lives of others around you, no matter the capacity or reach. The Book - Hopeful DespairThe book is broken into 22 chapters, touching upon some very heavy topics such as but not limited to:
Domestic violence: trauma it provokes and some resources for dealing with its repercussions
The severe lack of medical assistance for undocumented immigrants
Human trafficking events occurring all over the world
The lack of sanitary care for shelterless people: specific case of San Francisco
 What I Need & What You'll GetThis book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Besides paying for the production and shipping costs of the books themselves, the money raised will go towards the following:
The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in February, 2020
The Cover Design of my book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for my book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now (specific tiers have different perks) including:
Free shipping costs
A personally signed copy of my book when published
A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering
Your name will appear in a special, acknowledgements section in the book (“with special thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of Hopeful Despair with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experiences of writing my book and how you can do the same
And more...
As you can see, by pre-ordering Hopeful Despair, you are not simply buying the book, you are contributing to my journey in a very intimate and transformative way. About the AuthorAlyssa Skites is an adventurer and knowledge-seeker by heart who was blessed to have already, in 21 short years, experienced a plethora of opportunities that have shown her the beauty of existing with an open heart and an open mind. Alyssa has lived, befriended and worked with people from the various places she has, at one point, called home including Washington, Wisconsin, Hong Kong, Sitges, Barcelona, and San Diego. Through these experiences, she now believes in not just the importance but the cruciality of intercultural relationships to expand one’s view and appreciation of the world.Alyssa is admittedly passionate about more things than she can handle, leading her to sometimes be overwhelmed when trying to compartmentalize her priorities. When she does manage to find the time to relax, she loves going out with her friends, engaging in deep, philosophical or vulnerable conversations (this is relaxing to her, she promises!), as well as a nice morning soaking up the sun while reading anything written by her idol, Elizabeth Gilbert. In more recent years, Alyssa has begun to actively work on calming her racing thoughts by practicing mindfulness specifically through meditation and yoga.Alyssa’s desire to help others was instilled in her from a young age through her parent’s belief in the importance of community service. However, it wasn’t until she moved to Barcelona, Spain that she gained a much more intimate knowledge of various social issues. From this, her desire morphed into something much more; it developed into an undeniable assurance that beneficiary work was what she was meant to do for the rest of her life. Through writing Hopeful Despair, this assurance has been nothing but strengthened.For more information you can connect with Alyssa at alyssaskites@gmail.com and on Instagram (@alyssa_skites) and on Facebook (Alyssa Skites). Risks & ChallengesTypically, the largest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to those who order it online. I have eliminated this risk by building both the mailing and the shipping costs of your signed copies within each of the pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone, including the final one of publication. You will be promptly notified when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship. Other Ways You Can HelpIf you choose not to contribute in the ways outlined above, any of the following acts of support would be appreciated more than you know:
You can share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #HopefulDespair and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify each effort.
